item.title: Fan Blades (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The only way down seems to be through a hole in the floor with a slowly moving fan blade. It's not far, jumping would be fine.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

Upon close inspection, there are 3 fans space out over about 15 feet. They move synchronously and slowly. It would be quite easy to jump the 20 feet down and not get hit by the fans. However, about 5 feet down (near the first fan) there is a feather-fall like zone that only affect living creatures. Once the zone is entered, the fans speed up, and the character falls 5 feet per round as fans attack. On round 1, he is attacked by a single fan, on round 2, 2 fans, and on round 3 1 fan. Fan Attack (4d6 damage; DC 26 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets falling).

item.title: Avalanche Room (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Piles of boxes, papers and every kind of junk is piled floor to ceiling. There is barely a path through the clutter.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Any loud noise (such as a gunshot) or sudden vibration (such as stomping) or contact with one of the stacks will cause every stack in the room to collapse. Collapsing Stacks (2d6 damage; DC 18 Reflex for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in room); Effect (entire room is difficult terrain.

item.title: Negative Energy Wheel (CR *)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A valve wheel sits atop a small round portal in the middle of the floor.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the wheel is turned, it begins to channel negative energy in a 30' radius. For every quarter turn, increase the damage by 1d6 and the Will DC Save by 1 for half damage. So at a quarter turn, it is DC 11 Will save and 1d6 damage, at a half turn, DC 12 Will Save and 2d6 damage, etc. For higher CR's, up the amount of turns it takes to to open the door.

item.title: The Kitchen
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I was reading some recipes and looking at cooking gadgets. Many of these cooking gadgets, while unnecessary, would make a fine trap element, so let's use them. So, with no real connection other than they are used in a kitchen, the characters walk into a large room. As they progress, different kitchen-themed random death traps affect them, for no reason other than it's cool. The traps, in no particular order, are: The Slap Chop, The Garbage Disposal, The Oven, The Dishwasher, The Blender, The Waffle Iron and The Freezer.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Detecting the Traps

 

 

Very Hard Perception check.

same as PFRPG

The Slap Chop

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or take APL * 1d6 bleed damage, as blades at the end of a column slam down on individual members of the party for APL rounds.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take APL * d4 damage plus ongoing 5 bleed damage per tier. (save ends) Attacks for APL rounds.

The Garbage Disposal

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or take APL * 1d6 damage, plus be knocked prone. Each party member must escape the disposal with a Hard Climb check or take 1d6 damage per round while in disposal.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take APL * 1d6 damage, plus be knocked prone. While in disposal each party member takes ongoing 5 bleed damage (save ends) unless they escape with a Hard Acrobatics or Athletics check.

The Oven

 

 

Easy Fortitude Save that increases by 5 DC each round or take n points of fire damage, where n is the number of rounds in the heat.

Low Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude that increases by 5 each round or take n points of fire damage, where n is the number of rounds in the heat.

The Dishwasher

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or take APL * 1d4 acid damage each round, plus be knocked prone.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take ongoing 5 acid damage per tier. (save ends)

The Blender

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or take APL * 1d6 damage. Additionally, each party member that fails becomes entangled with the other party members. To escape the blender, an Escape Artist or grapple vs. CMD APL + 10 must succeed.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take APL * 1d6 damage. Additionally, each party member that is hit becomes dazed (save ends) and restrained (save ends)

The Waffle Iron

 

 

The hot ceiling collapses. Very Hard Reflex Save or take APL * d6 damage. Those that fail the save then take APL * d4 heat damage every round until they escape against a High CMD. (escape artist or grapple)

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take APL * 1d4 damage and become knocked prone, stunned (save ends), and immobilized (save ends), and also take ongoing 5 per tier fire damage until they move out of the iron.

The Freezer

 

 

Very Hard Fortitude Save or take 1d4 Con damage per round.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude or take 1d4 Con Damage per round.

item.title: Peeling Wallpaper (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wallpaper is peeling off the wall. It looks like something may be written on the wall beneath the paper.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the full text is revealed by peeling off the paper, it uncovers Explosive Runes. They go off as per the spell with a DC 17 Reflex Save. (CL 5 and +4 attribute bonus)

item.title: Wall of Nails (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stout set of wooden double doors leads to the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is opened, they fling open inwards forcefully on springs, slamming into the wall on each side of the door. The wall causes a shower of nails to fly out from the walls. Shower of Nails (3d6 Damage, DC 21 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 10' of the square on either side of the doors)

item.title: Constrictor Curtains (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Thick velvet curtains frame the bay window.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The curtains animate and grapple the nearest character. The curtains have a CMB of +13 and a CMD of 23. A character, when grappled, takes 2d6 constriction damage per round. They curtains can be destroyed with 50hp of damage. It also has DR 15/slashing. Damage absorbed by DR is inflicted to any character that is grappled.

item.title: Sovereign Glue Floor (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A balcony looks over to a floor a short drop below.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor is coated in sovereign glue. Anyone jumping on the floor must make a DC 21 Reflex save or take 1d3 damage, be knocked prone, and entangled until either his feet are freed. This means either hacking up the floor, using universal solvent, or removing his shoes.

item.title: Round Stone Doors
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I am thinking lots about wilderness traps. Therefore, this trap has little or nothing to do with that. The party comes across a large set of convex stone double doors with a slight gap in the middle. Trying to open the doors causes the doors to rotate rapidly, which throws the character into the next room. The opening of the hallway where the character is thrown has a taut, thick cloth, studded with barbed spikes. The character hits that, impales himself, then is flung back towards the doors, after becoming studded with busted spikes. The doors reverse direction and accelerate the character back through the party as the spikes cause a little more damage one last time.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Detecting the Trap

 

 

Very Hard Perception check.

same as PFRPG

Double Doors

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or take APL * 1d6 crushing damage and be thrown inwards into the room.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or APL * 1d6 crushing damage and be thrown inwards into the room.

Cloth of Spikes

 

 

Very High Bonus Attack vs. flat-footed AC or take APL * 1d4 bleed damage. APL * 1d4 spikes break off when thrown back.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take APL * 1d4 damage and ongoing 5 bleed damage. (save ends). APL * 1d4 spikes break off when thrown back.

Back Through the Doors

 

 

High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude or take APL * 1d6 damage. Additionally, take one extra point of bleed damage for each spike embedded in the character. Character lands 30' past the doors and is prone and dazed.

High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude or take APL * 1d6 damage. Lose a healing surge for each spike embedded in the character. Character lands 6 squares past the doors and is prone and dazed.

Through the Party

 

 

Hard Reflex Save for each party member on either side of a 30' line through the door or take 1d4 bleed damage.

High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or each party member within 1 square of a 6 square line of effect takes ongoing 5 bleed damage. (save ends)

item.title: Capillary Poison (CR 11)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The lock on the door seems very sturdy.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 38; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The tumblers on the lock all have tiny sacks of contact poison. When something comes into contact with the tumblers, like a key or lock pick, the poison quickly travels up the implement to make contact with the tool holder. Contact Poison (Tears of Death - 1 minute Onset, 1/minute for 6 minutes, 1d6 Con Damage and paralyzed for 1 minute, DC 22 Fortitude Save)

item.title: Web Pit (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor collapses beneath you, dropping you into a mess of sticky strands.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

This 10'x10'x10' pit is filled with a web, as per the Web spell cast at CL3. The character falls all the way down and takes 1d6 points of damage and then must interact with the web as per the spell.

item.title: One Way Pit (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There seems to be some gold at the bottom of the pit

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Covering the pit is a one-way wall of force. It allows passage into the pit, but blocks the exit.

item.title: Dart Knocker (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A huge door knocker, with a peephole in the middle, is set into the center of the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the knocker is used, a dart shoots out. Dart Attack (1d3 damage, +6 ranged melee)

item.title: Glue Splat Trap
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  Not sure where this one came from, but here it is. The party enters a large chamber with a huge stone back wall and a high ceiling. The stone wall has a small door in it. When the party approaches, one of the tiles is spring-loaded, and fires the character up, into an arc and into the wall. This knocks the wall down. The wall was sitting atop the floor, keeping it from tilting, so the floor tilts towards the entrance, dropping the characters into a pit. Furthermore, the wall was also supporting the ceiling, which collapses one round later, trapping the characters in the pit and crushing the original character on the wall.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Detecting the Trap

 

 

Very Hard Perception check.

same as PFRPG

Spring-Loaded Tile

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or take 1d6 points of damage and be hurled towards the wall, knocking the character prone and knocking the wall over.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take 1d6 points of damage and be pushed to the wall, knocking the character prone and knocking down the wall.

Tilting Floor

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or be dropped into 20' spiked pit. (2d6 + 3 damage)

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or be dropped into 20' spiked pit (2d6 damage + ongoing 5 bleed damage (save ends))

Crashing Ceiling (Pit)

 

 

Ceiling holds down tilting floor, sealing off the top of the pit. The ceiling must be destroyed or bored through. Treat ceiling as favorite hard wall substance.

same as PFRPG

Crashing Ceiling (Room)

 

 

Hard Fortitude Save or death. Successful save results in APL * d12 damage and character is pinned with an extremely hard DC to escape.

High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude or death. Miss results in APL * 8 damage plus ongoing 5 crushing damage (escape ends). Character is restrained (escape ends) and stunned (save ends). Escaping DC is extremely hard.

item.title: Illusionary Handholds (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A deep pit, filled with nasty spikes blocks the path. There is a thin strip of floor, next to a rough wall. You can probably cross by using the wall for support.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset Auto (persistent)

Effect

The strip of floor can be crossed with a DC 25 Acrobatics check, or DC 15 if the wall is used for support. About halfway across, the rough wall is an illusion. Characters crossing using the wall for support lose their balance. Illusionary Wall (2d6 + 3 damage from falling into pit, DC 18 Reflex negates)

item.title: Caustic Lock (CR 1/4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This lock appears sturdy, even though it is somewhat pitted.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The lock contains a small bladder of acid that will burst when the lock is picked. Acid Bladder (destroys lock pick, DC 18 Reflex Save negates)

item.title: Vulnerability Blanch
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The small vial can be applied to armor to temporarily give it DR.

Type: magical; Perception -; Disable Device -

Effect

This vial appears to give a specific DR, such as DR/magic, DR/cold iron, etc. Instead, it actually imparts vulnerability against that type of damage until X amount of damage is dealt. Hits by the vulnerable type of damage impart extra damage. For example, Vulnerability 5(100)/cold iron deals an extra 5 points of damage when hit with cold iron, until 100 total points have been dealt.

item.title: Rope Door Pull (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The old door in front of you, although simple, looks sturdy. A rope dangles from a small hole. It seems to be the way to open the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

When the rope is pulled, the door opens. However, the rope is soft and covers many sharp barbs. Rope Door Pull Attack (1d6 + 1 Dex Damage, DC 22 Reflex Save negates)

item.title: Sparkler Wand
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This is a fine looking wand

Type: magical; Perception -; Disable Device -

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

This appears to be a wand of lightning bolt. However, when used, it actually calls forth a chain lightning spell at CL 11, that strikes the caster and then arcs to up to 10 more nearby targets, both allies and foes.

item.title: Independence Day Picnic
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  It's the 4th of July. That means fireworks and BBQ. I can provide the pyrotechnics, the characters provide the meat. The party enters a room, filled with webs. As they walk through the room, the first things that happens is several long spikes fire out from the walls, skewering various party members, and setting the webs aflame. One the characters are skewered, the spikes slowly turn as the floor underneath them ignites. Shortly thereafter, the burning floor collapses into a pit filled with powder and all sorts of colorful explosives.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Detecting the Trap

 

 

Very Hard Perception check.

same as PFRPG

Webs

 

 

Treat the webs as if CL = APL.

As the 5th level Wizard Daily Power.

Skewers

 

 

Very High Bonus Attack vs. AC or take APL * d6 damage and become pinned. Skewers have High CMD for escaping.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. AC or take APL * d6 damage. Very hard Escape Artist or Athletics check to escape.

Roasting

 

 

Each character on skewer takes APL fire damage each round.

Same as PFRPG.

Fireworks

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save for each party member in room or take APL * d12 damage and become blinded for APL rounds. On a successful save, take half damage and not blinded.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or each party member in room takes APL * d12 damage and becomes blinded and deafened (save ends both). On miss, take half damage.

item.title: Grated Floor (CR 12)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor of this room is made up of metal grates.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 33; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The ceiling collapses onto a character, squeezing the character through the grate. Ceiling Attack (15d6 damage, DC 27 Reflex negates)

item.title: Geas Shackles (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wallpaper is peeling off the wall. It looks like something may be written on the wall beneath the paper.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

These shackles, when applied causes the subject to have a geas cast on him that forces him to make restitution for the crime which he has been accused. If the subject is actually innocent, no geas is cast. As such, these are used by law enforcement at times to determine guilt/innocence.

item.title: Mirrored Floor (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor of this room is a large mirror. The spiked ceiling reflects perfectly on its surface.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

In the middle of the room, a section of the mirror is missing, revealing a spiked pit. The mirror is so perfect though, that this can be easily overlooked. Spiked Pit (1d6 + 3 damage, DC 18 Reflex Save negates)

item.title: Rack Doors (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Large, wooden double doors lead to the next room. Each door has a solid iron ring pull.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the rings are pulled together (the door will not open otherwise) they become shackled and constrict around the character's wrists. The doors then open up wide, stretching out the character. (6d6 damage plus 1d6 bleed damage per round until magical healing is applied, DC 24 Reflex Save negates, DC 24 Strength or Escape Artist check required to escape)

item.title: Backdraft (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A slight, cool breeze blows towards you from the other end of the corridor

Type: magical; Perception DC 33; Disable Device 33

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the trap is triggered, it will deal blow down the hall for 60 feet, dealing 3d6 points of damage. (DC 22 Reflex negates). Additionally, any arrows, spells or other weapons that can be physically affected are blown back at the characters, possibly striking the characters. The spells and missiles can also set off the trap.

item.title: Annoying Door (CR 1/4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A nice wooden door grants access to the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The bottom 8 inches of the door does not open when the door is opened, it must be opened separately. Door Trip (DC 18 Reflex save or be knocked prone)

item.title: Ringed Ceiling
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  We did ring pushups today. This inspired this trap. The characters enter a large room or cavern. The floor is covered in a pool of deep acid. Within easy reach, the ceiling is covered with dozens of rings. They are placed such that they can be used to traverse the room. However, 1 out of every 4 rings is trapped. Roll on the table below to see which trap it is. The perception check to detect the trap is easy. However, there should be so many of them that it will be difficult to see them all.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Detecting a Trapped Ring

 

 

Easy Perception check.

same as PFRPG

(1) Loose Ring

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or fall into acid, taking 1d10 acid damage each round. Ring also falls from ceiling.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or fall into acid, taking ongoing 10 acid damage until out of pool. Ring also falls from ceiling.

(2) Glue Ring

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or become stuck on ring. Escaping requires a Hard Escape Artist or Strength check. If strength is used, then make a Hard Reflex save or fall into acid as above.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or become stuck on ring. Escaping requires a Hard Escape Artist or Strength check. If strength is used, then make a High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or fall into acid as above.

(3) Greased Ring

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or fall into acid, taking 1d10 acid damage each round.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or fall into acid, taking ongoing 10 acid damage until out of pool.

(4) Sharp Ring

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or fall into acid, taking 1d10 acid damage each round. Also take 1d6 bleed damage from ring.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or fall into acid, taking ongoing 10 acid damage until out of pool. Also take ongoing 5 bleed damage from ring. (save ends)

(5) Exploding Ring

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or fall into acid, taking 1d10 acid damage each round. Also characters within 30' of ring must make a Hard Reflex Save or take APL * 6 damage and fall into acid.

High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or each party member within 1 square of a 6 square line of effect takes ongoing 5 bleed damage. (save ends)

(6) Gas Filled Ring

 

 

Hard Fortitude Save or be knocked unconscious for 1d4 rounds, falling into acid. Character takes 1d10 damage per round in acid.

High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude or be knocked unconscious (save ends) and fall into pool. Character takes ongoing 10 damage in pool.

(7) Teleporting Ring

 

 

Character is teleported to a random ring in the room (which may be trapped). Moderate Reflex Save or fall into pool, taking 10 damage per round.

Character is teleported to a random ring in the room (which may be trapped). Moderate Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or fall into pool, taking ongoing 10 damage.

(8) Poison Ring

 

 

Hard Fortitude Save or take 1d3 Dex Damage.

High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude or take 1d3 Dex Damage.

item.title: Anti-Toxin Bubbles (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Bubbles float up to the ceiling from under the grated floor

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The bubbles float up to the ceiling and pop, releasing a small amount of gas which barely neutralizes the poison gas in this room. Should the bubbles be disturbed, there will not be enough anti-toxin in the air and the poison gas will become toxic. Bubbles (DC 19 Acrobatics check or bubble becomes popped, setting off trap); Poison Gas (DC 17 Fortitude save or take 1d3 Dex damage and become sickened for 1d3 days)

item.title: Sandpaper Doorknob (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door has a gleaming silver doorknob

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The doorknob is hidden by an illusion. The actual doorknob is very gritty, like coarse sandpaper and is rotating at a high velocity. If the illusion is not penetrated, the character and/or his tools get "sanded". Sandpaper Attack (1d6 bleed damage or tool is broken, DC 18 Reflex Save negates)

item.title: Tilting, Sticky Floor (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor in this room is kind of sticky.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor towards the middle gets really sticky, sticky enough to immobilize the character. When this happens, a 10' section of floor tilts 90 degrees, causing the character to face-plant, and then fall into the pit. Sticky Floor (DC 18 Reflex Save or character falls into the floor and is immobilized, 1 round later the sticky part of the floor tears away and the character falls into the pit. On a successful save, character maintains standing, but must make a second DC 18 Reflex save to escape the tilted floor to avoid falling into the pit when the floor tears away); Pit (3d6 +3 damage); multiple targets (all targets on 10' square section of floor)

item.title: Spo' Boy (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An old, rotting sandwich sits on top of a golden plate.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The sandwich is rotting and if disturbed, releases a cloud of spores. Spore Attack (1 Con Damage per round for 6 rounds, DC 13 Fortitude save cures). The plate is worth 75gp.

item.title: Ballroom
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I have been working out with medicine balls, working on balance and stuff. Let's see how that works in-game. The characters enter a large room. The entire floor is covered in spheres, all of the same size and color. The floor itself is electrified. However, the balls provide insulation. However, the balls are hard to balance on, and if upset, the balls can have random (bad) effects.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Electric Floor

 

 

Moderate Acrobatics check or character falls on floor, taking APL * d6 damage per round. Also sphere is "disturbed"

same as PFRPG

Fire Sphere

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or take APL * d6 fire damage.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take APL * d6 fire damage.

Sonic Sphere

 

 

Very Hard Fortitude Save or take APL * d6 sonic damage, plus become deafened for 1d6 rounds. An additional 1d6 nearby spheres are "disturbed"

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude or take APL * d6 damage and become deafened. (save ends). An additional 1d6 nearby spheres are "disturbed".

Gas Sphere

 

 

Hard Fortitude Save or fall prone and become unconscious for 1d4 rounds. Character takes damage from floor while unconscious.

High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude or be knocked prone and become unconscious. (save ends). Character takes damage on floor while unconscious.

Exploding Sphere

 

 

Hard Reflex Save for each party member within 20' of sphere takes APL * d6 damage and falls prone, taking floor damage. Each character that falls prone "disturbs" one nearby sphere.

High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or each party member within 4 squares takes APL * d6 damage and falls prone, taking floor damage. Each prone character "disturbs" one nearby sphere.

item.title: Mossy Landing (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There is a small drop-off in the floor here of a few feet. The lower floor is covered in green moss.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the moss is dropped on, it causes small clouds of spores to be released. Spore Cloud (1 Con Damage, 1/6 rounds, DC 13 Fortitude Save cures); multiple targets (all targets within 20' radius)

item.title: Absorbing Doorknob (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorknob seems to have been polished recently and is locked.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When an object touches the doorknob, such as a key or lock picks, they are absorbed into the doorknob. Absorbing Doorknob (absorbs object, DC 15 Fortitude Save negates)

item.title: Bungling Pie (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There seems to be something just around the corner...

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the character turns the corner, he is hit in the face with a pie and is affected by the bungle spell. (DC 12 Will Negates)

item.title: Disgusting Doorknob (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorknob is decorated with several small gargoyles.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the doorknob is touched, it casts curse of disgust on the target, with the trigger being doorknobs. (DC 18 Will Save negates)

item.title: Delusional Mirror (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A mirror, framed in a gold frame, hangs on the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger sight; Reset Auto

Effect

item.title: Sticky
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  Somebody mentioned marshmallows. Marshmallows can get sticky. Marshmallows burn. All good. The characters walk into a room and get doused by a sticky substance. The substance itches, is annoying and hampers movement somewhat. However, shortly afterwards, the characters get hit by flame, and as it turns out, the sticky substance burns nicely. There is a pool of water near the end of the room. It also turns out that the sticky substance reacts violently with water.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Sticky Coating

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or become coated. Coated characters receive the "shaken" condition. Removing the substance requires either Universal Solvent, or removing all armor and clothing and having it repaired from the "broken" condition, even though the armor and clothing is not considered broken.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or become coated. Coated characters receive the slowed and weakened conditions until coating is removed. Removing requires that characters remove all clothing and armor, and pay half the cost to "repair" the armor/clothing. It takes 1 hour per AC bonus to clean the armor.

Flame

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or be set on fire, taking APL * d6 damage for 5d4 rounds. When the fire is out, the substance is removed.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take APL * d6 damage for 5d4 rounds. When the fire is out, the substance is removed.

Pool

 

 

Very Hard Reflex Save or all characters within 30' take APL * d6 damage and become stunned for 1d4 rounds. This does not put out the fire. There is a 25% chance that anyone coated in the substance hit by the blast will also explode as above.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or take APL * d6 damage and become stunned (save ends). This does not put out the fire. Each character coated in the substance and hit by the blast must make a save or explode.

Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I ca never remember the effects of the various conditions. This trap should either solve that or make it worse. A hallway is set up as follows. Shortly in, a tripwire knocks the characters prone as it cuts them for bleed damage. It also causes a bag of rotting organs to fall and splash in front of them, nauseating them, and spreading spores which fatigue the party. Shortly afterwards, the organs move, panicking the characters for one round, where they turn and run into a beam that dropped behind them, which staggers the characters. Afterwards, they are shaken for 1d6 rounds.

Very Hard Perception check.

same as PFRPG

item.title: Cement Tumbler Corridor
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  Almost everyday I see a truck from Central Concrete driving down the street. The characters enter a cylindrical corridor, sloped downward. The floor contains gravel and sand. As the characters make their way down the corridor, it starts to first slowly fill up with water, which happens to be filled with nastiness. Soon after, the corridor begins to rotate, sending water, sand, gravel and characters flying. Slowly, the heat begins to build up, and the sand and gravel form a concrete-like substance, trapping the characters.

same as PFRPG

item.title: Time Delay Room
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I was watching various Sci-Fi, and time is always an issue. The characters enter a large room. Everywhere in the room are strange effects hanging in the air. Small golden beads, balls of force, etc. Time has been stopped in this room in the midst of a great spell battle. The spells cast still hang in the air. The characters must navigate their way to the other side of the room, without disturbing the time flow. If they do, they will activate one of the spells, which, may in turn, activate another. Have the characters make perception checks to notice spell zones, and Acrobatics checks to avoid setting them off. They should do this every 10'. There are several spells in air. All spells are at CL7, with a DC of 17. When a spell is set off, area effect spells have an n% chance of setting off another zone, where n is the radius or range of the spell in feet. Non area effect spells will target the triggerer. Roll a d8 to randomly determine the spell from below. Magic Missile Fireball Flaming Sphere Scorching Ray Lightning Bolt Ice Storm Shout Fear

Interaction

item.title: Treasure Cap
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded: Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I was thinking of some of the traps from Grimtooth's which were simple and straightforward, but obviously absurd. So we have this... The characters walk into a room with a large, single-piece stone floor. It also happens to be absolutely covered in all kinds of treasure - coins, jewels, armor, weapons, etc. However, there is volcanic pressure pushing on the floor below. The treasure was set on the floor as an "offering" that also happens to have enough weight to hold it down. Should the characters remove too much treasure, it will explode in a massive volcanic eruption, atomizing everything in a 1000' radius. It's up to the GM to determine exactly how much treasure is "too much".

item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I've been doing barrels all week. So why should today be any different? The entire floor of the room contains barrels. The floor is lower than the door, so the tops of the barrels are at normal floor height. Each barrel is sealed and filled with oil. However, several of the tops are weakened to the point where anyone stepping on one will fall through. As the characters walk through the room, several nasty looking, spiked barrels roll out from hidden compartments in the walls towards the characters. When they hit a character of the far wall, they burst into flame. Any opened barrels will also catch fire, and if there's enough, the whole room will go up.

item.title: Clock Room
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  The version of ntp that we're using in our client is old and outdated, so I need to update it. However, we rely on some very specific behavior, so I have to modify the new client to deal with it. This got me to thinking about time(). The characters enter a room filled with clocks on the wall. Each is clicking away loudly, and each has a different time. The relative time difference between the clocks adversely affects the passage of time in the room. There are 41 + d20 clocks in the room, all showing a slightly different time. Depending on the overall time difference, time will either pass more swiftly (more clocks are fast than slow) or more slowly (more clocks are set slow than fast).  Here's the kicker - Once everyone is inside the room, the doors shut and lock, and can only be opened when time is "normalized". Each round spent in the room results in 1 point of damage to each character in the room. (adjust up or down to change the difficulty). Feel free to say "tick tock" every time you deal the damage. When determining clock status, set 1 clock to the correct time and 20 fast and 20 slow. The other d20 clocks are either fast or slow (50/50 chance). For every 3 clocks out of whack (i.e. 32 clocks fast and 28 clocks slow) time passage changes by one increment. Free actions become swift, swift become move, move become standard, standard becomes full round, and full round actions take 1 round more. If time is 6 clocks out of whack, a full round would take 3 rounds, a standard action would take 2 rounds, a move would be a full round, a swift would be a standard, and a free would become a move. Should perception check fail to locate the correct clock, let them think they succeeded, and have them set the clock accordingly, adding one more to the pool of skewed clocks. For fun, add a small imp that runs around the room, resetting clocks.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Detecting whether time is running faster or slower

 

 

Moderate Int check (swift)

Same as PFRPG (quick)

Locating a fast or slow clock

 

 

Moderate Perception check (move equivalent)

Same as PFRPG

Setting clock correctly

 

 

Hard Perception check and Moderate Int check (standard action)

Same as PFRPG

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I think with my group we'd have to use the Double Bastard option...
Ok, this is pretty cool.... But I think it needs rules to cover moving multiple people. Also does the map go with the person or stay where it was?

The rules for multiple people are implicit. If multiple people touch the map, they all get teleported to wherever they were touching. The map stays, unless you are a bastard GM. In that case, the map goes with the character. If you are a double bastard, the map goes up in flames.
Nice!

item.title: Chandelier of Spell Reflection (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several crystals dangle from a low hanging chandelier.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger proximity; Reset None

Effect

1d4 + 1 crystals hang from a chandelier. When a spell is cast, the caster must make a spell penetration check vs. SR 22 or the spell is reflected back on the caster. Each such spell reflected destroys a crystal. The crystals, if removed, still function. The crystals also function indiscriminately, the first spell that is activated within 100' of it will be affected.

item.title: Doom Candles (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several black candles, set in black candlesticks are alight in the center of the room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

While the candles are burning, everyone within 110 ft of the candles must make a DC 11 Will save or become shaken for 1 minute.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Those are some Spoooooooky candles!

item.title: Fireball Candles (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Three red candles are hanging from the wall, unlit.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If any fire based spell is cast in the room, the caster must make a SR 19 penetration check. If it fails, the candles absorb the spell and become lit. The next round, they explode in a fireball centered on the candles. Fireball (3d6 damage, DC 14 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 20')

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Are the candles consumed by the fireball or do they persist in some fashion?
They are consumed, or rendered inactive. The "Reset" field of the trap says "none" which means that once set off, it can't be reset.
Ooooh These little bitties are nasty!!

item.title: Metamagic Floor (CR 1+APL)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wooden floor has been polished to such an extent as to be almost mirror-like.

Type: magical; Perception DC 25+APL; Disable Device 25+APL

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor has been enchanted such that the first damage-dealing offensive spell cast in the room will have its area of effect tripled.

item.title: Not Proficient Mosaic
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I have no idea what inspired me for this trap... Just wanted something with a simple puzzle element and a little different. The players walk into a large room. On the back wall is a mosaic, depicting what looks to be an adventuring party. There is a ranger, a cleric, a wizard, a rogue, and a fighter. However, upon closer examination, the mosaic figures each have the wrong weapon. The fighter is holding a dagger, the cleric the sword, the wizard a bow, the rogue a wand,and the ranger a mace. Once in the room, the door locks. Each round, the mosaic figures will attack the party until the correct implement is placed in their hand. In order to do this, certain skill checks, as below must be made. Once a character has the correct implement in hand, attacks cease from that character. Once all characters have implements in hand, the doors open. When an implement is replaced, the old implement stays with the current mosaic character until the proper checks are made to move it.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Ranger

 

 
 Detecting and moving implement

Hard Perception check to detect that mace is moveable. Hard Will save to remove mace and place it on cleric.

Hard Perception check to detect that mace is moveable. High bonus attack vs. Will or unable to move mace and place it on cleric.
 Attack

2 characters in room get shot by an arrow - High bonus attack vs. AC for APL/2 * 8 damage.

same as PFRPG

Cleric

 

 
 Detecting and moving implement

Hard Perception check to detect that sword is movable. Hard Fortitude save to move sword and place on fighter.

Hard Perception check to detect that sword is movable. High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude to move sword and place on fighter.
 Attack

Channel - Hard Will Save or all characters in room take APL * 6 damage.

High Attack bonus vs. Will or all characters take APL * 6 damage.

Wizard

 

 
 Detecting and moving implement

Hard Perception check to detect that bow is movable. Hard Reflex save to move bow to ranger.

Hard Perception check to detect that bow is movable. High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex to move bow to ranger.
 Attack

Magic Missle - Each round APL +1 magic missiles are fired. Each individual missile will strike a random character for 1d4 + 1 damage. A character can be struck multiple times.

same as PFRPG

Rogue

 

 
 Detecting and moving implement

Hard Perception check to detect that wand is movable. Hard Arcana check to move wand to wizard.

same as PFRPG
 Attack

Sneak Attack - Random character is attacked, High Bonus Attack vs. AC or character takes (1d4 + APL + (APL * 6)) damage and is staggered for one round.

Sneak Attack - Random character is attacked, High Bonus Attack vs. AC or character takes (1d4 + APL + (APL * 6)) damage and is dazed. (save ends)

Fighter

 

 
 Detecting and moving implement

Hard Perception check to detect that dagger is movable. Hard Reflex save to move the dagger to the rogue.

Hard Perception check to detect that dagger is movable. High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex to move the dagger to the rogue.
 Attack

Cleave - Attack one random character in room with a high bonus attack vs. AC for APL * 8 damage. If it hits, attack another random character. Repeat until it misses or all characters have been attacked.

same as PFRPG

item.title: Lake of Lanterns (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several lit lanterns float gracefully on a serene underground pool.

Type: mechanicall; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 31

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The air in this cavern up towards the ceiling is flammable, as is the lake itself. Disturbing the lake water in any way (including a failed disable check) can cause the lake and air to ignite. Ignition (DC 22 Reflex Save when touching water or set off a fireball); Fireball (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 10d6 damage, half damage on successful save); multiple targets (all targets in cavern)

item.title: Sheathed Door Handle (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The pull on this door is long and thin.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The door pull is actually a sheathed, very sharp knife. Knife Attack (DC 16 Reflex Save or take 1d3 damage and 1d3 Dex Damage)

item.title: Boil Doorknob (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorknob looks a little uneven

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the doorknob is touched or squeezed, it bursts, spraying white ooze everywhere. Ooze (DC 14 Fortitude Save or be infected with the Shakes, see CRB for onset details); multiple targets (all targets within 15')

item.title: Blindfold Room (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Wallpaper hangs from the walls in tattered strips.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Once in the room, strips of tattered wallpaper fly off the walls and attach to the faces of the characters. Wallpaper Attack (DC 18 Reflex Save or become blinded, It takes a full round action to remove the wallpaper); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Pull Out the Carpet (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door ahead appears to be somehow mechanically opened by a knob in the center, and has a plush carpet set down in front of the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door by rotating the knob, it swings inward with force. The door is attached to the carpet, pulling the carpet out from underneath the character. Pull out the Carpet (DC 16 Reflex save or character is knocked prone)

item.title: Recessed Lever (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It looks like there is no way to open the door till your rogue discovers the outline of a hidden panel in the wall next to the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

There is a lever inside the panel. If it is pulled, the door opens. However, the compartment slides shut with considerable force. Panel Attack (DC 21 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage plus 1 bleed damage, and also take 1d3 Dex damage)

item.title: Glue Ladder (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A ladder leads up into a hole into the ceiling.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The ladder is coated about halfway up with an extremely adhesive substance, which also happens to by quite flammable. When a character reaches the area, he gets stuck, and 1 round later, the ladder catches fire. Glue (DC 18 Strength or Escape Artist check as a full round action or become entangled and immobilized); Fire (2d6 damage per round for 1d6 + 1 rounds to anyone on upper ladder)

item.title: Ring Pull Plug (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door has a single, brass pull in the middle.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

If the ring is pulled with a DC 15 Strength check, it comes out of the door. Once it comes out of the door, the air in the current area is evacuated. In 1d6 rounds, everyone on this side of the door begins to suffocate. In order to break down the door, it requires a DC 25 Strength, Dungeoneering or Engineering check.

item.title: Bullseye Flame Jets
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I was looking for something a little different and real time... The characters enter a room. On the far side is a chasm about 100 feet across. A target has been placed on the far wall. It has 3 rings and a bullseye. Once they are all in the room, several jets of flame shoot out from the walls, engulfing the entire room. The characters will have to shoot the target to turn off flame jets. The rings are labelled 1, 2, 3 and 5. Each time one of the rings is hit, it turns off that many number of jets.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Target

 

 
 Detecting that the target and jets are connected

Moderate Perception check.

same as PFRPG
 Flame Jet Damage

Each jet does 1d4 damage per round to everyone in the room. There are APL * (number of characters) jets in the room.

same as PFRPG
Target AC

4 x (target value) + APL

same as PFRPG

item.title: Mirror of Envy (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A polished silver mirror covers almost and entire wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger visual; Reset Permanent

Effect

When a character looks into the mirror, he sees an image of himself carrying a valuable item from a nearby ally. The character must make a DC 16 Will save or be affected as the Envious Urge spell - they will try to steal the item. Each round, as long as they aren't looking at the mirror, they get a new Will save to end the effect.

item.title: Disgusting Door (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door has eyes and tentacles carved into it. They seem to almost be alive.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is touched, the character is affected by a curse of disgust spell with the trigger being doors. Unless the character makes a DC 17 Will save, whenever he is within 30 ft of the door he gains the sickened condition and has a urge to leave. A DC 17 Will save negates the urge, but the sickened condition persists. The condition remains until the curse is removed.

item.title: Spinning Floor (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The players enter a circular room with a one piece floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

One the characters are in the room, the floor begins to spin rapidly as the walls spin in the opposite direction. The wall is very rough. The characters are thrown against the wall. Wall Attack (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Illusionary Oasis
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Here is another installment of exTRAPaganza, our Thursday over-the-top trap series.  I just spent a week in the desert... The players enter a large, dry, hot cave. As they begin making their way down the cave, the entrance collapses, so they have no choice but to move on. The cave gets hotter and drier; hot enough to affect them. As they make their way further, they come upon what seems to be a cool oasis. The air here is cooler and there is even a pool of water. The air and pool are illusions. If they decide to stay at the oasis, the air will eventually cook them. The pool is even worse. It is actually molten copper, but will remain seemingly like water until either the character ingests it or is immersed in it.

Interaction

 PFRPG:

D&D 4e:

Air

 

 
Effect

Moderate Survival Check each round or take APL points of fire damage.

Moderate Endurance Check each round or take ongoing 5 per tier fire damage.

Oasis

 

 
Detecting Illusion

Very Hard Will Save. Detect magic will also show strong illusion magic.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Will or character will not detect illusion. Also, any type of detect magic spell or ritual will show it.
Effect

Hard Survival Check each round or take APL * d6 fire damage.

Hard Endurance Check each round or take ongoing 10 per tier fire damage.

Pool

 

 
Detecting Illusion

Very Hard Will Save. Detect magic will also show strong illusion magic.

Very High Bonus Attack vs. Will or character will not detect illusion. Also, any type of detect magic spell or ritual will show it.
Effect

Immersion - Very Hard Reflex Save or take APL * d10 fire damage per round. Leaving pool takes 1 full round, and then the character continues to take APL damage for 1d4 rounds.

Ingestion - Very Hard Fortitude Save or character dies. If saves, still takes APL * d10 fire damage and 4d6 Fortitude damage.

Immersion - Very High Bonus Attack vs. Reflex or character takes ongoing 30 per tier fire damage. Once out of pool (full round action) the ongoing effect can be ended with a save.

Ingestion - Very High Bonus Attack vs. Fortitude or character dies. On a miss, character takes ongoing 30 per tier fire damage (save ends) and ongoing 1d6 Fortutude Damage (save ends)

item.title: Volcanic Chest (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A sturdy, locked iron chest is chained to the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The chest covers a volcanic vent. When unlocked and unchained, lava spews forth. Lava Attack (6d6 fire damage, DC 24 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Tarnished Doorknob (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The brass doorknob looks to be tarnished and weathered.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When touched, the character's hands and persona are tarnished. Tarnish (DC 14 Will save or become tarnished, -4 to Charisma for 1 day)

item.title: Toppling Staircase (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A narrow staircase heads straight up.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The staircase is unsupported. When a character gets near the top, the entire staircase tips over, tossing everyone off of the stairs. Toppling Staircase (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 2d6 points of damage and be knocked prone); multiple targets (all targets on stairs)

item.title: Sandpaper Slide (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor slopes downward at a steep angle.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Farther on down the corridor, the floor and walls take on a sandpaper texture. About halfway down, the corridor will suddenly lurch and tilt to a very steep angle. Sandpaper slide (DC 19 Reflex Save each round or take 1d3 bleed damage, be knocked prone and slide 10 feet for up to 4 rounds); multiple targets (all targets in corridor)

item.title: Pin Floor (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor below appears to be an irregularly shaped metal surface

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The floor is actually made up of thousands of small, sharp pins. Each pin recesses to a different depth, but takes significant pressure (such as that of a character) to move. If the floor is jumped down on, the character is likely to get skewered, while if it is gently set upon, the character is still likely to get skewered, just more slowly. Skewer Attack (DC 22 Reflex Save or fall prone; secondary attack) Secondary Attack (+10 + <number of feet above surface before landing) vs. AC or take 1d20 damage, or 1d100 if Reflex Save Failed)

item.title: Obvious Spiked Pit (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A 10'x10'x10' spiked pit blocks the hallway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The "spikes" in the pit release gas once someone crosses to the other side of the pit without disabling them. Pit Gas Attack (DC 17 Fortutude Save or take 1d6 Con damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30' of pi)

item.title: Decap Door (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stout wooden door is at the end of the hallway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is opened, an extremely thin blade rotates out at neck height. Neck Blade (+16 vs. AC, 4d6+12 damage, crit 19-20, on critical subject must save vs. DC 21 Fortitude or be decapitated and killed)

item.title: Glue Tiles (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is made from large ceramic tiles.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Several tiles have been coated with a substance like sovereign glue. Once stepped on the tiles adhere to the character's feet, soaking through the shoes and adhering to the flesh. Only universal solvent can remove the tiles. Glue Tiles (DC 22 Reflex Save or be stuck to the tiles. When tiles are stuck, character gets a -10 to Stealth and a -6 to any Dex based skill or save)

item.title: Rotted Door Bar (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is barred with a large wooden bar from this side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The center of the bar is a sharp, metal pole. The wood is rotted. If the bar is lifted off, it falls apart, cutting the character. Rotted bar (DC 17 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage, plus poison); Poison (DC 14 Fortitude Save or take 1 Dex Damage, 1/round for 6 rounds, 1 save cures)

item.title: Gravel Floor (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor in this room is covered in gravel, with a small burning brazier in the corner.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

There is a simmering heat source in one corner of the room. As the characters cross the room, the floor heats up. Heated Gravel (nd4 damage per round, where n is the number of consecutive rounds spent in room, DC 18 Fortitude Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets on gravel)

item.title: Bomb Doorknob (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There is an iron pull ring in the middle of the wooden door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the rung is pulled, it arms a bomb behind the door, which explodes in 1 round. The door is also locked (DC 30 Disable Device to open). Door Bomb (6d6 damage plus 1d6 bleed damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30' of door)

item.title: Target Dummies (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several target dummies, each armed with a crossbow, are along the back wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

There are six dummies. When triggered, each one fires a crossbow bolt at a random target. Crossbow (+8 ranged melee vs. AC, 1d8 damage)

item.title: Book of Diseases (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The title of this worn, leather bound book simply says, "Common Diseases of Golarion".

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger visual; Reset Auto

Effect

The book describes several diseases in detail. All diseases from sourcebooks are covered. When someone reads about a disease, they must make a DC 16 Fortitude save or become exposed to the disease.

item.title: Magnetized Pool (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pool of deep water lies between you and the other side of the cavern.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 33

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

Towards the middle of the pool there is a strong magnetic field that will pull characters wearing metal down into the water. While underwater, use drowning rules. Magnetic (DC 22 Swim check each round or be pulled straight down 5 feet. If the check succeeds, that character either makes a normal swim move distance, or may rise 5 feet)

item.title: Interior Doorknob (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It looks like the doorknob has a simple, push to lock button on this side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

There is a small needle in the knob. When the button is pushed, the needle jabs the character. Needle Attack (DC 14 Fortitude Save or take 1d3 Con Damage)

item.title: Gas Torch (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A metal torch, burning bright, is set into the wall, lighting the entire room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The torch is fed by high pressure gas. If it is removed, gas will quickly fill the room. Any open flame, including the torch, will ignite the gas. Gas Explosion (6d6 fire damage or DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Trampoline Tile (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The tiles in this narrow hallway are wide and even.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

One of the tiles in the hallway acts like a trampoline. When it is stepped upon, it flings the character up and into the ceiling. Trampoline Tile (DC 16 Reflex Save or be flung into ceiling, 1d6 damage and knocked prone)

item.title: Jack-o-Lantern (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A huge pumpkin, carved to have the face of a ghoul and lit up by an unknown light source seems to mock you as you enter the room.

XP 6,400; CE haunt (30 ft. by 30 ft. room)

Caster Level 9th; Notice Perception DC 30 (to see a translucent spirit exit the jack-o-lantern); HP 18

Trigger proximity; Reset 1 day

Effect

When this haunt is triggered, a nearly invisible, translucent spirit exits the jack-o-lantern and attempts to occupy the highest level character (as per magic jar spell at DC 18). Other characters will only notice the possession with a successful Sense Motive check opposed by a +14 Bluff check.

Destruction

The soul from the jack-o-lantern can only be put to rest by having it's host body slain out of range of the jack-o-lantern. (190 feet)

item.title: Invisible Rakes (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The courtyard, although empty, appears to be well groomed and the grass is nice and green.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

There are several invisible rakes lying on the ground. Each time a character moves 5', there is a 50% chance that he will step on an invisible rake. Invisible Rake (DC 16 Reflex Save or take 1d3 damage)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cW69WHTnkVo&t=1m57s

This is a lot like that scene from the Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy!
:)

item.title: Shoe Tying Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door, while not locked, seems to require a few seconds of fiddling with the doorknob to open it.

Type: magical; Perception DC 25; Disable Device 25

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character opens the door, his shoelaces become tied together, causing him to trip when he tries to move through the doorway. It is a standard action to untie the shoelaces. Tied shoelaces (DC 16 Reflex save or be knocked prone. While tied, movement is halved and the character gets no Dexterity bonus)

item.title: Static Floor Mat (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An iron door is recessed into the wall. A small, wooly floor mat is in front of it.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The floor mat imparts a static charge to the character that steps on it. This charge is discharged when he touches the metal door. The charge will dissipate in 1d6 rounds if not discharged on a another character or metal surface. Static Charge (3d6 electrical damage, DC 21 Fortitude Save for half damage); multiple targets (if discharged by touching another character, both take the damage)

item.title: Loose Brick (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There is an obviously loose brick in the wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

There is a single, loose brick in the wall. It takes a bit of strength (DC 20 Strength check) to loose it. Once loosened, the wall collapses. Wall collapse (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage and be knocked prone and pinned, DC 18 Escape Artist or CMB to escape); multiple targets (all target within 10' of wall)

item.title: Rotting Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door in front of you appears to be old and decrepit.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The door is rotting. When the handle is pushed, it goes through the door, leaving splinters and sharp nails. Splintered Door (DC 16 Reflex Save or 1d3 damage + 1 bleed damage)

item.title: Weak Flagstones (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The flagstones that make up the floor look quite damaged.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The flagstones are cracked and fragile. For every 5' of movement, there is a 25% chance the the flagstones collapse. Flagstone Collapse (1d3 damage plus 1 bleed damage and character is immobilized, DC 17 Reflex Save negates, once immobilized, it requires a full round action to free oneself for no damage, or a swift action, which will cause an additional 1d3 plus 1 bleed damage); multiple targets (all targets on floor)

item.title: Steam Tunnel (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The narrow tunnel has several vents spewing forth steam, and several valves.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The steam vents can be turned off (there are 6 of them) by turning off all the valves. However, when the valves are closed, the back pressure causes an explosion. Individual Vents (1d6 steam damage, DC 17 Fortitude Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 5'); Tunnel Explosion (6d6 steam damage, DC 21 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in tunnel)

item.title: Collapsing Outer Room (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The room is small, barely bigger than a closet, but it can probably hold everyone. There is a door on the other side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is opened, the floor in the outer room opens up, dropping characters 30 feet onto a spiked floor. Anyone actually in the small room is safe. Opening Floor (DC 26 Reflex Save or take 3d6 falling + 2d6 spike damage and be knocked prone); multiple targets (all target in outer room)

item.title: Rope Pull (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This recently repaired door can be opened by a simple rope pull.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The rope attaches to a cannon on the other side of the door. When it is pulled, it fires. Cannon Attack (+15 ranged melee attack, 8d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets in 30' cone in front of door)

item.title: Might as Well Jump (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small, broken stone wall about 3 feet high crosses the hallway. It looks easy enough to jump over to the other side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The wall spans a spot on the floor where it has been severely compromised. Anyone climbing over the wall will cause the wall and floor to collapse. Collapse (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 3d6 falling damage plus 1d6 crushing damage); multiple targets (all targets on the wall); Jumping over the wall requires a DC 8 Acrobatics check, failing the check triggers the collapse)

item.title: Grimy Windows (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The windows in this room look out on... well, it's hard to say, they are extremely dirty.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The windows look into a small cave that is filled with a poison gas. Cleaning the windows will show the a green gas filled cave. However, in order to see the windows, they must be cleaned. Wiping the windows may cause them to break, and using liquid causes them to dissolve, letting in the gas from the cave. If the windows are wiped, a DC 22 Reflex Save is required or they break. Poison Gas (DC 16 Fortitude Save or take 1d6 Con damage and be knocked unconscious for 1d6 rounds); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Serrated Shaft (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Beneath the manhole cover is a deep metal shaft, with a ladder attached to one side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

About halfway down, the ladder has been greased. Below this the shaft narrows slightly (DC 24 Perception check to notice) and is lightly serrated. When the character hits the greased portion of the ladder, he must make a DC 21 Reflex Save or fall. Falling (5d6 falling damage + (6d6 - AC) melee damage + d6 bleed damage)

item.title: Rusty Nail (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wooden floor is in bad repair. Planks are warped and nails have come loose.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

When walking across the floor, a rusty nail impales your foot. The PC is now infected with the Shakes with an immediate onset, and must make the appropriate save - DC 13 Fortitude Save or 1d8 Dex Damage, 2 Saves cures, 1/day Frequency.

item.title: Noxious Cauldron (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorway is blocked by a big cauldron, full of some kind of noxious, bubbling liquid.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The cauldron can be easily tipped over. However, when it is tipped over, it quickly corrodes the floor, causing the floor on both sides of the door to collapse. Floor Collapse (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 2d6 falling damage plus 1d6 acid damage); multiple targets (all targets in either room)

item.title: Cursed Keyhole (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is locked. The lock seems very intricate, and it looks like you insert the key into a devil's mouth.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If this lock is picked and not disarmed, the unlucky thief will be cursed. Any door he tries to open will be locked (DC 20 Open Lock check) if it is not already locked, and any locked door will have +10 added to it's Disable Device difficulty. It is a DC 15 Will save to avoid this effect.

item.title: Ricochet Room (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The walls in this room seem to be pitted and scuffed

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If a gun is fired in this room, misses ricochet and will strike another character in the room. When a firearm attack misses, resolve the attack on the closest character to the intended target, if that misses, the next closest, then the next, etc. If the attack misses everyone, start over with the original, intended target. The ricochet stops when an attack successfully hits.

item.title: Squishy Step (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A narrow set of stairs descends into darkness.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

About a third of the way down, one of the stairs is squishy, the consistency of wet foam. When a character steps on this, he trips and falls down the stairs. Squishy Step (DC 17 Reflex or take 1d6+1 falling damage and be knocked prone at base of stairs)

item.title: Electrified Entrance (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small archway in the wall leads to another room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

If the edges of the archway are touched and the ground, it discharges an electrical effect. Discharge (DC 22 Acrobatics check or take 6d6 electricity damage)

item.title: Vertical Bolt Shaft (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A tall narrow shaft goes upward. The floor starts to rise.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 24

Trigger proximity; Reset Repair

Effect

The floor goes up at 5ft per round until it goes 40 feet up, where it stops. Activating the floor requires a DC 22 Disable Device check to make it go back down, it automatically rises when it is stepped on at the bottom. Every 5 feet of the shaft, there are holes in the shaft that shoot crossbow bolts. Crossbow Bolt (+8 melee, 1d8 damage)

item.title: Break and Brachiate (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several low hanging vines seem to offer a way to get across the small chasm.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger proximity; Reset None

Effect

When a character comes within 10' of one of the vines, or tries to use it, it conveys him to the other side, and smashes him against the wall. It then swings back and smashes against the other wall. It repeats this seven more times. (a total of 9 smashes) Smash Attack (1d6+3 damage, DC 21 Reflex, Escape Artist or CMD to get free of vine on each attack)

item.title: Flint Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The room has a very bad odor. A heavy stone door leads out.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

The room is filled with a flammable gas. Any open source of fire will set it off. This is easily detectable. However, the door has a metal frame and is made of flint. When it is opened, it will spark, igniting the gas. Flint Door (3d6 Fire Damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Light Crystal (CR 12)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large, bright gem hangs from the ceiling.

Type: magical; Perception DC 36; Disable Device 36

Trigger proximity; Reset Auto

Effect

Once per round, the gem focuses any magical light in the room, such as a continual light spell, magical flame, etc, and fires 3 beams back at the sources. Light Beam (+15 Ranged touch for 4d6 fire damage); multiple targets (sources within 30')

item.title: Mini Shadow Me (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It seems like something is following you, but you aren't sure.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger proximity; Reset None

Effect

Once in the room, a quasi-real, miniature shadow follows you that is hard to see (Perception DC is 32 + the character's Stealth skill). It can be dismissed with a Dispel Magic with DC 24 caster check. When the target makes an attack, the shadow immediately interrupts the attack with an identical attack of it's own on the character, then the shadow disappears. The shadow uses the combat/magic stats of the character it follows.

item.title: Loose Stool (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stool sits in the corner, underneath a high shelf.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If one stands on the stool, they can reach the shelf. However, when someone stands on the stool, it breaks, and sickens the character. Loose Stool Attack (DC 13 Fortitude Save or become sickened for 1d4 hours)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
The name and effect of this (and the fact that the characters become sickened) made me laugh.
DC 26 perception and disable might be a bit high for a CR2 trap though.
It's based on a level one spell. Per the Core Rulebook, the DC for Perception and Disable Device checks is 25 + spell level, and the CR is 1 + spell level.

item.title: Greased and Spiked Corridor (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A short, narrow corridor ends in a spiky wall; iron doors are on either side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The floor of the corridor has been greased. Characters stepping into the corridor slide into the back wall. Greased Corridor (DC 18 Acrobatics check or slide into wall, taking 1d6+1 damage)

item.title: Hot Glue Doorknob (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door has a large brass doorknob.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The doorknob, when touched, activates a non-magical, glue-like substance. The character's hand is stuck to the door. (DC 30 Strength check or universal solvent to remove). Once attached, the doorknob heats up as per the heat metal spell.

item.title: Slide Pole (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It looks like the only way down is to slide down the pole that is attached to the ceiling, goes through a hole in the floor and is secured on the floor below.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The pole attaches beneath the floor below, at the bottom of a spiked pit. When a character slides down the pole, he will break the floor below and slide into the pit. Sliding Pit (DC 21 Reflex Save or take 3d6 +3 damage and be knocked prone in the pit)

item.title: Knocking Sandbag (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large, brass knocker is set into the center of the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Several feet above the door is a small shelf containing a sandbag full of sneezing powder. When the knocker is used, the shelf tilts, dumping the sandbag onto the ground. Sandbag Attack (DC 14 Fortitude save or become sickened for 2d4+1 rounds); multiple targets (all targets within 15')

item.title: Poison Plate (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The china in the cabinet is absolutely magnificent

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

Any food that touches this plate becomes poisoned, as per the poison spell. The save DC is 14.

item.title: Pit Chest (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An iron-bound wooden chest sits in the back of the room, near the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the chest is opened, a pit appears beneath the opener (even if opened from a distance) as per the Create Pit spell. The DC is 13 and the CL is 4.

item.title: Recessed Doorknob (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large metal door, with a recessed bronze doorknob, is set into the middle of the wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the doorknob is touched, the character must make a DC 22 Reflex save or the hand becomes stuck. Each round, the character must try to remove his hand from the doorknob. This can be done with a DC 22 Escape Artist or Strength check. Alternatively, universal solvent will also free the hand. Application of oil, the casting of a grease spell, etc will grant a +10 circumstance bonus to the check. If the hand is not freed, electricity flows through the doorknob.
