Electricity Attack (6d6 damage, DC 22 Fortitude Save for half damage)

item.title: Entry Gong (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A gong and a mallet sits next to a featureless round door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The gong must be struck to open the door. However, when the gong is struck, it sends out wave of force. Force wave (DC 12 Fortitude Save or take 1d6 damage, additionally, non-magical items are subject to being shattered as per the Shatter spell with a save DC of 12); multiple targets (all targets in a 25' cone)

item.title: Vacuum Room (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door in front of you is not locked, but it is stuck fast.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The door opens towards the current room. Beyond the door, is a small room that has had its air bled out, so it is near a vacuum. If someone bashes the door, they get sucked into the set of spikes at the far end of the room. Spiked Wall (DC 22 Reflex Save or 3d6 + 3 damage)

item.title: Weed Mines (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The way is blocked by thick, tall weeds.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Several weeds block the path. If the weeds are pulled, nothing happens. (DC 22 Strength to pull) If they are hacked, they explode. Weed Explosion (6d6 damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Distorted Reflection Bowl (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A bowl of highly reflective liquid sits on a pedestal, about waist height.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the liquid is disturbed while the character is viewing his reflection, the ripples manifest physically on the character's face. Distorted Reflection (DC 15 Will Save or target takes a permanent -6 penalty to his Charisma score)

item.title: Desk Calendar (CR 11)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A book sits open on a small desk. It is turned to a journal entry that is dated for today.

Type: magical; Perception DC 35; Disable Device 35

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the page is turned to tomorrow, the book emits a Power Word: Kill with a save DC of 23. The world may not be ending, but it is ending for you.

item.title: Lava Plug Gem (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A huge diamond sits atop a pedestal.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The pedestal is the top of a lava chute, and the diamond is acting as a plug. If the diamond is removed (DC 22 Strength check or DC 22 Disable Device) lava spews forth. Lava Spew (6d6 fire damage per round, DC 21 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30') Feel free to make the diamond priceless or worthless.

item.title: Cookies and Milk (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You enter a small parlor. There is a roaring fire in the fireplace, and two leather chairs. Between the chairs is a small table. On the table is a platter of cookies and a pitcher of milk.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the characters exit the room, they are sprayed with a toxic poison. If they haven't eaten a cookie and some milk, it will harm them. Eating a cookie and some milk after being poisoned will also negate the effect. Toxic Poison(DC 26 Fortitude Save, 1d3 Strength Damage, 1/round for 6 rounds); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Chimney (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It looks like the chimney could be used to descend into the house.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The chimney is fairly easy to descend (DC 10 Climb Check). When a character gets near the bottom, the fire roars to life. Also, several large spikes, pointed downwards, spring from the chimney walls. The characters can either roast, or brave the spikes to climb back out. Fire (1d6 fire damage per round); Spikes (DC 22 Escape Artist Check or 1d6 + 3 damage per 10 feet)

item.title: Boxes (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Boxes and crates are stacked floor to ceiling. Paper and ribbons litter the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset none

Effect

The floor is very slippery due to the paper and ribbons. A DC 15 Acrobatics check is required for every 10 feet moved in the room. If it fails, the character slips, knocking over boxes. Falling Boxes (DC 20 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage)

item.title: Arrow in the Knee (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An arrow fires out of the wall, striking you on the knee.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The stricken character is affected by a geas to stop adventuring. See geas/quest spell for details.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Reblogged this on Save VS Weekend and commented: Yes, yes, I know it isn't 4th Edition - but I love "Trap-A-Day", and I got a good chuckle out of this.

item.title: Hells Bells (CR 11)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
For today's extrapaganza, I decided a haunt was in order.

When you enter the room, you hear a small, haunting chime of several bells.

XP 12,800; N haunt (special)

Caster Level 10th; Notice Perception DC 35 (to locate bells); HP 49

Trigger proximity; Reset 1 day

Effect

When this haunt is triggered, several bells ring. This causes all of the characters to make a DC 30 Will Save or lose 1 Wisdom permanently. Afterwards, once per day, the bells will ring and the characters will hear it, no matter where they are. Only destroying the bells will stop the attacks.

Destruction

The bells can be destroyed easily, but they must be found, which requires a DC 35 Perception check while in the room. The haunt cannot be destroyed by reducing its HP, as it is neutral.

item.title: Freezing Waterfall (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A waterfall cascades down the mountain into a small pool, blocking the way into the cave behind it.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If someone steps through the waterfall, (passing a hand is not sufficient, at least 50% of the body must pass) it instantly freezes. Frozen Waterfall (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 6d6 cold damage and become entangled in the waterfall. A successful save negates the entanglement and deals half damage. While entangled, the characters takes 1d6 cold damage per round. A DC 19 Escape Artist, Strength or CMD check is required to break free from the ice)

item.title: Sewing Machine Portcullis (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The post of the open portcullis appear to be connected to each other via a sinewy rope.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When someone walks under this open portcullis, the individual parts of the portcullis quickly move up and down. They also have a thick rope attached to each post, essentially sewing the person in place to the ground. Sewing Portcullis (DC 24 Reflex save or take 10d6 + 1d6 bleed damage and become entangled. Entanglement can be undone with a DC 22 Profession: Tailor check for no damage. Otherwise, an additional 1d6 bleed damage will be dealt if the character makes a DC 22 Escape Artist or Strength check)

item.title: Acid Door Pull (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door has a single, brass door pull in the center.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The pull comes out of the door when pulled, spaying a fine mist of acid. Acid Attack (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 2d4 acid damage); multiple targets (all targets in a 15' cone)

item.title: The Hourglass (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An hourglass sits on a small table in the middle of the room. The sand has almost run out.

Type: magical; Perception DC 33; Disable Device 33

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

When the sand runs out in 1d4+1 rounds, everyone in the room is treated as if a Temporal Stasis spell has been cast on them with a DC of 22. Time for affected characters can only be restarted by turning the hourglass over.

item.title: Steam Valve (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A valve seems to be open, as steam spews into the corridor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The steam does one point of damage per round to anyone in the corridor. The valve can be shut in a single round. However, once the valve is shut, pressure builds up. In 1d4+1 rounds, the pipes will explode in a shower of steam and shrapnel. Steam Explosion (6d6 + 1d6 bleed damage, DC 19 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Ring Shackle (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A shiny ring, radiating magic, sits on the table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

When someone picks up the ring, it is automatically put on. There is an invisible cord that anchors the ring, via the ethereal plane, to this room. If the character tries to leave the room, the ring will reach the end of the cord, preventing the exit. The ring also cannot be removed by non-magical means. If a finger or limb is cut off, it magically appears on another finger or toe. Only if all fingers and toes are removed will the ring return to the table. The ring's effect can be dispelled, the DC is 18.

item.title: Greased Portcullis (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A closed portcullis blocks your way.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The bars of the portcullis are greased, and pieces are sharp. If the portcullis is lifted by hand, the lifter loses his grip, slicing open his hands. Portcullis Attack (DC 18 Strength check or slip and take 1d6 bleed damage)

item.title: Manhole Cover (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The manhole cover is not quite set.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The cover is spring loaded, and the edges are sharp. If someone tries to remove it, it flies up, spinning. Manhole Cover Attack (2d6 + 1d6 bleed damage, DC 19 Reflex Save negates)

item.title: Springy Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door in front of you appears stuck.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The door is actually made from a very dense, springy form of wood that has expanded a bit, sticking in the frame. If someone tries to break the door by running into it or kicking, they will get bounced back. If they try to hack it open, the attacking weapon will get bounced back. Springy Door (DC 22 Strength check or be thrown back 2d10 feet, taking 1d6 damage and knocked prone; AC 5 to hit, hardness 15. If the hardness limit is not exceeded with a single blow, then a DC 18 Reflex save is needed to hang on to the weapon, otherwise the weapon bounces back and strikes the wielder with the same attack roll and damage result used to hit the door)

item.title: Cobweb Corridor (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor is filled with cobwebs, floor to ceiling and wall to wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The webs maintain a magical field that supports the walls of the corridor, if enough of them are removed, the corridor collapses. Corridor Collapse (cumulative 5% chance for each 5 ft square cleared that walls collapse, 6d6 damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in corridor)

item.title: Ultimate Maze Decks: Sewers now Available on RPG Now!
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded: Mentats of Gaming is proud to present our 2nd maze deck product  - Ultimate Maze Decks: Sewers.

item.title: Cuisinart Door (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A revolving door, made of glass, is set in the middle of the wall.

Type: mechanicall; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Once a character enters the revolving door, blades spring out from the center and the door rotates very quickly, slicing them up and expelling them out the other side. Cuisinart Door (+18 melee, 10d6 damage plus character is placed on other side of door and knocked prone on successful hit)

item.title: Lantern Rift (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several lanterns hang from mounts on the walls. They appear unlit, yet they radiate heat.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The lanterns emit energy in the non-visible spectrum. Beams criss-cross and effectively connect to all lanterns. The energy serves to protect this area from a negative energy rift but as a side effect deal 1 point of fire damage per round to all characters in the hallway. Should any of the lanterns be snuffed or moved, the area becomes unstable. Unstable Rift (DC 18 Will Save or take 6d6 negative energy damage per round); multiple targets (all targets in hallway)

item.title: Peace Bonds (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This entryway has several frescoes painted on the wall, all depicting signs of peace - negotiations, warriors laying down their weapons, etc.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the characters enter the room, the characters' sheathed weapons are silently bound to their sheath, harness, etc by loose straps, threads or anything else on their person.  It requires a DC 22 Perception check to notice this. When the characters draw their weapons, it requires a full-round action to undo the string binding the weapon, or, as a move-equivalent action, the weapon can be drawn with a DC 25 Strength check.

item.title: Choker String Curtain (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorway is blocked by a simple curtain made up of several hanging strands of cloth.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The strips of cloth seem normal. However, once anyone crosses the threshold, the cloth activates, wrapping around the character, choking and holding him. Choking Strings (+15 CMB, 25 CMD, character is grappled and is considered suffocating. Additoinally, speech is impaired, and verbal spells cannot be cast)

item.title: Wall of Ice (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorway is sealed with a thin sheet of ice.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the ice is struck, a Wall of Ice (CL 8) is created behind it. Anyone running through the ice takes 1d6 + 8 cold damage.

item.title: Illusionary Water (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
As the party makes its way down the corridor, suddenly, flames burst from the walls, catching everything on fire! A huge pool of water is near one end of the hall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The pool of water is under the effect of a Major Image spell. It's actually highly flammable oil. If thrown on the fire, it quickly spreads. Fire Attack (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage per round, It is a full round action to douse the flames. If more "water" is used, an additional 1d6 fire damage is inflicted); multiple targets (all targets within 30' of flames)

item.title: Broken Tiles (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is well worn; the tiles are cracked in many places.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

If any of the cracks are stepped on, they deal negative energy damage. Crack Attack (1d8 + 1 negative energy damage, to avoid stepping on a crack, a DC 5 Acrobatics check is necessary every 5 feet. If not actively avoiding cracks, there is a 25% chance that a crack will be stepped on every 5 feet)

item.title: Blast Door (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door, made mostly of metal and stone, appears to not only be locked, but stuck.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 21

Trigger proximity; Reset None

Effect

The door is inset with several blasting caps. If it is struck hard (enough to do 2 points of post-hardness damage) it will explode. Exploding Door (10d6 fire damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 20'); Otherwise, the door has hardness 20 and 85 HP.

item.title: Oven Door (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is slightly warm to the touch.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the door is opened, it is as if someone was standing near a wall of fire. The other side is not hot, however, and there is no extra damage for passing through the door. Oven Door (2d4/1d4 damage per round); multiple targets (all targets within 10 feet/20 feet)

item.title: Static Room (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The air seems charged in this room. Your hair stands on end.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The characters build up a static charge while in this room. If they touch one of the metal doorknobs on either door while in the room, it discharges. Static Discharge (10d6 electrical damage, DC 22 Fortitude Save for half)

item.title: Disarming Room (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
One wall appears to made out of copper, opposite that wall, there appears to be a dirt wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset 1 day

Effect

About halfway through the room, the trap activates. Living material is pulled towards the dirt wall, while metal is pulled towards the copper wall. Held objects require a DC 19 Strength check or they are dropped and end up secured to the wall, where a DC 19 Strength check is required to pry them loose. Characters in metal armor require a DC 19 Strength check, or they are dragged towards the wall at 5 feet per round. All characters require a DC 19 Will Save, or they are dragged towards the dirt wall at 5 feet per round. Characters that are being pulled by both walls are immobilized, and take 1d6 damage per round that they are immobilized. Additionally, the characters' armor must make a DC 19 Fortitude, or it is pulled off, attached to the copper wall and takes on the broken condition.

item.title: Trail of Powder (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A trail of powder leads towards a door in the back wall... It's just been ignited!

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the door is opened, the powder ignites. It moves 30' per round until it reaches the far wall. It ignites the far wall, which is coated in a deadly contact poison. The fire burns the contact poison and fills the air with acrid fumes. Otherwise, if the fuse is put out, the contact poison remains on the door/wall. Contact Poison Fumes (1/round for 6 rounds, 1 Con Damage, DC 16 Fortitude Save, 2 cures); multiple targets (all targets within 30' of back wall); Contact Poison (1/round for 2 rounds, 3d6 Con Damage, DC 18 Fortitude Save)

item.title: Stinging Bead Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorway is full of hanging beads.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The bead strands have tiny needles embedded into several of the beads. Characters passing through the beads will get "stung" by the beads. Stinging Beads (+8 melee for 1d6 damage plus 1 bleed damage)

item.title: Flanking Tiles (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The tiles in this room all have a dark circle in the center.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

Whenever a PC is in combat, the tile will rotate, granting a flanking bonus to any creature attacking that PC. Flanking Tile (DC 18 Reflex save or attacking creatures are granted a flanking bonus for that round, Freq, 1/round); multiple targets (all targets on tiles)

item.title: Dimension Doors (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The foes are right behind the door! Standard door opening procedure!

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If characters attack through the door, either melee, ranged or spells, the attacks are automatically turned back on the character(s) in the doorway just outside of the room. (i.e. the same side they opened the door from)

item.title: Dusty, Gusty, Hallway (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor's floor is thick with dust.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor is covered in dust, which, by itself is harmless. However, about halfway down the corridor, a pressure plate sets off a gust of wind spell. This stirs up the dust. It causes visibility to drop to zero, effectively blinding the characters. It creates breathing issues, treat each character as if they had the suffocating condition. It is also quite flammable. Any open flame will ignite the dust. Ignited Dust (6d6 fire damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in hallway). The dust will re-settle on the floor in 20d6 rounds, removing all of the above conditions.

item.title: Mirror Door (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door at the end of the hall has a mirrored, albeit, warped, surface.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the character sees his own reflection, he sees himself, but with a goatee added. His alignment is instantly changed to be the polar opposite of what he is now should the door be opened. Mirror Door (DC 22 Will Save or have alignment reversed)

item.title: Underwater Glass Room (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor leads down, eventually opening up in a room that seems to be underwater and have walls of glass. The floor is highly polished marble, and a room-wide swirling pattern works its way across the room in the tiles.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If stepped on, several of the tiles make a ringing sound. When 1d4 + 1 of these tiles have rung, the glass walls shatter, and tons of water rushes in. The characters must swim 40' up the corridors to surface. Rushing Water (6d6 damage, DC 22 Fortitude save for half and the characters are submerged);  multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Yoko Ono Peanuts (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You walk into a well-appointed parlor, with several women in strange costumes offering you candied peanuts. There are several exits leaving the parlor on the other side of the entrance.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The candied nuts cause the party to split up, and leave via different exits. Yoko Ono Peanuts (DC 15 Will Save or leave the room via an exit not taken by another party member); Multiple targets (all targets in room)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: There's an inside joke here... About 5 people on the face of the planet will get it.

item.title: Holes (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The room's floor is wet; several small holes are in the far wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

About halfway across the room, a small pressure plate triggers this trap. The entry shuts, and water starts to pour out of the far wall, filling the room at 3 feet per round. The rising rate remains constant until all the holes are plugged. The holes can be easily plugged, however, one of the holes is pouring out acid. Should the characters not plug the holes (there are 1d6 + 1) they will be subject to drowning rules. Should they plug the acid hole (random) it will eat through any plug in 1 round, or cause damage to a character is he is plugging it himself. Once all the holes are plugged, the room drains at the rate of 3 feet per round. The door opens into this room, as well, so opening it requires a DC 30 Strength check. Otherwise, the door has 80hp and 20 hardness. Acid Spray (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 3d6 acid damage per round, or take 3d6 acid damage and keep hole plugged)

item.title: Greased Slide Pole (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A slide pole descends down several levels, you can see the floor of the next level about 10 feet below.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

About 5 feet below the floor, the pole has been magically greased. Failure means the characters accelerates until he hits the floor 3 levels down. Greased Pole (DC 12 Reflex Save or slide all the way down to the floor 3 levels below, taking 3d10 damage)

item.title: Gate Gate (CR 12)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door to the building is set behind an ornate iron gate.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Should the gate be opened without speaking the command word, the opener is immediately gated to the parlor inside the building, in another plane of existence. The owner of the gate will eventually get around to talking to the character, and, in exchange for some unpleasant service, will most likely offer a return trip home. There is no saving throw for this effect.

item.title: Focused Peepholes (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A few small holes look into the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The holes are filled each with a glass lens. Looking through the hole causes the lens to turn slightly, focusing the light from the next room onto the viewer's eyes. Focused Light (DC 22 Reflex Save or Blinded for 1d10 + 1 rounds)

item.title: Reverse Trap Door (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A locked trap door is in the middle of the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The trapdoor opens up from the floor, and if not disarmed, opens up very quickly, slamming into the floor. Reverse Trap Door (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage and be pinned, DC 21 Escape Artist or 21 CMD to escape)

item.title: Sticky Trap Door (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A locked trap door is in the middle of the floor.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The trapdoor opens into the floor, and the handle is coated with magical glue. Characters opening the trap door are stuck and the door pulls them down into the hole. After 1d4+1 rounds, the glue dissolves. Sticky Trap Door (DC 14 Reflex Save or be stuck to door as it opens, hanging in midair, DC 22 Climb Check to climb out of hole. Otherwise, glue dissolves in 1d4+1 rounds and character falls, unless he makes a DC 22 Reflex Save to hang on, taking 3d10 damage)

item.title: Illusionary Exploding Trap Door (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A locked trap door is in the middle of the floor.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The trapdoor is locked and stuck. Since it is an illusion, cast at CL 20, it is very hard to penetrate, and thus will most likely appear to just be a stuck and locked door. However, the floor under the illusion has been coated with a film that explodes when it is stuck. The explosion also dispels the illusion, leaving a small crater in the floor. Exploding Trap Door (3d6 damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Dimension Door with a View (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The window in the tower shows a magnificent view of the countryside.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If a character pokes his head (or any body part) out the window, he is automatically teleported about 500 feet straight out, where he then falls. Dimension Door (DC 16 Will Save or be teleported 500 feet out and fall for 10d10 damage)

item.title: Burning Shadows (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Bright moonlight creeps in through the decorated windows, casting shadows of the symbols onto the floor.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The shadows move a bit. When a shadow is crossed, it deals negative energy damage. The shadows can be removed via a consecration spell. Burning Shadows (+8 ranged touch for 2d8 negative energy damage)

item.title: Anti CSI Runes (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There seem to be words or runes carved into the wall, but time has worn them down to be pretty much illegible.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger Visual; Reset None

Effect

The carvings are explosive runes, but they can't be read. However, if they are rubbed with chalk or something else to make them legible, the spell will trigger.

item.title: Shoot The Glass (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The walls of this long corridor seem to be made of glass.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

As the characters move down the hall, muskets fire from each side every 10 feet, shattering the glass. Musket Fire (+18 ranged melee for 1d12 damage, 2 shots every 10 feet); Shattered Glass (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets within 10' of shots); Treat the areas of broken glass as difficult terrain.

item.title: Offset Doors (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A single, narrow door leads out of the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The door rotates on an axis about a foot from the wall, making the opening smaller than expected. The edges of the door, have spikes, too. Spiked Edges (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage)

item.title: Antidote Trap (CR 12)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The stout wooden door is locked.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22(needle) DC 28(contact); Disable Device 22(needle) DC 28(contact)

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The doorknob is covered in a contact poison, however, the needle is filled with the antidote. Needle (DC 18 Reflex Save or be injected with antidote); Contact Poison (DC 24 Fortitude Save or take 4d6 permanent Con damage unless injected with antidote within 1 hour)

item.title: Greek Fire Chest (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large, oaken chest sits in the middle of the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The chest's contents have been packed inside layers of greek fire in glass vials. Greek Fire (10d6 fire damage, DC 24 Reflex Save negates, plus 2d6 fire damage per round for 1d4 + 1 rounds); multiple targets (targets within 20' take 1d6 splash damage)

item.title: Wet Plaster Ceiling (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor appears to have been freshly whitewashed.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

About halfway down the hall, a pressure plate springs open, sending the character straight up into the wet plaster ceiling, where they will be stuck and suffocating. Wet Plaster Ceiling (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 1d4 damage and become stuck in ceiling with the drowning condition. It is a CMD 22 or Escape Artist DC 22 check to escape)

item.title: Sneezing Dust (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is covered in a heavy layer of dust.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset 1 day

Effect

The dust causes uncontrollable sneezing. Sneezing Dust (DC 16 Fortitude Save or begin sneezing, -4 to all attack or skill rolls. Sneezing ends 1d4+1 rounds after leaving room); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Fractured Mirror (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A cracked mirror is on the far side of the room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger Visual; Reset None

Effect

If a person looks in the mirror, he sees multiple, diminished copies of himself, lowering his self worth. Fractured Mirror (DC 14 Will Save or lose 1d6 Charisma)

item.title: Ankle Biters (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor in front of the door is scratched.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

There are 2 bear traps hidden underneath the tiles. When the door is opened, the traps snap shut from under the tiles. Ankle Biters (+12 melee for 2d6 + 2 damage, plus target is entangled - DC 18 Escape Artist or 18 CMD check to escape)

item.title: False Ceiling Trap Door (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A trap door is in the middle of the ceiling, with a rope to pull it open.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The trapdoor is false. If it is pulled, the entire ceiling falls. Fake Trap Door (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 6d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Bolt Doorknob (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door has a large doorknob in the center.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the doorknob is turned, a single crossbow bolt fires from the center. Bolt Doorknob (+6 melee for 1d8 damage)

item.title: Dimension Door Crate (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You've entered a warehouse, full of crates.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

One of the larger crates has a dimension door effect. When it is explored, the character is teleported to another large crate that is locked and sealed, and has no air inside. Dimension Door Crate (DC 16 Will Save or teleported to another locked crate, characters gains drowning condition. DC 25 Strength check to break out of crate. Crate 80hp, 20 hardness)

item.title: Mouse Trap (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A big pile of coins is in the center of the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The coins sit on a lever. When enough coins are removed, it causes a huge metal bar, like a mouse trap, to go off. Mousetrap (4d10 damage and pinned, DC 22 Reflex Save avoids, DC 22 Escape Artist or CMD to escape)

item.title: Loose Brick (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
After careful searching, you see that the mortar around one of the bricks has been chiseled away.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

There is a ring of protection +1 behind the brick, which can be removed. However, when the brick is removed, the wall collapses. Wall Collapse (10d6 damage plus target is pinned, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage and avoids pinned); multiple targets (all targets within 10' of wall)

item.title: Hollow Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door at the end of the hall is locked, and stuck fast.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

There is a hollow space in the middle of the door that is filled with little spikes. If a character kicks or runs through the door, they cut him up. Door Spikes (+8 melee for 1d6 damage + 1 bleed damage)

item.title: Stop and Stair (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A sturdy wooden staircase leads to the second floor.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Halfway up the staircase, one of the stairs is trapped. When it is stepped upon, it holds the character in place. Stop and Stair (DC 13 Will Save or target is paralyzed for 4 rounds).

item.title: Beeping (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A faint beeping noise resonates throughout the complex.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

A small device has been centrally placed and the acoustics of the area allow the sound to travel to all areas. Beeping (DC 14 Will Save, or all Will Saves and Perception checks are at -1 until the area is exited); multiple targets (All targets in area)

item.title: Heavy Dust (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A thick layer of dust covers the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The dust is very thick. If it is moved through normally, it kicks up, making breathing more difficult and providing concealment. Heavy Dust (DC 16/24 half movement/full movement Acrobatics Check or anything 10ft or more away gains 20% concealment, and Fortitude Saves for anyone within 10ft are at -1); multiple targets (all targets in affected area)

item.title: Split Door (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door is at the end of the hall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The door is split. When the door is opened, the bottom 18 inches stays shut. Split Door (DC 16 Reflex Save or be knocked prone)

item.title: Oily Stair (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Stone stairs lead down into darkness.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

About halfway down the stairs, one of the steps has had oil spilled on it. Oily Stair (DC 16 Reflex Save or fall down stairs for 1d6 damage and be knocked prone)

item.title: Keeper of the Peace (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A statue of a meditating monk sits next to the door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

If someone tries to pass the door with a drawn weapon, the statue shoots a single magic missile at the target. It will do this once per round. Magic Missile (1d4+1 damage); multiple targets (one target within 30' per round who has a drawn weapon)

item.title: Closet Full of Anvils (CR 11)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A sturdy wooden door is on the far wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The door leads to a closet which is overflowing with anvils. When it is opened, the anvils spill out. Anvils(DC 22 Reflex Save or take 8d6 damage)

item.title: Warping Rug (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The hallway is carpeted with a runner covering the wooden floor.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

When someone reaches the halfway point of the rug, the floor warps, creating a 10'x10' hole. Warped Wood (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall into hole, taking 2d6 points of damage); multiple targets (all targets in 10'x10' area) Trip (DC 16 Reflex Save or be knocked prone); multiple targets (all targets on rug)

item.title: Reversing Mirror (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You feel compelled to look at yourself in the large, ornate mirror on the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger visual; Reset Auto

Effect

When a character looks into the mirror, everything becomes reversed. He takes a -4 penalty on attack rolls, needs to make a Concentration check to cast spells, and must make a DC 20 Intelligence check to read anything. A DC 22 Will Save negates the effect, and the mirror has not further effect.

item.title: Acid Drip (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Goo begins to drip down from the ceiling.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Goo drips from the ceiling. (DC 22 Reflex Save avoids). It is very sticky and smells somewhat. A little further into the room is a basin of water. If water is used to wash away the goo, it takes a full round action. However, the water reacts with the goo, causing 3d8 points of damage.

item.title: Barred Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door at the end of the hall is securely barred from this side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The bar is heavy, and holds down a rotating floor underneath it. When the bar is lifted, the tile flips, dumping the character into a pit, and then the bar falls in the pit. Pit ( DC 18 Reflex Save or fall in pit and take 1d6 damage and secondary attack); Secondary Attack (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage)

item.title: Self Correcting Quill (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This quill has a huge, magnificent black feather attached to it, and a fine point.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

This quill functions as a normal quill, however, when something written is grammatically incorrect or spelled incorrectly, it damages the writer. Quill Attack (+8 touch for 1d8+1 damage)

item.title: Glass Door (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A sturdy, wooden door is at the end of the hall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The door appears to be a sturdy wooden door that is stuck. If someone tries to break it, it shatters. Glass Door (3d6 damage plus 3 bleed damage)

item.title: Chopping Stairs (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A set of metal stairs leads up.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When one of the middle stairs is stepped it opens up, then snaps shut again very quickly. Chopping Stairs (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage plus 1 bleed damage and become immobilized until a DC 18 Strength or Escape Artist check is performed)

item.title: Illusory Gold (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A metal chest sits in a corner.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The gold in the chest is actually there. However, even though it looks like lots of gold coins, it is actually molten gold. Molten Gold (6d6 fire damage)

item.title: Level Up (CR *)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several arcane tomes line the bookshelves.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Several of the tomes appear to give the ability to level up one or more levels. When read, the reader is "levelled up" 100 feet in the air for each level raise. Level Up (DC 18 + number of levels Will Save or be transported levels*100ft into the air)

item.title: Broken Stairs (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several stairs are missing at the bottom of the stairway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor at the landing is also broken. Characters who leap over the broken stairs will land on the floor, which breaks, dumping them down another story. Broken Stairs (DC 19 Reflex Save or fall for 1d6+3 damage)

item.title: Troll Wig Trap (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
We're doing our first guest trap. This one is from Mike Myler. He also has a new adventure, The Clockwork Wonders of Brandlehill over at rpgnow. Check it out!

Spiderwebs gently move in the breeze ahead of you.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 20; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Manual

Effect

Attack +20 ranged (entangled by net, fire damage 1d6)

Onset

Immediate; single target. Reflex DC 17 to put out the fire after ending entangled effect. Can be immediately doused by magical means.

Troll Wig Item

Price 8,080 gp; Aura faint abjuration, faint transmutation; CL 3rd; Weight 6lbs

Description

This masterwork net is festooned with pebble sized ornaments that tie together thick cords of spider’s silk. Most of these trinkets are blank pieces of bone but some appear burned, and bear effigies of troll skulls in painful grimaces. When soaked in oil the net becomes an applicable target of the spark spell or may be lit on fire (before or after an attack with it, requiring a swift action) with mundane sources, dealing 1d6 fire damage to any creature entangled by it (the oil burns away and the net extinguishes  after 5 rounds).

The Troll Wig has a range of ten feet, 12 hit points, a hardness of 6 and can be burst with a DC 27 Strength check but operates exactly as a net in all other ways. Should the Troll Wig be used to kill a troll, one of the thirty white bone trinkets changes into a burned miniature troll skull. When all thirty of these charms have been transformed the Troll Wig deals an additional +1 fire damage to entangled targets

History

Gnomes are often credited as the original designers of the Troll Wig, given its specialized set of qualities, but grippli are the true creators of this unique net. With their extraordinary ability to climb and natural proficiency with the weapon, one clever shaman in the first days of the ancient Glachra clan used this subtle device to swiftly defeat the leader of an imposing band of trolls. Since then they have appeared in the hands of cautious small folk from coast to coast, all with varying numbers of burned skulls.

Construction Requirements

Cost 4,040 gp; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, reinforced armaments, resist energy (fire), 200 ft. spider's silk

wp:comment.wp:comment_author: Troll Wig on TrapADay.com! | Mike Myler
wp:comment.wp:comment_content: [...] If you haven’t indulged in the The Clockwork Wonders of Brandlehill yet and remain wary of the steep $4 entry fee, head over to TrapADay.com and get a look at the Troll Wig trap. [...]

item.title: Jenga Brick Wall (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorway seems to have been filled in with haphazardly placed bricks.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Each round a brick is removed, there is a cumulative 5% chance that the bricks collapse. Collapse (1d6 damage)

item.title: Gold Pile Paperweight (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A huge pile of gold sits on the floor in this small room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

There are thousands of gold pieces on the floor. However, they are holding down a trap door that covers a steam flue. If a few hundred are removed, the steam bursts through, sending gold pieces and hot steam everywhere. Steam (6d6 fire damage - DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 20'); Gold (+14 ranged melee for 4d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets within 20')

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Devious! I like it! :-)

item.title: Magic Missile Vineyard (CR 11)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The grapes on the vines seem plump and ripe

Type: magical; Perception DC 35; Disable Device 35

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Each vine has a bunch of grapes that are magic missiles. If someone wanders into the vineyard without the correct amulet, they will be hit by magic missiles. Every 30 feet there will be 5 missiles that will be evenly distributed amongst the party. Magic Missile x 5 (1d4 + 1 damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30 feet)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: now is this every 30 feet there will be another bunch of grapes? or every 30 feet traveled they draw 5 missiles? if its every 30 feet traveled then it would be too easy to just fireball the trap and it wouldn't do more then the initial 5x missiles... or am i reading this wrong?
Every 30 feet they get hit by 5 missiles from a random clump of grapes. I guess you could raze the entire vineyard...

item.title: Kettlebells (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A high archway has been hewn into the rock, leading to the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

A small pressure plate on the floor releases two 53 lb kettlebells which swing together and smack you in the head. Kettlebells (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 6d6 damage and become dazed for 1 round)

item.title: Gem in the Arch (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A gem is embedded in a brick at the apex of the archway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the gem is removed, the archway loses its structure and collapses. Arch Collapse (4d6 damage and pinned or DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage and not pinned)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hehe... it's always fun to play on PC greed. ;)

item.title: Doorknob Illusion (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorknob appears to be stuck.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The doorknob is an illusion covering a serrated blade. If it is forced, it slices the hand. Serrated Doorknob (DC 16 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage + 1 bleed damage)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: what would be your opinion of putting elemental damage on this? like a weapon enchantment, what would it add to the CR for an added 1d6 fire or such as that?
I would think it would add 1 to the CR.
i haven't done trap making before so most of your work is really interesting to me,
Pathfinder has a nice table in the Core Rulebook that helps you get the CR correctly. However, I think that the descriptions in 4E for traps do a better job, they seem more flexible.

I believe that it is intended not to fool the senses, but instead if you force the doorknob think of it like grabbing the doorknob and trying to shove your shoulder into the door, when you grab the doorknob you're actually grabbing a blades and therefore that's what cut your hands. as far as adding elemental damage to it with an enchantment I agree with the plus one Cr but I'm not sure if that is. one thing that I would add to the description would be if you manipulate the handle as if trying to check if it is locked I would say that that would trigger the trap as well or at least have a chance to trigger.

How does one create an illusion which feels like a normal doorknob (w/o feeling the blades) when tried/checked to open without force? Is it also enchanted with some sort of Charm Effect to fool the mind into believing that it feels differently? If there is a Charm Effect, wouldn't normal resistances to Charm Effects then have to be factored into if the illusion were even believed enough to fall victim to the trap?

item.title: Icy Ramp (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor slopes downward and is covered in ice.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Further down the corridor, the ice creates small, razor sharp ridges. Should a character fall and slide, they will slice him up. Icy Ramp (DC 22 Acrobatics check or slide; DC 22 Reflex save if sliding to prevent being knocked prone; 2d6 bleed damage (4d6 if prone)); multiple targets (all targets moving on ramp)

item.title: Self Portrait (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A portrait is on the wall. The features of the face are fuzzy and indistinct.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger Visual; Reset None

Effect

The viewer sees the portrait changing into his own likeness, then he is imprisoned as the spell. Once imprisoned, the portrait becomes a portrait of the character. Imprisonment (DC 23 Will Save or become imprisoned in the portrait as per the spell)

item.title: Fire Escape Ladder (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An iron ladder, covered by a protective iron bar cage, leads upward.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

About halfway up, one of the rungs triggers the trap. The iron bands constrict, crushing the character. Constricting Bands (DC 33 Reflex Save or take 4d6 crushing damage per round and character is pinned. DC 33 Strength or Escape artist to escape)

item.title: Rito della Successione available on Adventure-a-week
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded: A new Freeport adventure is here.

item.title: Bag of Holding, but not Bearing
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This finely crafted bag appears to be able to hold much more than its apparent volume.

Type: magical; Perception -; Disable Device -

Effect

This bag functions like a bag of holding in every way except one. When an amount of weight is put into the bag that would be the same as the character's heavy load, the weight suddenly hits the character once he does an action (skill check, combat, etc) where the load would affect the action.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Does Disable Device remove the load restriction & create a normal BoH? Or, does it render the entire bag non-magical in holding capacity?
Since there is no Disable Device difficulty, it can't be changed.

any thoughts on what the DC to not fall/sink/stumble? like base DC10 with +1 per 10lb in the bag? since i would guess it would be a Str based check... or reflex, also would this show up with a Cursed aura?

It should act like a normal cursed item. You could have a check to not fall, stumble, etc, and I'd guess it would be a DC 5 or 10, with a die modifier equal to the negative modifier due to weight just like the skill related checks.

This finely crafted bag appears to be able to hold much more than its apparent volume.
Type: magical; Perception -; Disable Device -
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ This is where I got the idea it could be disabled. Perhaps as an auto success simply for being able to figure out that it was even an option, that it would become obvious to the character as to how to do it successfully. Or perhaps the DC is set by something related to the carrying capacity of the owner/holder of the bag, or their strength score. I.E. A person possessing the bag with a strength score of 12 would need to succeed on a DC "#" (12+half level rounded up perhaps) Disable Device. No matter the way the DC is figured; if it is allowed... what would the resulting effect on the bag be? If the check is not intended to be allowed, then perhaps we should exclude it's being referenced on the item in its entirety.
When I put a "-" in there, I mean that the skill check isn't applicable.

item.title: Peepholes (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Two holes are available to spy on the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

If the holes are used, the characters will briefly see the next room before a pair of stubby fingers pokes them in the eye. Eye Poke (DC 16 Reflex Save or become blinded for 1 turn (2 eyes) or shaken for 1 turn (1 eye))

item.title: Falling Portcullis (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open archway leads out to a courtyard.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

At the top of the archway, a portcullis has been jammed open. Walking under it causes it to fall. Falling Portcullis (DC 17 Reflex Save or take 1d10 damage and become pinned - DC 18 Strength or Escape Artist to escape)

item.title: Zip Line Cart (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A cart, attached to a zipline seems to be the only way to cross the river of lava.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The cart has a braking mechanism. After release, the next time it is pulled, the floor of the cart drops away. If the brake is not pushed, gravity will accelerate the cart such that it breaks when it hits the other side, and the effect is the same, except one will leave them clinging to the cart, the other will have them safely on the other side. Cart Drop (DC 22 Reflex Save or fall into lava, taking 10d6 fire damage per round); multiple targets (all targets in cart)

item.title: Tree Tunnel (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A lone tree sits in a path atop a steep hill. The only easy way is to go through the tunnel that has been hacked out from the tree.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When someone enters the tunnel and gets to the midpoint, solid wood doors slide down on either end.Wooden Doors (DC 18 Reflex save if within 5ft to escape; otherwise trapped. Wooden doors have 20hp and hardness 5, or can be broken with a DC 22 Break check)

item.title: Rubber Cannon Ball (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
As you round the corner, a cannon fires at you!

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 25; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The characters will notice that the corner wall is angled across. When the cannon fires, if it misses the first person in the hall, it will bounce off the corner and go down the other hallway, and won't stop till it hits someone. Cannon Ball (DC 24 Reflex Save or take 10d6 damage)

item.title: Spiky Mud (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The terrain is very muddy.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

Under the mud, in several places are sharp spikes. The mud makes this difficult terrain. Sharp Spikes (+10 vs. AC or take 1d6 damage); multiple targets (check once for every 10' of movement)

item.title: Flinty, Grassy, Steep Hillside (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The hillside is steep, and covered with dry grass

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

In order to travel down the hillside, a DC 20 Acrobatics check must succeed for every 10' of movement. Treat the ground as difficult terrain. Failing the check causes the character to fall, and failing by 5 or more causes the character to fall and slide. There are several place where there is exposed flint. Characters wearing metal armor will spark and set the hillside on fire. The fire will move outwards from the falling character at 15' per round. Characters caught in the flame take 1d6 fire damage.

item.title: Bleeding Mist (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A narrow corridor winds it way downwards.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When tripped, fine dust is released throughout the corridors. This mist causes bleed effects to happen when damaged. Blood Mist (adds 1 bleed damage for each die roll of damage and each +1 to modifiers); multiple targets (all targets in area); Example (magic missile does 2 * (d4 +1) damage, which will cause 3 bleed damage, a sword which does 1d6+3 will do 4 bleed damage)

item.title: April Showers (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Frescoes on the ceiling depict storm clouds, rain and lightning.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the characters venture underneath the frescoes, a storm will start. Treat it as the spell storm of vengenace with save DC's of 23.

item.title: Hump Day (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This long corridor seems to have a gentle roll to its topography.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 33; Disable Device 33

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the characters reach the middle of the hallway, the ground violently shakes, and a small mountain grows up from the floor. Anyone on top of the mountain gets smushed into the ceiling and into the rock above. Mountain (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 10d8 damage plus become pinned and suffocating, requiring a DC 28 Strength or Escape Artist check to escape); multiple targets (all targets within 15')

item.title: Bladder Floor (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There is about a 10 foot drop to the floor below.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor below sits atop a bladder filled with pepper gas. Landing on it from more than 5 feet discharges the gas. Pepper Gas (DC 22 Fortitude Save or become blinded and sickened for 1d8+1 rounds

item.title: Overhang of Force (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The road curves around slightly to the left.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Just around the corner, a wall of force is suspended in midair, at about neck height for someone riding a horse. Wall of force (DC 22 Reflex save or take 1d10 points of damage and be knocked prone from horse, and is dazed for 1 round)

item.title: Torches, Dust and Stairs (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A set of bare, rickety wooden stairs lead up. Underneath the stairs, on the wall, are several lit torches.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

If someone walks up the stairs, dust falls from underneath, onto the torches. There is a 10% cumulative chance each round that the dust will ignite. Igniting Dust (6d6 fire damage, DC 19 Reflex Save for half damage, additionally, anyone on the stairs falls for an additional 1d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets on stairs or within 30')

item.title: Dispelling Welcome Mat (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A well-used welcome mat sits on the ground in front of the door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

When the mat is stepped on, it acts as if a greater dispel magic at CL 11 has been cast on the target.

item.title: Ballista Door (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door at the end of the corridor appears to be locked and stuck.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The door is locked (DC 28) and stuck (DC 28 Break, 8 hardness, 60 hp). If it is opened, it is holding back a ballista bolt, which fires into the character from the ballista behind the door. Ballista (+19 ranged melee, 3d8 (19-20) damage)

item.title: Oil Pool (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A cool pool of liquid is at the end of the natural tunnel

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Close to the end of the tunnel, a jet of flame erupts from the side wall. (DC 18 Reflex save or take 1d6 fire damage and be set on fire, requiring a full-round action to extinguish with a DC 18 Acrobatics check, and dealing 1d6 fire damage at the start of every turn). The pool is filled with a cool, flammable oil. Characters that jump into the pool cause it to explode. Oil Pool (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 4d8 fire damage, and be set on fire. Furthermore, everything within 30' is covered in flaming oil. Treat each 5' square of flaming oil as the jet of flame above. The oil will burn out in 1d6+3 rounds); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Invisible Web (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It appears that the only way to reach the room below is to jump down...

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The characters are at an overlook that hangs over the middle of a room, which is 20' down. When a character lands on the floor, it activates a web spell which fills the room. If a character flies or climbs down, the web is not triggered.

item.title: Acid Lock (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is locked. The lock appears old and pitted.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Acid sprays from the lock. Acid Spray (DC 18 Reflex save or become blinded for 1 hour and take 1d6 acid damage)

item.title: Wooden Ramp (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden ramp leads down to the floor below.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The ramp is steep and slick. Wooden Ramp (DC 19 Acrobatics check or fall and slide down ramp, taking 1d6 + 1 bleed damage from splinters)

item.title: Live Wire (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The characters arrive to the edge of a narrow chasm. There is a rope hanging from the cave ceiling that they could probably use to swing across.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The rope is made of silk and steel wire. The rope has been charged so that the first person to use it will get electrocuted. Rope (DC 16 Acrobatics check to swing on rope or fall. 6d6 electrical damage - DC 17 Fortitude save for half, then a DC 18 Reflex save or fall); Fall (4d10 falling damage - 40')

item.title: Brick in the Face, Brick in the Face (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is locked.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16(19); Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The door is trapped with the same trap twice. A brick will hit the character in the face unless it is disarmed twice. However, the trap must be searched for again (you can do a passive perception check, or give them a bonus if the actually look again). If it is not disarmed at all, it triggers twice. Brick in the face (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage)

item.title: Metallic Filings (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Fine mist swirls around in the air.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The mist is composed of very fine metal shavings. Unless specific precautions are taken, they get into everything, hair, eyes, nose, etc. At the exit to the room, a very powerful magnet activates briefly, ripping away any hand-held metal items, and all the shavings. Magnet (4d8 bleed damage plus characters are blinded and deafened for 1d6 + 3 rounds, DC 22 Fortitude Save for half damage, and negates the bleed, blind, and deafened conditions. Additionally, anyone holding metal objects must make a DC 22 Strength check or drop the object, and anyone wearing metal armor must make another DC 22 Strength check or be knocked prone); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Razor Portcullis (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A portcullis blocks the hallway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The portcullis can be lifted with a DC 22 Strength check. However, if it succeeds, razor blades spring out of the bars when it is lifted about a foot. Razors (+8 vs AC for 1d6 bleed damage); multiple targets (all targets lifting portcullis)

item.title: Oily Water (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor is a few inches deep in oily water.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The oily water adheres to footwear, causing the character to take a -2 penalty to Acrobatics check, and slowing down movement speed by 1/2. Removing the oil from footwear takes 1d6 +2 rounds.

item.title: Fireball Mine (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is made of fine tile.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

One of the tiles has been set with a fireball mine, that will go off when stepped on. Fireball Mine (13d6 damage, DC 20 Reflex Save for half damage)

item.title: Braced Trap Door (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A trap door is in the ceiling, braced by a 4x4 beam that is wedged into the floor to prevent access from above.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The beam not only prevents opening of the trap door, it is actually supporting the ceiling. If it is removed to open the trap door, the ceiling will collapse. Ceiling Collapse(3d6 damage plus target is knocked prone, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage and to avoid being knocked prone); multiple targets(all targets in room)

item.title: White Room (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The characters enter a featureless room, and then the only exit disappears!

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The way out of this room is to draw a door, window, or some other exit on the wall. Once done, it will become real, and then they can use it to leave the room. The walls radiate moderate transmutation.

item.title: Slamming Door (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open doorway is in front of you.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the doorway is traversed, it causes the door to slam shut. Slamming Door(+4 melee for 1d6 non-lethal damage, character must make a CMD check of 20 or movement is stopped)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: The inside of each door teleports the character to the other door, facing inwards, back into the traps. This makes it impossible to leave the room by normal means, they will have to use some kind of magic or device to escape the room, and will have to quite possibly face all the room traps again.

item.title: Spring Loaded Tile (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The room has large tiles, and a single door at the far end.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

One of the tiles in front of the door is spring-loaded, and will activate when stepped on, blasting the character into the door. Spring-Loaded Tile (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 4d6 damage, be knocked prone and be dazed for 1d6-2 rounds)

item.title: Descending Ceiling (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
As you reach the center of the room, the ceiling begins to descend.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The ceiling can easily be held up (DC 17 Strength check) by a character. However, the pressure of the ceiling causes the thin floor tiles to snap, pushing the character into the spikes below. Should no one support the ceiling, it will crush a character into the spikes. Foot Spikes (+12 vs. CMD for grapple. Once grappled, character takes 1d6 bleed damage per round. It requires a DC 22 CMB check to escape, or DC 32 if the ceiling is being held. Characters crushed by the ceiling take an additional 1d6 damage per round, with the same CMD/CMB checks required)

item.title: Portcullis Pit (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A closed portcullis blocks the way.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the portcullis is opened, the floor on either side opens up into a funnel shaped pit. Moments after the pit opens, the portcullis slams all the way down into the pit. Portcullis Pit (DC 22 Reflex save or take 1d6 falling damage and 3d6+3 damage from the portcullis)

item.title: Cursed Gold (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You see a small pot of gold.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger proximity; Reset Special

Effect

These gold pieces are cursed. Each time a gold coin is spent, is causes 1 bleed damage. Gold Coins (DC  12 Fortitude Save or take 1 bleed damage every time coins are spent)

item.title: Icy Shallow Pit (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor is cold.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

In the middle of the corridor, the floor caves in, creating a 20' diameter depression about 5 foot deep. The edges are smooth and sloped. (DC 18 Reflex save or be knocked prone. It requires a DC 28 Escape Artist or Acrobatics check to stand up, and a second to escape)

item.title: Magnetic Door (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor ends in a sturdy, metal door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

This locked and stuck door becomes magnetized when struck. Characters wearing metal armor are stuck to it, as are metal weapons. Magnetized Door(DC 16 Strength check or armor/weapon remains stuck)

item.title: Portrait of Despair (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Large portraits cover the wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

One of the portraits shows an old man with a dour expression. Portrait (DC 16 Will Save or take a -2 penalty on attack/damage rolls, skill checks, saving throws and ability checks for 4 minutes)

item.title: Living Rope (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A rope hangs down the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the rope is used, it wraps around the character, and then smacks him against the wall. Rope(DC 14 Reflex Save or become entangled. Each round entangled take 1d6 points of damage. DC 14 Escape Artist or CMD to escape, however, if no other precautions are taken, character will fall 30' taking std falling damage)

item.title: Stalactites (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several sharp stalactites cover the tall ceiling of the cavern.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Underneath one of the stalactites, a reverse gravity spell triggers. Reverse Gravity(DC 21 Reflex Save or "fall" upwards into the stalactite, taking 15d6 damage)

item.title: Roller Floor (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is made up of several small cylinders.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The cylinders rotate when stepped upon, making movement difficult. Rotating cylinders(DC 15 Acrobatics check or character cannot move. If failed by 5 or more, character falls prone, requiring a DC 15 Acrobatics check to stand. Area is treated as difficult terrain)

item.title: Broken Glass (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Broken glass litters the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Broken glass litters the floor. Treat as difficult terrain. Broken Glass(For each movement action, +8 vs. AC or take 1 bleed damage); multiple targets(all targets in room)

item.title: Black Ice Patches (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The air is quite cool in here.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The floor has several patches of ice. If a character moves at half speed, a DC 15 Acrobatics check will let them navigate the room. At full speed, it is a DC 30 Acrobatics check. Make this check for each movement action. Failure results in the character being knocked prone.

item.title: Alarm (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door appears to be locked.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger proximity; Reset None

Effect

The door has been trapped with an alarm. If the password isn't spoken, a fine mist of blue dye covers a 15' cone in front of the door, coloring everyone blue. Blue Mist (DC 14 Reflex Save or be dyed blue. Dye wears off in 1d6 + 1 days); multiple targets (all targets in 15' cone)

item.title: Carbon Dioxide (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The caverns head down into the earth.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The air in the caves slowly is replaced by carbon dioxide. Every round, characters must make a DC 15 fortitude save, or be pushed one more category down. The categories are: Fatigued->Exhausted->Unconscious->Dead.

item.title: Pot of Gold (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A rainbow leads to a pot of gold.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger proximity; Reset None

Effect

If anyone touches the gold, it activates a color spray, with a DC 13 Will Save.

item.title: Electric Ladder (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A metal ladder leads down into the sewers.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

About halfway down the ladder, it will become electrified. Those on it take 3d6 electrical damage per round. In order to let go, or move, characters must make a DC 18 Strength check for each movement action. Characters that let go will fall.

item.title: 180 Teleporter (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small, deep chasm is in front of you. It looks like it can be easily jumped.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

There is a teleported on the far side of the chasm. It immediately teleports the character to the same spot, but rotated 180 degrees. In order for the jump to succeed, the character must traverse the chasm twice, once on the way to the portal and then back to the original jump point, thus use 2 times the distance for the DC. Those that fail fall into the chasm, either by failing the original distance, or hitting the portal and then falling.

item.title: Locked Gate (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large wooden gate leads into the castle, and is locked.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

If the gate is unlocked, the trap will trigger, dropping a portcullis down from overhead. Portcullis (3d6 damage + knocked prone and pinned, DC 22 Escape Artist or Strength check to escape, DC 22 Reflex Save negates)

item.title: Statuary (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The garden is filled with several life-like statues set atop pedestals. A few of the pedestals are empty.

Type: magical; Perception DC 33; Disable Device 33

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

If one of the empty pedestals is approached, a time stasis is cast upon the character, with a DC 26 Fortitude Save at CL 15.

item.title: Disquieting Fresco (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The frescos on the wall appear to change as you approach.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset 1 day

Effect

When the frescos are examined, they appear to show the character's likeness being slain by a monster or trap. Fresco(DC 12 Will Save or become shaken for 1 minute)

item.title: Dutch Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden dutch door is in the middle of the wall with the top half open.
