Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The top of the lower door appears to be serrated. When the bottom door is opened, the top door slams shut. Door Slam(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 bleed damage and be knocked prone).

item.title: Lightning Web (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The last 40 feet of the corridor is filled with thick webs.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The web cannot be destroyed by normal fire but acts as a web spell at CL 11. The web can be cleared away 5' at a time as a full round action. Each round, the web discharges electricity. Web Discharge(11d6 electricity damage, DC 20 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets in web)

item.title: Icy Reflection (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A frozen pool reflects almost perfectly, but strange auras surround the reflections.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the ice is disturbed, it breaks apart, spraying everyone in a 20' radius with shards of ice. Ice shower(3d6 cold plus 2d6 bludgeoning damage); multiple targets(all targets in a 20' radius)

item.title: Fog Floor (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor appears to made from fog.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device -

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The floor is solid fog, and appears to support weight. After 10' of travel, those walking on the fog begin to fall at a rate of 5'/round, and the fog is treated as difficult terrain. The fog is 15' deep. After falling 15' it opens up into a vast cavern, where a 100' drop awaits. Once falling into the fog has started, one cannot climb out without external assistance.

item.title: Illusionary Floor (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You are overlooking a sitting room, about a 10 foot drop down.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The floor is actually 60 feet down, and it has been painted to create the illusion of a sitting room that is only 10 foot down.

item.title: Moving Force Belts (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The party has entered what looks to be a large, empty warehouse type space.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The entire room is filled with conveyor belts made from force. For each 5 foot moved, there is a 50% chance that someone steps on an invisible conveyor belt. When the belt is stepped on, a DC 17 Reflex Save is required to avoid it, or to get on it without falling prone. Once on a belt, it moves in a straight line at 15' per round, just before the character's turn. Each round, before it moves, there is a 50% chance that the belt ends after the movement, requiring another DC 17 Reflex save, or the character falls prone. If the belt runs into a wall, the character takes 1d6 damage, or can make a DC 17 Reflex save to exit the belt.

item.title: Flickering Torch Pits (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The flickering torches cast ever changing shadows in the room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The shadows cast by the torches create several 10' radius shadows that act as 20' deep pits. The shadows can be avoided with a DC 15 Acrobatics check. However, every round the shadows change. There is a 50% chance that each character will be in shadow when this happens. It requires a DC 13 Reflex save to avoid falling in the pit.

item.title: Acid Glass (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pile of gold coins lies in the next room. A plate glass window seems to be the only way in.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The plate glass has a layer of pressurized acid between the two panes. Breaking it causes it to spray outward, sending acid and glass everywhere. Acid Glass(2d6 acid + 1d6 bleed damage, DC 19 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets within 20')

item.title: Window Illusion (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open window leads over to a small bedroom next to this room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character comes over to the window, it sets off a set of huge blades that come crashing down on the character. The only escape is through the window. Both the window and blades are illusions. Behind the window is a pool of acid. If the characters fail a DC 18 Will save, they will believe that there is a window, and that real blades are coming down on them. They go through the window if they make their reflex save and take damage. If they fail, they take the blade damage. If they succeed on the will save, they recognize the window as an illusion, and the blades when they come down. Blade Attack (6d6 damage, DC 18 Reflex Save to jump through window); Pool of Acid (3d6 acid damage, plus 3d6 per round. Also 1d6 of acid splash damage to targets within 10')

item.title: Wall Illusion (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open window leads over to a small bedroom next to this room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character comes over to the window, it sets off a set of huge blades that come crashing down on the character. The only escape is through the window. The window is an illusion and is actually a wall.  The wall next to the window is actually a corridor entrance. If the characters fail their will save, they will believe that the window is a window and the wall is a wall. If they make a DC 18 Will Save, they will recognize the false window and wall. When the blades come down, they can escape through the corridor. If not, they will automatically fail their reflex save for the blades. Blade Attack (6d6 damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for half damage)

item.title: Door Illusion (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door is set into the middle of the wall, stuck fast.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character traverses the doorway, he is dimension doored to the ceiling, which is 30ft up. If he's running while going through the door (either by running or by trying to force the door open by running into it), add an additional 10ft to the fall. There is actually only a wall behind the door illusion, those that make a DC 17 Will save will detect the illusion.

item.title: Stair Illusion (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A steep staircase leads down into the darkness

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The close wall actually has a ladder that can be easily descended. However, if the stairs are used, the first 5 steps are real, and the rest are an illusion that can be discovered with a DC 17 Will Save. Once the character hits the sixth stair, he needs to make a DC 18 Reflex Save or fall whatever distance you deem appropriate.

item.title: Deck of Ouch (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A deck of cards sits on a small end table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

When a character flips over a card, they take damage equal to the face value of the card unless they make a DC 11 Will Save. Ace=1, Jack=11, Queen=12, King=13. The face cards also animate and mock the character as they do damage.

item.title: Salt in the Wounds (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Jagged rock formations protrude from all directions; passage is difficult.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 12; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The caves are littered with sharp protrusions made of salt. Moving through the area at half speed requires a DC 15 Acrobatics check (25 if full speed) per movement action or the character gets cuts for 1 bleed damage. A DC 17 Fortitude save is required, or the character also becomes shaken, due to the salt in the wound. Magical healing will remove the shaken condition, as will a DC 15 heal check. This heal check is in addition to the normal heal check to removed the bleeding condition.

item.title: Wall Pit (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open doorway leads to a long hallway, with brick floor, walls and ceiling.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character enters the hallway, gravity changes such that the far end of the hallway, which is 100' away, is down. The end of the hallway is also spiked. Wall Pit(DC 20 Reflex Save or take 10d6 damage plus 3d6+3 bleed damage and be knocked prone)

item.title: Stone Door (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stone door is set on the far wall, it looks a bit rough and unfinished.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character pushes on the door to open it, it becomes soft clay, causing the hands to sink in. It then immediately reverts back to stone, trapping the hands. Once trapped, they can be chipped away (causing one quarter of the damage to the character, unless a DC 15 appropriate Craft or Profession skill check is passed) or released by a suitable spell, like Stone Shape, Stone to Flesh, etc. Soft Stone Door(DC 13 Reflex Save or hands stuck in stone)

item.title: Reactive Dust (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The caverns are very dusty as thick clouds of the stuff seem to hang in the air.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The dust coats everything and is highly reactive to water. If the characters get wet, either by jumping into a pool, pouring water over them, etc, the dust explodes. Dust Explosion (1d6 damage if poured on - rain, a jug of water, etc - to the character and in a 20' radius. Those in the blast receive a DC 18 Reflex save for half damage; If immersed, the damage increases to 3d6 and the save to DC 20)

item.title: No Air (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You've entered a 5 foot wide, twisty maze of corridors.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character turn the corner into one of the dead ends, he is presented with something of interest, a chest, levers on the wall, coins, etc. Once he enters the dead end, an antilife shell formed as thin wall blocks the exit. It lasts for 12 minutes. At the same time, the air in the dead end is evacuated over the course of 1 minute. This can be stopped with a (DC 33 - round) Perception check. A DC 33 Perception check is required to find the mechanism which can then be disabled with a DC 33 Disable Device check. If the Disable Device check succeeds by 5 or more, the airflow can be reversed. The air drains 10% per round, so after 10 rounds there is no air. After 5 rounds, the character gains the suffocating condition.

item.title: Fire Wall and Tanglefoots (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An archway leads to the next room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character begins to enter the archway, a Wall of Fire (CL 9) springs up 5 feet in front of you (dealing 2d4 damage to all within 10 feet and 1d4 damage up to 20 feet) and lasts for 9 rounds. At the same time, sacks full of tanglefoot bags fall from a hidden cache in the ceiling with a +10 ranged touch attack bonus. The bags hit all characters within 10 feet of the triggering character.

item.title: After You... (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door is in front of you.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is opened, a large pendulum swings down, striking the character in front of the door and pushing him through the open doorway 5 feet. Pendulum Attack (+8 vs. CMD or be pushed 5 feet, if the attack succeeds by 5 or more the character is also knocked prone)

item.title: Splintering Door (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A weathered wooden door beckons you to open it.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The door requires a DC 18 Strength check to open. When it does open, though, it sends a shower of splinters out in all directions. Splinters (DC 17 Reflex Save or take 1d6 bleed damage); multiple targets (all targets within 15')

item.title: Saloon Doors (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A set of saloon doors leads into the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the doors are pulled open, nothing happens. However, if they are pushed, it unlocks a spring, causing them to spin wildly and forcefully. Saloon Doors (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage and be knocked prone)

item.title: Sliding Floor (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door seems to be the only exit in the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the characters enter this large room, the door shuts and becomes stuck. It requires a DC 22 Strength check to break open the door. However, if someone tries to push against the door, the floor underneath them slides, pushing them back 5 feet. The only way to open the door is to destroy it or disable the sliding tile.

item.title: Last Step Escalator (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A set of steep stairs leads up to the next leve.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character steps on the last step, it moves up as if it were an escalator. Escalator Step (DC 19 Reflex Save or be knocked prone; if failed by 5 or more, fall down the stairs for 1d6 damage as well, others on the stairs must also make a DC 19 Reflex save with the same conditions or be knocked prone or fall down the stairs)

item.title: Pipe Bomb (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You have entered a parlor; a smoking jacket is draped over a leather chair and a smoking pipe has been carefully placed on a small, round table.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Two rounds after the a character enters the room, the pipe explodes. Exploding Pipe(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage; DC 16 Fortitude Save or become sickened by the smoke); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Whisper Alcoves (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You see several guards in the distance. The walls have several, large concave spots hollowed out of them.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The concave hollows reflect sound to the guards. If the characters do not speak, they need to make normal Stealth checks against the guards perception. If they speak, however, the guards' perception will be at +10.

item.title: Ultrasonic Vibrations (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A long corridor is before you.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When walking down the hallway, every 5' there is a vibration burst, shattering any small non-magical objects less than 1lb in a 5' radius.

item.title: Fire Hose Door (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A round, valve type wheel seems to be the way to open up the metal door at the end of the hallway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When a the valve wheel is turned, water shoots out. Water Jet(DC 19 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage, be knocked prone and be pushed back 5 feet); multiple targets(15' cone)

item.title: Lake Barrier (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The cliff edge overlooks a placid lake, dozens of feet down.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The lake below is cold and deep. It has also been covered with a type of antilife shell. Non-living stuff passes through it just fine, however, when someone jumps... Lake Barrier (6d6 falling damage)
