wp:comment.wp:comment_content: […] Lake Barrier Trap […]

item.title: Invisible and Extremely Sharp (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The cave entrance opens into irregularly shaped passages.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Nearly invisible strands litter the passages. These strands are extremely thin and sharp. Each 5' of movement causes an attack that deals 1 cumulative bleed damage. Each bleed damage has a 10% cumulative chance of being detected. Sharp Attack (+16 melee for 1 cumulative bleed damage); multiple targets (all targets moving in passageway)

item.title: Escher Stairs (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A staircase leads up, then abruptly turns right.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The stairs are an illusion. It appears that you are on an endless staircase, going up and up. In fact, the staircase ends after two flights. However, unless the illusion is disbelieved or dispelled, the characters will be stuck in an endless staircase loop. Escher Stairs (DC 20 Wisdom Save to disbelieve, CL 13 to dispel)

item.title: Rock Falls; Into Pit (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The stones of the hallway appear pitted with age.

Type: magical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character sets off the trap, a large rock falls from the ceiling, and breaks the floor, causing the character to fall into the 20' pit, and covers up the hole. To complicate matters, the walls of the pit slope outward from the top, and are smooth. Rock Falls(DC 22 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage, plus 2d6 falling damage) The walls of the pit cannot be climbed normally, nor is there any place in the ceiling where a grappling hook can be used. The rock requires a DC 30 Strength check to move.

item.title: Black Dragon Hilt Sword (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This is a guest entry from Brian Wiborg Mønster, submitted on Adventure-a-Week.
This golden masterwork hilt has a carving of a dragon’s body along the grip ending in a pommel shaped like a dragon’s head with open maw, ready to breathe. The dragon’s outstretched wings serve as the sword’s guard.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 18

Trigger special; Reset Repair

Effect

The first time a character wielding the sword rolls a natural one, the slight differences in pressure points along the hilt triggers an acid shower through the pommel from a reservoir hidden in the grip. Acid Shower(6D6 acid damage).

item.title: Gas Pockets (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several, small, natural tubes are in the cave walls.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

An odorless, flammable gas has built up in the lower pockets of these tubes. Thrusting a fire-based light source inside to see what is in there will ignite the pocket. Gas Pocket(6d6 fire damage, DC 19 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets within 30')

item.title: Razor Portcullis (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An iron portcullis blocks the way.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The portcullis requires a DC 25 Strength check to open. If the check succeeds, the bars shift, revealing razors that cut anyone lifting or assisting. Razor Portcullis(DC 21 Reflex Save or take 1 bleed damage, and a -2 penalty to attacks and Dex-based rolls until magical healing is applied); multiple targets(all targets lifting or assisting)

item.title: Wildfire (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Thick smoke hangs in the air, sting the eyes and lungs. In the distance, a wall of flame rapidly approaches.

Type: mechahical; Perception DC 5; Disable Device -

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

A d100 * 5 foot wall of fire moves 1d10 * 5 feet per round in a single direction. Characters caught in the fire take 10d6 fire damage per round for 1d4+1 rounds, after which they will take 1d6 fire damage for 1d10 rounds.

item.title: The Red Fountain (CR *)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This is a another guest entry from Brian Wiborg Mønster, submitted on Adventure-a-Week.
A small shelf on the wall in a dungeon corridor has potions setting on it. There are as many potion bottles as there are characters. These potions are fully working potions of gaseous form. A piece of parchment shows that the 4” holes in the ceiling every 20’ are to be used with the potions in case of emergencies.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset automatic

Effect
About 8’ up in the holes, which lead to another level in the dungeon, is a targeted Dispel Magic vs. Gaseous Form. The DC is 16 if using a potion, and the modifier is +8 for the dispel magic roll. The holes all end in a room with an empty fountain, hence the nickname of red fountain when an adventurer tries to fit into the small tube in his normal size. Alternate version: It also works if the party is following an adversary in the dungeon and the corridor ends with a single hole and the potions give a clue to how the adversary got away, of course he just took the secret door in the wall, but the party will hopefully surmise that he took the hole in the ceiling.

item.title: Yes my Leech (CR 6 + CR4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This is another guest entry from Brian Wiborg Mønster, submitted on Adventure-a-Week.
This stone corridor looks like so many that have come before you.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 25; Disable Device 20

Trigger location; Reset automatic

Effect
A 10’ by 10’ piece of the floor swings open and closes after swallowing up any characters standing on it, (DC 22 Reflex save to avoid falling in). It starts with a 30’ steep slope covered in razor-sharp protrusions, the protrusions will deal one hit per 10ft fallen (3 hits at +14 that deals 2D6 + 1 bleed, the bleed damage is cumulative from these hits.) The hits are resolved vs. the character’s flatfooted AC due to falling. The bottom of the pit is covered in 4’ of stagnant swamp water, which seeps through the pit via 4” circular holes along the bottom of the pit. In the water is a swarm of leeches, now just sit back and watch as the bleed damage and the Str, Dex and Con drain from the leeches slowly drains the character(s). We will throw down a rope they say, remember the razor sharp protrusions I say.

item.title: Inconvenient Torch Mounts (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A lit torch is mounted closely on each side of the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset Auto or None

Effect

When a character enters the room from the non torch side, they run into the torches with their head, if they are over 5' tall. Torch(DC 17 Reflex Save or take 1 damage and becomes staggered for one round. If they fail the save by 5 or more, the torch falls out, setting the curtains on the wall on fire. In the case of fire, the trap is counted as not reset)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: If there's something on the ground to be wary of, such as caltrops, they will be more likely to be looking down. Maybe the ground is slippery or there are critters or debris....

item.title: Bent Nails (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridors here are tight and irregularly shaped.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The walls of the corridors have several bent and rusted nails sticking out of the walls. If noticed, a character can make a DC 15 Acrobatics check for each move action to avoid being cut by the nails. Otherwise, they must make Reflex Saves. Bent Nails(DC 16 Reflex Save each move action or take 1 point of damage, and make a DC 12 Fortitude Save or take 1 Dex Damage); multiple targets (all targets walking down corridor)

wp:comment.wp:comment_author: Trap Tuesday #8: Using everyday objects to inflict harm – Bent Nails | Adventure-A-Week

item.title: Just Waxed Floor (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wooden floor in this room is highly polished and clean.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 22

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The floor has been polished and waxed. Normal movement is not affected, however, any other actions, including spell casting with somatic components, combat actions or running are affected. Waxed Floor (DC 15 Acrobatics check or fall prone)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: […] Just Waxed Floor […]

item.title: Spinning Door (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wooden door appears stuck in place.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

The wooden door is quite stuck. To the left of the door, near the hinges is a wall illusion. When the door is forced open, it spins all the way around, through the illusion to smack the character from behind, pushing him into the room, which, by the way, starts out with a steep flight of stairs. Spinning Door(+16 vs. CMD or fall down stairs, taking 3d6 points of damage, knocked prone and staggered)

item.title: Sneak Attack Lock (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door appears to be locked with a very complex mechanical lock.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 38; Disable Device 36

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

If the Disable Device check is failed by 5 or more, the lock appears to be opened. However, when the door is opened, a long needle will pierce the character. Needle(1d4 +5d6 damage)

item.title: Simulacrum Mirrors (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Many mirrors cover the walls of this room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

At any point in the room, the character will have 1d4+1 reflections. Each reflection is a simulacrum of the character and will follow them around as 2d images until a remove curse or dispel magic is cast against CL 13. Any damage done to a simulacrum is also done to the character. The images also impart a -10 Stealth penalty. Simulacrum Images(DC 20 Will Save or 1d4+1 reflections appear)

item.title: Powdered Scroll (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A rolled up scroll sits on the table.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 36; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The scroll itself has spells on it and radiates magic of the appropriate type and strength. However, when unrolled, white powder spills out. White Powder(Releases Nightmare Vapor - DC 20 Fortitude Save, 2 consecutive saves for cure or 1 Wis damage and confused for 1 round; 1/round for 6 rounds)

item.title: Thumb Screw (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorknob is recessed in the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character turns the doorknob, a sharp screw penetrates the thumb. Thumb Screw(DC 21 Reflex or take 1 Dex damage and becomes Entangled. A DC 21 Disable Device or Escape Artist will negate the Entangled condition. A DC 18 Strength check will also negate it, but will deal 1d4 points of damage plus 1 more Dex)

item.title: Trick Dresser (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stout oaken dresser sits up against the far wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

When a character opens a drawer, a random drawer kicks out, striking them. Random Drawer (+8 vs. melee or take 1d4 non-lethal damage and become dazed for 1 round)

item.title: Enervation Lift (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An elevator is at the end of the corridor, with room for but a single person.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The elevator has 4 buttons, labelled 1,2,3 and 4. When pressed, they drain the corresponding number of levels. Enervation Lift(+16 ranged touch attack or lose either 1,2,3 or 4 levels, depending on the button)

item.title: Pit and Sliding Floor (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A 10 foot wide pit is in the middle of the hallway. The hallway turns to the right about 10 feet beyond the pit.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The tiles on the far side of the pit are floating on a track and slide forward when someone jumps over the pit and lands on them. They carry the character straight into the wall, which has several small spikes on it (DC 33 Perception check to notice from the other side of the pit) The pit itself is 80' deep. Sliding Floor (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall prone; If not prone: DC 22 Reflex save or take 1d6+3 damage and 1 bleed damage, prone characters take 1d3 damage, as they miss the spikes)

item.title: Pit Illusion (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A 10' pit is in the middle of the room, with a chest at the bottom.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The pit bottom is an illusion. The pit is actually 60' deep. If you are nice, you can have a treasure chest down there, too. Pit Illusion (DC 11 Will Save if interacted with)

item.title: Door Pit (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open window leads over to a small bedroom next to this room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the door is opened, a 10'x10' space in front of the door turns into a 20' deep pit as in the Spiked Pit spell at CL5. Spiked Pit(DC 14 Reflex save or take 2d6 damage +2d6 piercing damage); multiple targets(all targets in 10'x10' area)

item.title: Spider Web and Pit (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A 10' wide deep pit blocks the corridor

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The far side of the pit is covered floor to ceiling in a thin, giant spiderweb. Characters will either break through, stick, or bounce off the web. The pit is 40' deep. Spider Web (CMB vs. 22 CMD; Success - break through web; Fail by 5 or less - stuck to web, DC 22 Escape Artist or Strength Check to escape; Fail by more than 5 - fall, taking 4d6 damage)

item.title: Static Electricity (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Your hair stands on end; the air itself seems to be charged.

Type: magical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

Whenever metal surfaces are touched in this room, there is a discharge of electricity. Static Electricity (Take 11d6 electrical damage, DC 19 Fortitude Save for half)

item.title: Dagger in Wall Illusion (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An ornate dagger has been stabbed into the wall. It looks quite valuable.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

It is an illusion. The actual dagger is just a normal dagger, and it is stuck in backwards. When somebody grabs and pulls, the illusion dispels. Dagger Illusion (DC 17 Will Save to disbelieve, 2d4 damage + 1 bleed damage if handled)

item.title: Unbalanced Stair Steps (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A rickety wooden staircase leads down into the darkness.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The tops of the stairs are loose and not attached. When the characters go down the stairs, there is a 50% chance per step that it will slip or topple. Unbalanced Steps (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, taking 2d6 damage)

item.title: Sodium Bucket (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large bucket dangles from the end of a rope over a well.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character gets close enough to the well to look down, the bucket falls and hits the water some 20' below. The sodium explodes on contact. Exploding bucket(6d6 damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Hex Floor (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is made of hex-shaped stone tiles.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Should a character step on 2 separate tiles, his arms will fly up in the air and he will drop anything he is holding as he becomes stunned. Hex Tiles (80% chance each movement, DC 22 Fortitude Save or become stunned for 1d6 rounds); multiple targets (all targets within 60')

item.title: Hall of Mirrors (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several ornate mirrors hang from the walls

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

The first character to look into a mirror is affected by the smug narcissism spell (DC 17 Will Save). Due to the number of mirrors in this room, the character will not leave until the spell expires (90 minutes) or is dispelled.

item.title: Curtains (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A cloth curtain covers the open doorway.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The curtain is actually a piece of cloth that has had a silk to steel-like spell cast on it. Characters running through the cloth must make a Break check of DC 25 or be dazed if the attempt to run through it.

item.title: Uneven Stair (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A staircase leads down.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 10

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

One of the stairs in the middle of the staircase spaced either 50% more or less than all the other stairs. When moving quickly (double move or faster, or any kind of movement during combat) there is a chance the character will lose his balance. Uneven Stair(DC 18 Reflex save or trip and fall, taking 1d6 damage and being knocked prone at the bottom of the staircase)

item.title: Boots of Extra Springing (Item)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A nice pair of leather boots is tucked in the back of the closet.

 

Effect

These appear to be boots of striding and springing. However, when the jump action is taken, the boots become extra springy, sending the character 2d6*10 feet in the air. Upon landing, the character takes the appropriate falling damage.

item.title: Sticky Doorknob (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small door leads to the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the doorknob is turned, it excretes a sticky substance, and then the door swings open rapidly, pulling the character into the room and into the door. Sticky Doorknob(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d3 damage and become dazed for 1 round)

item.title: Really Cold Iron Blanch (Item)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several vials are on a shelf

Type: magical; Perception DC 35; Disable Device -

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The vials act as a Cold Iron Blanch for a weapon, giving it the Cold Iron property. However, it also makes the weapon very cold. On a successful hit, the weapon gains the broken condition, and, of course, the Cold Iron property is removed.

item.title: Echo Chamber (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This cave has irregularly shaped walls with many recesses in them.

Type: magical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Sounds in this cavern reverberate strangely. Somatic spells require a concentration check to cast, and all sound-based checks are at +2 difficulty.

item.title: The Cake is not a Lie (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A chocolate cake sits just behind the counter.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The cake acts like a Zone of Truth spell cast at CL 3.

item.title: Steam Door (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door appears to be locked

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The door shoots out a small jet of steam. Steam Jet (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage)

item.title: Sail Cave (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The tunnel opens up into a big cavern, overlooking a deep, wide chasm. The wind blows out of the tunnel.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character steps out of the tunnel, he gets wrapped up in a netting attached to a large, sail-like kite that propels the character out over the chasm before the lines of the net detach from the kite. Sail Cave (DC 22 Reflex save or fall and take 6d6 damage)

item.title: Skittering Ceiling (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You just catch some motion on the ceiling out of the corner of your eye, it's too dark to make out.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

There are several small, harmless spiders on the ceiling. However, they spin a very thin, translucent web that is hard to see and covers the ceiling. If a player sticks a torch, or some other exposed flame near the ceiling to see better, they ceiling webs catch on fire. Web Fire(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 points of damage, +10 vs. CMB or continue to burn for 1d6 points of damage each round. It takes a standard action to extinguish the flames on an individual. The fire spreads 5 ft per round)

item.title: Web Illusion (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
One side of the room is covered in webs. They block the door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The webs are an illusion, covering a pile of magical scrolls. If the web is set alight to remove them, they will burst into flame, dispelling the illusion and revealing leftover ashes of what was once scrolls. If the web is examined, a DC 14 Will save will disbelieve the illusion.

item.title: Mud Floor (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor in this room appears to be muddy.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor is covered in deep mud. Characters walking in the room must make a DC 22 Escape Artist or Strength check for each 5' of movement or they become immobilized. Treat the floor as difficult terrain.

item.title: Ground and Pound (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor in here is made of wide wooden planks.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the trap is set off, somewhere in the middle of the room, the floor boards begin to rock violently. Anyone in the room gets tripped, and then they get hit by the boards while they are on the ground. Floorboard Attack(+16 CMB to trip; while character is on the ground they take 1d6 damage per round; it is a CMB vs. 26 CMD to stand upright again. Treat area as difficult terrain) multiple targets(all targets in room)

item.title: Weapon Carpet (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The carpet in this room is decorated with pictures of weapons.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

Anytime a character steps on one of the weapons, it attacks him. It is a DC 10 Acrobatics check to avoid stepping on a weapon per 5'. Weapon Attack (+20 vs. melee, dmg as weapon type)

item.title: Covered Wagon (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An abandoned covered wagon sits in a small clearing. Painted on one side are the words, "Remember my name".

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character gets within 10', he may trip a long tripwire circled around the wagon. If he does, several autoloading crossbows begin to fire out of each side, sweeping from side to side. Crossbows (+16 ranged melee for 1d8 damage for 6 rounds); multiple targets(all targets within 60')

item.title: Paired Battle Axes (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Two battle axes have been crossed and mounted on the wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The axes are mounted on a rotating disk and covered in a sticky substance that is very hard to see. When grabbed, they adhere to the hand and the disk rotates quickly. Rotating axes(+12 vs. CMD or be knocked prone and dazed for one round) The axes can both be masterwork, if you like.

item.title: It Just Went Off (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The hallway has some odd scorch marks and other damage.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character sets this trap off, a single magic item he is carrying will activate (expending a charge is applicable). If the magic item requires a target, the person carrying it is the target. Went Off(+5 CL check vs. CL of item.)

item.title: Broken Mirror (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A cracked mirror hangs on the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

Any character that looks into the mirror will have a piece of his equipment break. Broken Mirror(DC 13 Will Save or a major item carried by the character gains the broken condition)

item.title: Anti Spellbook (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A spellbook sits on the desk.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the spellbook is read, it will appear to contain spells that match whatever the character has currently memorized. When a spell is examined, it will erase a random spell from memory. Erase spell (DC 15 Will Save or lose a random memorized spell, or expend a random spell slot if spells do not need to be prepared)

item.title: Shooting Star (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The ceiling of this room depicts many shooting stars in motion.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The shooting star effect is an illusion, however, if the characters stand and look at it (i.e. they decide to examine or search) a single throwing star shoots out. Shooting star (+12 ranged melee for 1d6 damage)

item.title: Small Door Portal (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door appears to be stuck. One good kick should open it.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character kicks the door, it creates a small portal. The foot goes through the door and comes back out the same side, kicking the character. Kick Me( +chars CMB vs. CMD or become dazed for one round)

item.title: Stuck Window (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An old window at the end of the hall looks down on an overgrown courtyard.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Opening the window requires a DC 17 Strength check or a DC 21 Knowledge(Engineering) check. If opened by strength, the window slams into contact explosives at the top. Window Explosion (6d6 damage + 1d6 bleed damage, DC 19 Reflex Save for half damage and no bleed damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Grenade Apple (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A golden apple hangs from a branch on a tree.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the apple is removed, the tree detonates. Grenade(10d6 damage, DC 24 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets within 30')

item.title: Trapped Stair Base (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A narrow set of stairs leads up to a small landing with a door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is opened, several arrows fire at the base of the stairs. Arrows(+8 ranged melee for 1d8 damage); multiple targets(all targets at base of stair area)

item.title: Fire Missile Pit (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A recently used firepit is in the middle of this clearing.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

Underneath the ashes are several small rocks that when ignited, shoot missiles. Fire Missiles(1d6+1 missiles, +8 ranged melee for 1d6 fire damage); multiple targets(all targets within 30')

item.title: Hammer and Wire (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
As you walk through the doorway, a hammer swings down at your head!

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character walks through the door a hammer swings down from overhead, and a wire snaps into place in the door at about ankle height. Hammer and Wire(Reflex Save: 22 - no effect, 20 - take 1d6 damage and become dazed for one round, 18 - take 1d6 damage, become dazed for 1 round and be knocked prone)

item.title: Articulated Portcullis (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A portcullis blocks the passage.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 22

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the portcullis is lifted (DC 22 Strength check) it rolls up into the ceiling and comes back down from a second recess in the ceiling right on top of the character opening it or standing in front of the portcullis. Portcullis(DC 19 Reflex Save or take 2d8 damage)

item.title: Musk Spray (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door leads into the small hut.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character opens the door, the area is misted with the musk of a skunk. Skunk Musk(DC 18 Reflex Save or become covered with musk - Anyone within 10' of a musk covered person must make a DC 16 Fortitude Save or become nauseated for 1d6 rounds after leaving the area); multiple targets(all targets within 10')

item.title: Taut Wire (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small stairway leads down.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character steps on the third stair, a taut wire from above descends on the character (think like a pulled bowstring). Taut Wire(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 bleed damage)

item.title: Mirror Door (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door appears to be made from a mirror.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the character opens the door, the mirror shatters, causing bad luck for the character breaking it. Bad Luck(-2 on saving throws for 4 rounds, DC 14 Will Save negates)

item.title: A Bridge, A Barrel, A Waterfall, and A Dimension Door (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A narrow wooden bridge leads across a river. Below it, the river drops off into a large waterfall. A barrel, precariously balanced, sits in the middle of the bridge.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the first character steps onto the bridge, he is immediately teleported into the barrel, which then falls off the side of the bridge into the river, where it proceeds to go off the cliff, down the waterfall. Trap(DC 16 Will Save or teleport into barrel; Once in barrel, DC 16 Fortitude save or take 6d6 damage, after the fall, the bucket fills up with water and sinks in 3 rounds. DC 22 Escape Artist or Strength check to break out. Once sunk, drowning rules are in effect)

item.title: Anti Styptic Torches (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Smoke hangs in the air from the several torches on the walls.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Any wound suffered while in the area automatically adds 1 bleed damage.

item.title: Spider Web Window (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open window leads over to a small bedroom next to this room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character passes through the window, they become entangled in a magic web made from thousands of strands so small that they are practically invisible. Treat the 5 foot square as if a web spell has been cast at CL3.

item.title: Illusionary Ladder Rung (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A ladder is attached to the wall and leads up a long way.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The ladder goes up about 100 feet. About 80 feet up, one of the rungs is an illusion. Illusionary Rung (DC 11 Will Save to disbelieve if examined, otherwise, DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, taking 8d6 damage)

item.title: Safe Arrow (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A safe sits behind a cabinet.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the safe is opened, an arrow flies through the keyhole. Arrow (+8 ranged melee for 1d8 damage)

item.title: Lightning Snare (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small clearing is just ahead.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

A rope snare entangles the character and then an electric charge surges through it. Lightning Snare(DC 15 Reflex Save or become entangled and knocked prone, then take 5d6 electrical damage)

item.title: Color Spray Scope (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A telescope looks out the window. The ends are capped.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the eyepiece cap is removed, color spray at CL 1 (DC 11 Will Save) is cast originating at the eyepiece.

item.title: Spore Web (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor is blocked with thick webs.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The web is full of very small spores. If the web is disturbed in any way, including touched or burned, the spores release into the air. Web Spores(DC 19 Fortitude Save; Frequency 1/minute for 1d4+1 minutes; Initial Effect 1d2 Con; Secondary Effect 1 Con; Cure 1 Save); multiple targets(all targets within 30')

item.title: Hot Merchandise (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several pieces of expensive gold jewelry lay on top of the dresser.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The jewelry is very nice, and worth several hundreds of gold pieces. However, if removed from the room, it will begin to heat up in 1d4+1 hours and act as the spell heat metal at CL 4.

item.title: Fake Pit (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large pit blocks the way forward.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

A cleverly painted pit has been painted on the ground. Unless someone gets up close, it looks very real. Anyone who gets within 5' will identify it as fake.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: You made my day!

Trust me, that isn't even the half of it... while chasing Boh R'aam (Rambo) they faced spiky mud, deathjump spiders in the trees, the aforementioned pit trap and are currently about to fall foul of some illusory handholds :-D If they actually manage to defeat Boh R'aam, the spiked chest they will try and open will blow them all to the Shadowfell. Thanks for the inspiration, please keep it up!
This got my 4e group good and proper - they took the alternative route into the pit containing a rat swarm :-) Thanks!

item.title: Phasing Plate Glass Window (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large, empty window frame overlooks the outside.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character crosses the plane of the window, the glass reappears, cutting the character and shattering in the process. Window(DC 20 Reflex Save or take 7d6 bleed damage; targets within 15' must make a DC 20 Reflex save or take 3d6 damage from shattering glass)

item.title: Sundial (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large sundial sits in the middle of the plaza.

Type: magical; Perception DC 33; Disable Device 33

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

When a character's shadow is cast over the sundial, the character is frozen in time, as if affected by a temporal stasis spell at CL 15 with a DC 22 Fortitude save. The character remains in this state until his shadow no longer is cast over the sundial.

item.title: Catapult Floor (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A trapdoor is set into the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Underneath the trapdoor is a catapult like mechanism. When the trapdoor latch is released, it launches the character into the ceiling. Catapult Floor(DC 19 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage, become dazed for 1d4 rounds and be knocked prone)

item.title: Mosaic Mirror Death Puzzle and Lock (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is made of a segmented mirror of several squares with one missing. It appears that they can be slid up, down, or sideways.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The mirrors must be manipulated (DC 22 Knowledge Arcana) to unlock the door. However, the reflection lags behind the movement by 1d4+1 rounds. If they door is opened before the reflection is updated, the character being reflected is instantly killed. Reflection Death(DC 23 Fortitude Save or be instantly killed)

item.title: Kick Plate Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door has an iron kick plate.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is opened, the kick plate slams down on the character's feet. Kick Plate(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage and become entangled and immobilzed, DC 18 Strength or Escape Artist check required to free oneself)

item.title: Ceiling Holes (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The low ceiling has several holes, irregularly placed.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character goes through the hole, a large hammer comes down and strikes them. Hammer(+12 melee for 1d6+1 damage)

item.title: Seeping Walls (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wooden walls are slowly seeping sap.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the characters try to open the far door, sparks flare up around the room, setting the sap in fire. Anyone in the room takes 1d6 fire damage per round until they leave the room through the locked (DC 25) door.

item.title: Pocket Dimension (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The merchant's pair of pants have deep pockets.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When these pockets are picked, the offending character is teleported 500ft away in a random direction unless he makes a DC 16 Will Save.

item.title: Unhinged Hinges (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is stuck fast in the frame, it looks like the only way to open it is to remove the hinges.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If a hinge is removed, the character is affected by a feeblemind spell with a Will Save of DC 17 and a CL of 9.

item.title: Mousetrap Door (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
At the end of the hall is a wooden door with a metal frame.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 22

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the door is opened, the metal frame snaps down on the character like a mousetrap. Mousetrap(DC 19 Reflex Save or take 2d6 damage and become pinned. CMB vs. 22 CMD to Escape)

item.title: Semi-Permeable Wall of Force (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A dark corridor leads south.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device -

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

120 feet down, the corridor ends. However, the beginning of the corridor is blocked off with a semi-permeable wall of force. This acts just like a normal wall of force spell at CL 13, except that it allows movement through it in one direction, and prevents movement through it in the other direction. The characters can freely pass through it, but won't be able to move back through it out of the corridor.

item.title: Angled Walls of Force (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A deep pit is in the middle of the hallway.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The sides of the deep pit look easily climbable. When a character reaches the bottom, several walls of force spring up from the bottom to the top, at angles so that they would be impossible to climb.

item.title: Fan o' Flames Swinging Doors (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorway contains a set of saloon style swinging doors.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the doors are swung open and the character passes through, they quickly swing back, spouting flame. Flame doors(1d4 damage, DC 11 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all target in 15' cone)

item.title: Anti-Magic Zone (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The ground, several hundred feet down, seems clear.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

About 100' off the ground, an anti-magic shell exists that goes all the way to the ground.

item.title: Joy Buzzer Ladder (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several metal hands have been bolted to the wall, forming a ladder of sorts.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

About 40 feet up, one of the hand rungs discharges an electric charge when grasped. Joy Buzzer (DC 18 Fortitude Save or become stunned for one round, falling for 4d6 damage and becoming knocked prone)

item.title: Freezing Pond (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The room is filled waist high with water.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the trap is set off about halfway across the room, the water freezes solid. Frozen Water (DC 17 Reflex Save or become entangled and immobilized by the water, requiring a DC 17 Strength or Escape Artist check to escape. While trapped in the ice, 1d6 points of cold damage per round is dealt); multiple targets(all targets in water)

item.title: Whoopee Cusion (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An elegant sofa is in this drawing room, near a coffee table with several expensive looking items on it, plus a small, iron chest.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character sits down on the couch, it releases a cloud of noxious fumes, much like the spell stinking cloud cast at CR 5.

item.title: Lava Tube (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stone chimney leads upward.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC gets about a third of the way up, a jet of lava shoots up from below. Lava Jet(10d6 fire damage, DC 22 Fortitude Save for half damage, DC 22 Reflex Save or fall for 4d6 damage); multiple targets(all targets in tube)

item.title: Mortar Hole (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A deep and narrow hole is in the middle of the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Anything put in the hole that touches the bottom (about 10' down) is shot back out. Mortar Hole(DC 19 Reflex Save or 1d6+1 damage)

item.title: Door Horn (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small button is next to the closed and locked door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character pushes the button, it activates a sound burst at CL 3 and DC 13.

item.title: Astral Web (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A web fills the hallway.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The web acts like a normal web spell at CL 17 and DC 17. However, the web is anchoring this spot in this plane. If 50% or more of the web is destroyed, the entire area reverts to the astral plane.

item.title: Loose Ceiling Block (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
In front of the door, about 7 feet away, it looks like a huge stone block is ready to fall from the ceiling.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the door is opened, anyone standing under the block, 10' from the door gets hit by a falling rock. The floor is also levered, so that anyone standing in front of the door is catapulted into the ceiling. Falling Rock (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage); Catapult(DC 22 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage)

item.title: Mispellbook (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A old, ornate tome sits closed on the table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

This book appears in all respects to be a spellbook. However, if anything is read, the reader gets dyslexia. (DC 16 Will Save) When preparing spells from a spellbook or reading spells from a scroll, the PC must make a Concentration check for each spell or it won't be prepared, but will still occupy a slot. The PC will think it is prepared, and will only find out when it is cast, at which point nothing will happen.

item.title: Puddles (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several puddles litter the hallway.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If a puddle is stepped in, a random party member must make a DC 14 Will Save or take 1d6 points of damage. Actively avoided a puddle is a DC 15 Acrobatics check per move, otherwise, a puddle will be stepped in once every movement.

item.title: Spiked Kneelers (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This small church is filled with pews. Each pew has a kneeler.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a PC walks down one of the rows between pews, the kneeler slams down, driving spikes through the feet. Kneeler(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d3 damage and become entangled and immobilized. DC 18 Strength or Escape Artist frees PC as a full round action)

item.title: Cave Paintings (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Something has been painted on the back wall of the cave.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

There are cartoon-style paintings on the back wall of the cave, complete with speech balloons. If a character tries to read the speech, he will be affected as if he were hit with a feeblemind spell at CL 9 and DC 19.

item.title: Disintegrating Door (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small, featureless wooden door is at the end of the hallway. A small button is in the wall to the right of the door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The door is a normal, strong wooden door and can be broken down. It will also open if the button is pushed. However, when the button is pushed, the PC is hit by a disintegrate spell, at CL 11 and DC 20.

item.title: Healing Curse Fountain (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small fountain bubbles water into a basin. In Draconic, an inscription reads "For temporary relief only".

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If a PC drinks the water, they gain 1d8+10 temporary hit points. However, they are also cursed. Any healing the PC receives will only give the PC temporary hit points. This curse can be removed with a remove curse spell with a DC of 25.

item.title: Chocolate Fountain (CR 8+)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A fountain of chocolate bubbles over in the center of the room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The chocolate is actually molten gold, but looks, tastes and feels like chocolate (DC 20 + APL Will Save to disbelieve) . However, if ingested, it reverts to molten gold, dealing 20d6 damage (DC 20 + APL Fortitude Save for half damage).

item.title: Gold Nugget Mortar (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large iron bowl is on the ground, full of gold.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If any nuggets are removed, the bowl fires like a small mortar or cannon. Mortar Shot (6d6 damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in a 15' cone). The gold nuggets, after being fired (or before) are worth 500gp.

item.title: Message Blast (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
As you walk into the room, you begin to hear whispers, which get louder.

Type: magical; Perception DC 25; Disable Device 25

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character sets off this trap, he begins hearing voices as per the message spell at CL 6. The messages build up to a dull roar, and last for an hour unless dispelled. While hearing the message, a caster must make Concentration checks in order to cast spells, and all skill checks are at -2.

item.title: Weak Floor (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is made from old, rotting wood planks.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

A small section of the floor collapses when a character steps in it, exposing a 1 foot pit. Weak Floor(DC 17 Reflex Save or take 1d3 damage and be knocked prone)

item.title: Propeller Doorknob (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A lever doorknob rests inside a recessed cavity on this thick wooden door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset repair

Effect

When a PC moves the lever, it quickly accelerates, turning into a small propeller or fan, and cutting the PC's hand. Propeller Doorknob (DC 21 Reflex Save or take 2d6 damage plus 1d6 bleed damage and become shaken for 1d4 rounds)

item.title: Roped off Entrance (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A red silk rope runs across the archway entrance.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 22

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

If the rope is touched, it discharges an electrical charge. Rope(6d6 electricity damage, DC 18 Fortitude Save for half damage)

item.title: Stripped Screws (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door seems secured with several screws.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Each screw is actually a small valve that just appears to be a stripped screw. The screw can be turned with a DC 12 Dungeoneering or Engineering check. However, once this happens, poison gas leaks in from the next room, which requires a DC 27 Perception check to notice. After 1 round, everyone in the room needs to make a DC 12 Fortitude Save or gained the sickened condition. 1d4 rounds later, A DC 15 Fortitude Save is required or characters are knocked unconscious; a new check is made each round for conscious characters. Each round after being knocked unconscious, a DC 18 Fortitude Save must be made or the character loses 1d3 Constitution.

item.title: Chiropractor's Table (CR 11)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A strange looking table is in the corner, set at an angle and with a donut-shaped pillow attached to one end.

Type: magical; Perception DC 35; Disable Device 35

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Any character looking at the table must make a DC 26 Will Save or be compelled to lie on the table. Once on the table, the character feels relaxed and won't want to get up. If compelled by an outside source, such as another PC urging them to leave, they get another Will Save. If they don't leave, in 1d4 rounds, they must make another DC 26 Will Save or have their alignment randomly change by 2 spots.

item.title: Music Box (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small box begins to play a pleasant tune.

Type: magical; Perception DC 25; Disable Device 25

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The song from the music box has the same effect as the lullaby spell cast at CL 1 with a DC 11 Will Save.

item.title: Quenching Picture (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A picture of a river is set into a gilded frame at the end of the hall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC gets within 20' of the picture, the picture animates into the image of water being sprayed outward. All normal fire in the nearest 5 20'x20' cubes is immediately extinguished, as per the quench spell.

item.title: Boots in the Chimney (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pair of sooty black boots hangs down from the chimney inside the fireplace. Next to the fireplace is a plate of cookies and a glass of milk.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 25; Disable Device 25

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the cookies or milk are moved or eaten, anyone within 20' must make a DC 25 Fortitude Save or gain the nauseated condition for 12 rounds. If the boots are disturbed, burning coal falls from the chimney. Burning Coal (DC 25 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage, 1d6 fire damage and be knocked prone and pinned; DC 25 Escape Artist or Strength check to escape. PC takes 1d6 damage per round while under coal)

item.title: Flash Wallpaper (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The walls in this house are covered with aging, yellowed wallpaper.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If metal strikes the wall, such as a missed arrow or sword, there is a 25% chance that it ignites and explodes in the room. Exploding Paper(6d6 damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Window Pain (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A dirty window obscures vision.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a PC cleans the window to look through it, they are hit by a Symbol of Pain at CL 9 and DC 17 Fortitude Save.

item.title: Popcorn (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is covered with several small pods.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor is covered with several small pods that, when heated, explode. When the PC's enter the room, the floor begins to heat up. After 1d4 rounds, the pods begin to explode. Each round, 1d6 pods explode. Exploding pods(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage per pod); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Light Shade (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small lamp, covered by a lacy shade, is on a small table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC enters the room, the lamp turns on, blasting the closest PC as if with a scorching ray at CL 4 and and +6 ranged touch for 4d6 fire damage.

item.title: Time Closet (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several stopped time pieces adorn the front of this aged wooden door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If a PC enters the closet, he disappears, as if affected by a Shelter from Time spell at CL 5. The PC is in the shelter for 30 hours.

item.title: tar.gz (CR 3 + 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A smoking, bubbling cauldron is in the middle of the room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC gets to within 10' of the cauldron, it shoots out a ball of burning tar, as the tar ball spell at CL 3 with a +8 attack modifier and a +1 Strength modifier. If hit, the person also must make a DC 12 Fortitude save or suffer the effects of reduce person at CL 3.

item.title: Water to Wine (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pitcher of water sits on a table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character approaches the pitcher, it begins to transform into wine. The process takes 2 rounds. After it transforms, any character within 30' of the pitcher begins to have their blood transformed into wine. Each round a character must make a DC 16 Fortitude Save or lose 1d6 points of Con. A single save stops further damage. However, when the character has taken 3 points of Con, they gain the drunken condition, which imposes a -1 penalty to all die rolls. After 6 points, they gain the sickened condition, after 9 they become staggered, and after 12 they are unconscious. If they reach 0 Con, they are dead.

item.title: Ceramic Jar of Acid (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door into the room is slightly ajar.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

A ceramic jar of acid is balanced on top of the door. If opened, it falls on the character. Jar of Acid(1d6 damage plus 1d4 acid damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for 1d2 acid damage)

item.title: Cloak Rack (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several cloaks hang from pegs on the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Each cloak is stuck to a peg. If the cloak is pulled off, it removes the peg with it, causing a poison gas to fill the room. Poison Gas (DC 15 Fortitude Save or become unconscious for 1d4 hours); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Piano Room (CR 11)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several wires run perpendicular to the doors across the room. 

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 33

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The glass ceiling is held into place by several crystal hooks. If a wire is struck, it makes a sound. The vibrations cause some of the hooks to breaks, and the ceiling falls. The wires require a DC 18 Acrobatics check to maneuver through. If they are cut, it causes them to emit sound. Falling Ceiling (10d6 damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Deep Fryer Elevator (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
At the end of the hallway there is what seems to be an elevator.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 22

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

The elevator is an open-topped big metal cage with several buttons. The top one is lit up. If the bottom button is pushed, the elevator goes down very quickly, until it reaches the bottom. Unfortunately, the bottom is filled with boiling oil. Once in motion escaping from the elevator and climbing the shaft walls is a DC 40 Climb check, due to the greasy nature. When the cage hits the boiling oil, it completely submerges. Boiling oil (10d6 fire damage per round while in oil); multiple targets (all targets in oil).

item.title: Spiky Chairs (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several armchairs have been placed around the room. They all seem to have overstuffed cushions.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 16

Trigger Touch; Reset Repair

Effect

Just under the cushions are several sharp, barbed spikes. Spikes (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d3 damage and become entangled with the chair. DC 22 Escape Artist or DC 22 Strength check to free from chair, however, if Strength is used, an additional 1d3 damage is dealt)

item.title: Pit and a Rope (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Nothing to see here, just an unadorned room with stone walls, floor and ceiling.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character reaches the far side of the room, the entire floor, with the exception of a 1' rim around the edges collapses into a 20' pit. At the same time, ropes fall down near the edges from the ceiling in a way that they could be used to climb out. If weight is put on more than one rope, the ceiling collapses, sealing off the pit. Pit (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 2d6 falling damage); Ceiling (If not in pit, DC 18 Reflex Save to jump in pit, taking 2d6 damage or take 5d6 damage from ceiling and be knocked into pit) The ceiling itself has hardness 8 and 540 HP with a Break DC of 50.

item.title: Stuck Pull Open Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door opens out, int the room you are currently in.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a PC pulls the door open, it pulls the frame with it, falling on the PC. Falling Door(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage and become entangled. DC 18 Escape Artist or Strength check to escape)

item.title: Tilting Staircase (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden staircase leads upwards.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC gets near the top of the stairs, the top falls down and the bottom lifts up, as the staircase spins in a complete 360. Tilting Staircase(DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, taking 1d6 damage); multiple targets(all targets on staircase)

item.title: Stone Columns (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Two large stone columns flank an archway in front of you.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a PC enters the archway, the columns move together and start to spin rapidly. Stone Columns(DC 21 Reflex Save or take 10d6 crushing damage)

item.title: Scorching Peephole (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small metal shutter is in the middle of the door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character opens up the shutter to look through it, he gets hit with a scorching ray at CL 4 and +4 ranged touch.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Reblogged this on Remian Embertainment and commented: Thus seems like a great trap that players won't be expecting.

item.title: Bubble Wrap (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The walls and floor of this room are covered in what appears to be bubble wrap.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The walls are covered in a substance that resembles bubble wrap, with the bubbles facing the floor/walls. If it is removed, or enough bubbles are popped (walking through 4 or more squares of the bubble will weaken it) the walls, floor and ceiling begin to shake and then collapse, as the wrap served to mitigate the natural tremors directly under this room. Collapsing Room(DC 21 Reflex Save or take 10d6 crushing damage and 3d6 falling damage. Additionally, the cave underneath the room has a Climb DC of 30 to escape. Due to vibrations, all checks in the cave are at -4, and concentration checks must be made to cast spells); multiple targets(all targets in room)

item.title: Scorch Marks (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Opposite the door are scorch marks on the wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character gets within 15' of the door, a timer starts. If they do not open the door within 2 rounds, a gout of flame shoots out from the door. Flame(DC 16 Reflex Save or take 1d4 fire damage); multiple targets(all targets in 15' cone)

item.title: Poison Book (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large, leather bound tome sits on a desk.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The book radiates magic as if it were a spellbook. When it is opened, the pages disintegrate. The powder from the pages is poison, however. Poison(DC 16 Fortitude Save or take 1d6 Int damage)

item.title: Floor Bored (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wooden floorboards in this hallway are dull and worn and the door at the end of the hall isn't anything special either.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

When a character tries to open the far door, he becomes bored as per the oppressive boredom spell cast at CL4 with a DC of 18)

item.title: Explosive Crystals (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Expensive looking crystals are embedded in the cave walls.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The crystals are valuable (20-100gp) but if they are struck, they explode. Removing them requires either a disable device check or a Dungeoneering or Profession(mining) check of DC 26. Exploding Crystal(6d6 damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets within 30')

item.title: Blurry Binoculars (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A set of fixed binoculars sits on a tripod, looking out over the valley.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character looks through the binoculars, they appear out of focus and blurry. When he stops looking, his vision is still blurry (DC 22 Will Save negates) This causes the PC to suffer a -8 penalty to any check that requires vision. It can be removed with a Lesser Restoration or better spell.

item.title: Goblin Privy (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small wooden door is set into the wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC opens the door, the sight and smell of the room beyond is... sickening. Goblin Privy (DC 18 Fortitude Save or become nauseated for 1d6 rounds); multiple targets(all targets within 30 feet)

item.title: Electrified Cobweb (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Cobwebs hang from the ceiling.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The web strands are electrified. Electric Cobweb(6d6 electricity damage, DC 18 Fortitude Save for half damage); The cobwebs can be avoided with a DC 22 Acrobatics check.

item.title: Heat Barrier (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The archway opening... did it just have the slightest shimmer?

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC passes through the archway, he is affected as if Fury of the Sun were cast at DC 18 and CL 4.

item.title: Wave Floor (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor seems a little squishy.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC triggers this trap, a large block of stone falls from the ceiling, striking the floor. The floor is malleable and floating on a dense liquid. When the stone hits, it causes waves to roll out from it. Wave Floor(1d6 damage and be knocked prone, DC 18 Reflex Save avoids); multiple targets(all targets on floor)

item.title: Whoopee Cushion Floor (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A thick, busily patterned carpet covers the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The carpet has several air pockets trapped under it. When stepped on, they product a loud, distinctive noise. If the Perception check is made, a DC 16 Acrobatics check is required to cross 10' of carpet without setting off a pocket.

item.title: Full Closet (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door is at the top of the ramp.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the door is opened, several large pieces of metal cascade out of the closet and down the ramp. Cascading Metal(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 2d6 damage, plus be knocked prone); multiple targets(all targets on ramp)

item.title: Shackle Flatware (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A table is before you, with several place settings.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a PC picks up a piece of flatware, shackles appear from the table, restraining the PC. Shackles(DC 18 Reflex save or become entangled. A DC 25 Break or Escape artist check is needed to escape. Also a DC 30 Open Lock check can be used)

item.title: Staples (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The hallway ahead is quite narrow.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Several large staples fire out of one of the side walls, trapping the character against the wall. (DC 19 Reflex Save avoids, there is a 2 in 6 chance that those that fail the save are also punctured for 1d6 damage. A DC 19 Escape Artist or Strength check is required to escape the staple); multiple targets(all targets in hallway)

item.title: Canister Door (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A worn wooden door is in the middle of the wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

A cannon filled with canister is just behind the door, and fires when the door is opened. Canister shot(+16 melee for 10d8 damage in a 30' cone)

item.title: Gopher Holes (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The road is a little rough in patches.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device -

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Mounted characters must make a DC 18 Reflex Save every round spent riding at a pace faster than a single move action. If failed, the mount steps in a hole, coming up lame, and the rider must make a DC 20 rider check or be unmounted, taking 1d6 damage.

item.title: Killer Cornfield (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A field is filled with tall stalks of corn

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PC's get to the middle of the cornfield, it catches on fire. The fire itself does 1d4 heat damage per round to the PCs. However, the heat causes the kernels on the corn to pop and explode, acting like a bullet. 6d6 kernels will pop each round. Kernel Bullet(+8 melee for 1d4 damage).

item.title: Gold Piece on Table (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stray gold piece is nestled between some papers on the table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

If the gold piece is removed from the room, the bearer is immediately hit by a geas to never loot money or gems. It can be removed as per the normal method for a geas.

item.title: Physics Experiment (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large iron ball on a chain hangs from the ceiling, resting against a door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger Touch; Reset Auto

Effect

When a PC lifts the ball to swing it against the door (DC 24 Strength check) and lets it go, it will strike the door. On the other side of the door are 4 identical balls hanging from the ceiling, touching each other. They will hear a quick series of clicks, and then the large ball will swing back 1 round later. Once set in motion, it takes 1d6 + 6 rounds to stop swinging. Swinging Ball (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 4d6 damage and be knocked prone)

item.title: Hand in the Cookie Jar (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A locked metal jar sits on top of the cabinet.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger Touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When a PC opens the jar, a knife springs out, stabbing the hand to the table. Additionally, spring loaded barbs pop out into the table, pinning the PC to the table. Knife (+8 melee for 1d4 damage and the character is entangled. DC 18 Strength or Reflex to escape, causing 1d4 damage +1 bleed damage)

item.title: Love Darts (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The walls of this room have several small holes in them.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PCs cross the room, several darts shot from the walls and strike the PCs. Each PC must make a DC 22 Will Save, or suffer the effects of the spell kiss of unrequited love. The object of each PCs obsession will be another random party member.

item.title: Oh, the Chocolate (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open heart shaped box is on a table, half-filled with chocolates.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

When examined, each chocolate appears to give a stat buff similar to spells such as Owl's Wisdom or Cat's Grace. Instead, after ingesting the chocolate, the PC suddenly feels very full and gains the sickened and fatigued condition for 1d4 hours (DC 18 Fortitude Save negates)

item.title: Ground Zero Wand (CR *+1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
* - Spell Level

A magnificent wand sits unattended in an open, velvet-lined mahogany case.

Type: magical; Perception DC 25+*; Disable Device 25+*

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

The wand seems to work as normal. However, when used in a combat situation, the target of the spell becomes either the wand-wielder or his square, as appropriate for the spell in use. Saves and effects are based on the spell stored in the wand. This can be a 1 charge only item, or it can have multiple charges.

item.title: Inverse Double Doors (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A set of ornate, wooden double doors is at the end of the hall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger Touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the doors are opened, instead of opening normally, they open connected at the middle, while the hinged parts of the door swing together, smashing the PC in front of the door. Double Doors (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 6d6 damage)

item.title: Blade (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A narrow shaft leads down into a pool.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 33; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset auto

Effect

The shaft leading down is nearly smooth (DC 30 Climb check). It goes down 20' and ends in a deep pool. However, 10' down the shaft is a small blade that protrudes from the wall. Anyone jumping down will be cut. Blade (+20 vs. flat-footed AC for 4d8 damage)

item.title: Electric Rung (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Iron rungs are attached to a stone wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

When a PC gets halfway up the rungs, a single rung electrifies. Electric Rung (DC 22 Fortitude Save or take 3d6 electrical damage and fall, taking 2d6 damage)

item.title: Force Jellybeans (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A bowl of brightly colored jellybeans is on the table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

If a jellybean is ingested, the character is enclosed in a force sphere for 1 hour. The PC can breathe, but is completely immobilized and cannot speak or hear. The sphere cannot be moved, but may be dismissed with dispel magic (CL 5), a rod of negation or cancellation, or disintegrate. While enclosed, the PC also cannot be damaged.

item.title: Wine Rack Secret Door (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The walls of this room are covered in wine racks, housing hundreds of bottles.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger Touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The back wall of the room contains a secret door, hidden by the racks and bottles. (DC 19 Perception). If the door is opened without disarming the trap, each bottle in the room simultaneously launches a lead-filled cork into the room. Lead Filled Corks (+16 ranged melee or take 10d8 damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Numbing Mist (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This area is shrouded in a light mist.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The mist causes mild numbing. Numbing (DC Fortitude Save or take -2 on all Dex or Str based checks); Multiple targets (all targets in mist); The numbing effect subsides in 1d4+1 rounds after leaving the mist.

item.title: Vermin Coin (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A platinum piece sits on the floor, a if it were dropped.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The coin emits a high frequency noise that attracts creatures with the vermin trait within 200' and makes them attack. Once acquired, the coin can only be discarded with a successful remove curse. It will always show back up 1 hour after discarding otherwise.

item.title: Tar Mat (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A doormat sits in front of a wooden door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The doormat is in front of the door and is 5'x5'. Anyone standing on the mat when the door opens becomes stuck as the mat turns into a tarry, sticky substance. Tar Mat(DC 18 Reflex Save of become immobilized and lose Dex bonus. DC 18 Strength or Escape Artist to break free as a standard action)

item.title: Dead Bolt (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is locked from this side, with a large dead bolt.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger Touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the lock is undone, a heavy crossbow bolt fires from behind the door. Bolt (+16 ranged melee for 1d10 damage)

item.title: Dart Board (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A dart board hangs on the wall at the end of the hallway. Several darts are lying on a small table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger Touch; Reset Auto

Effect

The dart board is a standard one numbered 1-20 with a bullseye and secondary ring. The AC of the bullseye is 30, and the secondary ring is 25. Is these are missed, roll a d20 to determine which number the dart strikes. An individual ring is AC 20, the double is AC 25 and the triple is AC 30, if missed roll the d20 to determine strike location. If the attack roll does not at least strike AC 10, the dart misses the board entirely. When a dart strikes a numbered segment, the thrower takes that amount of damage with no save.

item.title: Leaky Pipes (CR 5 or 14)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
