Several pipes run along the walls and ceiling.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If a pipe is struck it will break. There is a 50% chance that missed missile weapons or spells will strike the pipes, and a 100% chance that an area effect spell will strike the pipes. An area effect will break all the pipes, (5d4) while anything else only breaks a single pipe. When struck the pipes blast steam. Single Pipe (DC 18 Fortitude Save or take 3d6 steam damage); multiple targets (all targets in room).

item.title: Acid Doorknob (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wooden door looks like it can be opened with a pitted metal doorknob.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the doorknob is turned, it squirts a stream of acid. Acid (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 acid damage)

item.title: Slicing Door (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An empty archway leads to the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the archway is entered, two offset doors slide closed, with leading sharp edges. Slicing Door(DC 24 Reflex Save or take 10d6 damage + 1d6 bleed damage)

item.title: Much Ado About I Do (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A portrait has been mounted above the headboard in this bedroom. A small scroll is attached to the frame.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

The scroll is the trap, and has a wax seal. When the seal is broken, the scroll crumbles away into dust. The PC must make a DC 24 Will Save. If he fails, he will find out that he/she is legally married to the local ruler or monarch, and that person wishes to end the marriage. And by end the marriage, there is now a warrant out for the arrest and execution of the PC. How this unfolds in your campaign is up to the GM.

item.title: Electrified Door (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A black door leads to the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The door is electrified, but it is covered with a thin layer of insulating paint. It is stuck (DC 25 Break). If the door is forced open, enough paint flakes off to cause an electrical discharge. Electrical Discharge(DC 19 Fortitude Save or take 3d6 electrical damage); multiple targets(all targets touching door).

item.title: Eyebrows of Blindness (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An ornate mirror stands in the corner at a slight angle.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger Visual Reset None

Effect

When the mirror is gazed upon (DC 24 Will Save to avoid looking at the mirror) the onlooker will notice that his reflection has great, bushy eyebrows. After leaving, the eyebrows will begin to grow and will completely cover the eyes in 2 rounds. Once covered, they will grow back in 2 more rounds if cut off, and will defeat any attempt to bind them in place in 2 rounds, untangling themselves or growing around the obstacle if necessary. The eyebrow growth grants the PC the blinded condition, and also gives a -4 penalty to any Charisma based skill. Treat as if bestow curse at CL 9 were cast for removal purposes.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Eyebrow traps everywhere. Love it

item.title: Infected Goblet (CR 14)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Something golden is embedded inside a block of ice in the wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Inside of the ice is a golden goblet worth 1,000gp. However, once exposed to air, a dormant virus, frozen for centuries spreads through the air. Virus(DC 34 Fortitude Save or instantly age 1d100 years); multiple targets(all targets within 100' of goblet). A CL 20 cure disease will cleanse the goblet. However, once infected, nothing short of a wish will restore age. Each wish restores 1d100 years, up to the original age.

item.title: Electric Gem (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large diamond sits atop a pedestal.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The diamond is worth 1,200 gp. When it is picked up, an electrical discharge courses through the room. The one holding the diamond is grounded, and takes no damage. Electrical discharge(6d6 electrical damage, DC 21 Fortitude Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets in room)

item.title: Trip Bar (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open archway leads to the next room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character walks through the archway, an iron bar raises from the floor, tripping the PC. Iron Bar(DC 18 Reflex Save or become knocked prone)

item.title: Elastic Ring (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A plain gold ring sits on a velvet pillow inside of a small jewelry box.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The ring appears to be a fine magical ring worth around 15,000gp (pick a ring). When put on, the actual function of the ring reveals itself. A translucent cord attaches to the ring and is anchored to a spot in the center of the room. The actual anchor point is extra-planar. The cord itself stretches 50 feet, effectively tethering the ring bearer. The ring can be removed with a remove curse, or the tether can be cut by traveling with a planar travel spell to the tether's anchor point.

item.title: Thieving Mirror (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open window leads over to a small bedroom next to this room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger Visual; Reset None

Effect

When a character looks in the mirror, one of their items (armor, weapon, robes, etc) will appear blurry. If it is focused upon (DC 24 Will Save to avoid), the reflection will clear up, but the item will be stolen from the character and will reside in the mirror. It can be retrieved with a remove curse or dispel magic vs. CL 10.

item.title: Knife Block (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden block is full of knives.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a PC gets within 10', the knives fire out of the block. Knives(+24 ranged melee or take 10d4 damage)

item.title: Springy Grass (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several mounds of green grass litter the field.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a grass mound is stepped on, it catapults the PC into the air. Springy Grass(DC 18 Reflex Save or be thrown 30' in a random direction, taking 1d6 damage and being knocked prone) If not actively avoiding, there is a 1 in 4 chance that one of them is stepped on for each movement action taken.

item.title: Rotating Stair (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stone stairway leads down into darkness.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The top stair rotates when stepped on. Rotating Stair(DC 18 Reflex Save or take 2d10 falling damage and be knocked prone at the bottom of the staircase)

item.title: Exploding Seal (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wax-sealed scroll sits on the nightstand.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the seal is broken, it explodes. Exploding Seal(6d6 damage, no save, those not next to it but within 10 feet get a DC 21 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets within 10 feet)

item.title: Blood Pen (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A beautiful fountain pen, inlaid with gold filigree, sits in a stand on the desk.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the pen is picked up, it vanishes and returns to its owner. Whenever the owner writes, it uses blood from the victim for its ink. Blood Pen(When written with, DC 22 Fortitude Save or take 1 permanent Con loss). When the victim dies, the pen reverts to a normal pen. A Remove Curse or Heal will sever the effect, which works at indefinite range, as long as the pen and victim are on the same plane.

item.title: Bucket of Coins (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An bucket of coins sits near the door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character touches any of the coins, he becomes glued to them. They are all glued together and stuck to the bucket. Only a grease spell or Universal Solvent will release the bucket. Bucket of Coins(-4 to Dex based checks until removed, no save)

item.title: Anti-Knock Door (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An ornate wooden door allows entrance to this upscale house.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If someone tries to open the door via a knock spell, the door automatically counters the knock and lets loose with an extremely loud boom that only the caster can hear, which deafens him. Anti-Knock(DC 17 Fortitude Save or become deafened for 1d4+1 hours)

item.title: Reverse Telescope (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A telescope is mounted near a window.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character peers through the telescope, the landscape outside looks extremely large and magnified. This is because the PC has just been shrunk. Telescope(DC 17 Fortitude Save or be halved in size, as per the Reduce Person spell)

item.title: Toppling Ladder (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A very tall ladder rests against the wall, leading to the roof.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character climbs 30' up the 40' ladder, a spring loaded brick fires, pushing the ladder away from the wall and toppling it. Toppling Ladder(DC 26 Reflex save or fall and take 3d6 damage) If the save is successful, the PC is now hanging onto a 40' wall 30' up. It is a DC 25 Climb check to scale this wall.

item.title: Impaling Pit (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor of this room is made up of circular tiles.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

One of the tiles collapses when stepped on, revealing a cylinder-shaped pit that is 10 feet deep, and leaves little room on either side. Running up the middle of the pit is an 8-foot long iron spike. Impaling Pit(DC 18 Reflex Save or fall into pit and be impaled, taking 4d8 damage plus 1d8 bleed damage. The bleed damage cannot be stopped while impaled. The only way to escape the spike is to climb out of the pit, which requires a DC 28 Climb check and takes 2 rounds)

item.title: Sticky Webs (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is covered in webs.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

The webs cover a 5 foot square in front of the door, and act as the web spell. However, they cannot be burned by normal fire, only magical fire burns them. In addition, the webs stick to anything that comes in contact with them, and can only be removed by Universal Solvent or magical fire. Items that are covered in webs either become useless or unable to be opened. Weapons suffer a -1 penalty until cleaned, and PC's lose their Dex bonus.

item.title: Waxed Floor (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wooden floor in this room is very shiny.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor has just been waxed. Waxed Floor(DC 18 Reflex Save or fall prone, requiring a DC 20 Acrobatic check to stand up. Otherwise, PC can crawl 5 feet per movement action)

item.title: Searing Light Pool (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A clear, calm pool of water fills the cavern.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger Touch; Reset None

Effect

If the water is disturbed, a bright ray of light flares out from it. Searing Light Pool(spell effect +3 ranged touch AC for 2d8 points of damage)

item.title: Phasing Force Spikes (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An long hallway jags left and right at random intervals.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Sticking out from the walls are invisible spikes made from splintered walls of force. Additionally, they phase in and out of this plane at random intervals. For each move action, there is a 20% chance that a spike will phase into the area occupied by the PC. Phasing Force Spike(DC 25 Reflex Save or take 6d6 piercing damage)

item.title: Manhole Cover (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large iron manhole cover is in the middle of this dark alley.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When someone tries to open the cover, it flies up in the air, rapidly spinning. Those nearby take slicing damage. Manhole Cover(DC 22 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage); multiple targets(all targets within 5' of cover)

item.title: Corpse (CR 11)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A decaying corpse holds a small leather bag.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The leather bag contains 100gp. However, if it is opened, the person opening it becomes exposed to Cackle Fever. Cackle Fever (1/day, DC 16 Fortitude Save, 1d6 Wis damage. 2 consecutive saves for cure)

item.title: Cure Light Wounds (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A shelf contains several vials of potions.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a vial is taken, a dark ray fires from the shelf. Dark Ray(+7 ranged touch vs. AC or take 5d6 negative energy damage). The vials themselves contain a potion that will cure 1d8 points of damage from any light-based spell, such as searing light. Otherwise, it does nothing.

item.title: Core Sample (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A hollow tube is in the wall, light from the other side shines through it.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger Touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character looks through the tube, it rotates and fires out at the PC, taking a "core sample". Core Sample(DC 22 Reflex Save or take 2d8 bleed damage)

item.title: Dust Covered Blanket (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A dusty blanket covers something chest shaped.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the blanket is removed, it reveals an unlocked chest, which, of course, is empty. However, the dust particles fill the air. Dust particles(DC 14 Fortitude Save or take 1d2 Con damage); multiple targets(all targets within 30')

item.title: Fist Bump (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large stone fist overlooks a cliff. The fist is wearing a huge ruby ring.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The ruby is fist-sized and is worth 7,500gp. It can be removed with a DC 33 Disable Device check. However, if someone starts to remove the ruby, the fist "punches" the PC, sending them off the cliff. Fist Bump(+20 CMB to bull rush and move PC back 5 feet, off the cliff where they fall 100 feet, taking 10d6 falling damage)

item.title: Goblin Tripcord (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small hole is in the wall, about 3 feet up.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 16; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

A thin cord lays across the floor. From behind the wall, a single goblin watches. When a PC crosses the line, he yanks on it, bringing it up and tripping the PC. Usually, a small squad of goblins will then appear. Goblin Tripcord(+8 CMB attack to trip)

item.title: Caravel Security System (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small caravel is tied off to the end of the pier. It appears unmanned.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the ship is untied, many of the ropes animate, re-tying itself to the pier and tangling up any people near or on the boat. Animated Ropes(DC 18 Reflex Save or become pinned, requiring CMB check vs. CMD 18 to Escape); multiple targets(all targets on or within 10' of boat)

item.title: Burglar Alarm (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The windows are dark in this small cottage, it appears unoccupied.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the residence is entered, a small bell chimes. This bell, via a message spell, is also heard by the local constable, who will arrive in 2d10 rounds to investigate.

item.title: Stone Cell (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Books, scrolls, potions and other items litter the top of a stone table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The stone table is the workbench of a wizard. If items are removed, the offender is melded into the stone table. Stone Meld(DC 18 Fortitude save or be melded into the stone for 50 minutes. Any stone manipulation, or a spell like passwall will free the trapped person, but will deal 5d6 damage unless another DC 18 Fortitude save is made)

item.title: Don't Eat My Food (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several tasty looking treats sit on a pantry shelf.

Type: magical; Perception DC 25; Disable Device 25

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character eats some of the food, the food is putrified. Putrification (DC 15 Fortitude Save or become nauseated for 1d8+1 rounds)

item.title: Oily Floors (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
These twisted passages are filled with cobwebs.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The cobwebs are thick enough to act like a Web spell cast at CL4. However, under the web, in the seams of the floor tiles is a lot of flammable oil. If the webs are set alight, it creates a flash fireball. Flash Fireball (6d6 fire damage, DC 19 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in hallways). The fire clears out the entire complex of cobwebs.

item.title: If you really want it (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A magnificent staff is mounted on the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the staff is removed from the wall, it is teleported into the character touching it, impaling him. Staff Teleport(3d6 damage plus 1d6 damage per round until removed. Can be removed with a DC 15 heal check for no damage, or if the check is failed or not used, the removal causes an additional 1d6 damage, and also results in an additional 1d6 bleed damage)

item.title: Boulder and False Exit (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
After a soft click is heard, a large boulder starts to roll down towards the party!

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character trips the trap in a hallway, a large boulder drop from the ceiling and begins rolling towards them. It picks up steam until it is moving 60' per round in 2 rounds. As the party runs away, the corridor forks. Down one corridor they can see sunshine filtering in. The other one is dark. The dark hallway exits into a cavern complex, and the PC's, once in, can easily dodge the boulder. The light one ends after 100' in a blank wall, filled with polished spikes which reflect the sunlight from above. Boulder and spikes(Boulder 4d8 damage if boulder rolls over PC; If smashed against wall take 3d6 damage from boulder, plus 4d8 from spikes, DC 24 Reflex Save avoids spike damage); multiple targets (all targets in hallway)

item.title: Stained Glass Window (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An multi-paned glass window is at the far side of this big room. The sun is beginning to shine through it.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Each pane is a different color. When the light shines through different panes, the following effects happen. The light moves through a different pane per round, and takes 8 rounds to transit. The effects target a random PC in the room.

1. Yellow - (DC 21 Reflex Save or be struck by a searing light beam for 4d8 points of damage)

2. Red - (PC and everyone in 30' radius or be struck by a fireball for 4d6 damage, DC 21 Reflex Save for half damage)

3. Blue (DC 21 Fortitude Save or gain exhausted condition from blue ray)

4. Green (DC 21 Fortitude Save or gain nauseated condition from green ray for 1d10+1 rounds)

item.title: Fan Pit (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor of this long hallway is made of wood.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Halfway down the hallway, the floor opens up under the PC and drops them in a pit. The pit drop 10 feet into a fan, and then another 20 feet. Pit (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage, +12 melee attack or take 4d8 damage from fan)

item.title: Coat of Arms (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A huge mosaic depicting a coat of arms is in the center of the floor. It appears that the crest is that of a giant squid,

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character gets within 10' of the coat of arms, a tentacle fires out, grappling the PC. Tentacle(DC +12 CMB or become grappled, 22 CMD to escape. Each round grappled, the character takes 1d4 crushing damage); multiple targets(1d4+1 tentacles)

item.title: Dart Gun (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A door is at the end of the hall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the doorknob is turned, a small dart fires. Dart(+4 melee for 1d4+1 damage).

item.title: Pepper Spray (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stained wooden door is at the end of the hall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character opens the door, a cloud of pepper spray appears. Pepper Spray (DC 21 Fortitude Save or become blinded and sickened for 1d4+1 rounds)

item.title: Bursting Barrel (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several barrels are stacked up in the corner.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 22

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character opens up a barrel, the hoops explode outward, showering the area with nails and metal. Bursting Barrel(4d6 damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets within 15')

item.title: Crater Crate (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large crate is in the middle of the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the crate is opened, it explodes. Crater Crate(6d6 damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets within 30')

item.title: Magic Missile, Magic Mouth (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There is a closed door at the bottom of the stairs.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset Auto (50 charges)

Effect

When a PC opens the door, they see a short corridor that turns right. At the turn, a wand has been set into the wall, and there is also a magic mouth. The magic mouth speaks the command word for the wand and fires a magic missile. Missile(1d4+1 damage)

item.title: Fountain of False Life (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small fountain sits in the center of the courtyard.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger Proximity; Reset None

Effect

When a PC gets within 10' of the fountain, the water churns and splashes outward. When a PC is splashed by the fountain they are imbued with 1d10+7 temporary hit points that they are not aware of. These hit points will be lost first. To the PC, it will be as if he was not damaged until they run out. However, once they run out and the PC actually takes damage, he will also take additional damage immediately for the amount of temporary hit points he was granted. Fountain Splash(DC 21 Reflex Save avoids); multiple targets(all targets within 10')

item.title: Clogged Drain (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Molten gold slowly flows into the room and is diverted into molds. Several of the molds appear to have been cooled off enough to touch. Excess gold runs off into a drain on the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 33; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If any of the molded gold is removed, the gold flow increases fast enough that the drain backs up, filling the room with molten gold. Molten gold(3d6 fire damage per round); multiple targets(all targets in contact with gold). The gold fills the room at at the rate of 1 foot per round. When the gold reaches the room entrance, 20 feet up, it stops. Each gold statue is worth 400gp.

item.title: One Way Valve Opener (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small metal door is at the end of the hall. It has a wheel on it to open it, presumably.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character starts to turn the wheel, water starts to leak from the door, and then gushes out. The room fills up at the rate of 10' per round. The valve can be shut off, and the water will drain, but will not turn the other way without a repair, which is a DC 31 Disable Device or Engineering check once the water begins to flow.

item.title: Parapet Pit (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The parapets are 40 feet above the ground.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Near one of the parapets is a hidden pit. When triggered, the character falls 10 feet, where he hits an angled trampoline the vaults him up and over the parapet. Pit(DC 21 Reflex Save or take 4d6 falling damage)

item.title: Light Bomb (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The tunnel descends into darkness.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PC's get about halfway down the corridor, the entire area becomes bathed in bright light. Light Bomb(DC 19 Fortitude Save or become blinded for 1d4 rounds, those that make their save take a -2 penalty to vision based checks for one round); multiple targets (all targets within 60 ft)

item.title: Bag of Ball Bearings (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stairway leads down.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character reaches the middle of the stairway, a large bag of ball bearings falls on him and breaks, scattering ball bearings to the rest of the party on the stairway. Ball Bearing Bag(DC 22 Reflex Save or take 2d6 damage); Ball Bearings(DC 22 Reflex Save or fall down stairs, taking 1d6 damage and falling prone); multiple targets (All targets on stairway)

item.title: Chile Powder (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small chest sits on a table.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the chest is opened, it emits a cloud of chile powder gas. Chile Powder(DC 22 Fortitude Save or become blinded for 2d4 rounds and nauseated for 1d4-1 rounds); multiple targets(all targets within 10')

item.title: Screaming Statue (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A statue sits in the corner, arms outstretched and mouth open, revealing sharp teeth.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the statue is examined, (someone declares they are doing a search action) it screams. Screaming Statue(DC 19 Fortitude Save or take 1d8 damage and become stunned for one round)

item.title: Floating Door (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door floats in the doorway, clearly visible gaps are on all four sides.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character opens the door, the door falls to the ground. The character, however, is trapped, floating in the doorframe. Floating Door (DC 18 Reflex Save or become pinned in doorway, DC 18 Escape Artist check or CMB vs. 18 CMD to escape)

item.title: Barrel in Web (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The corridor is blocked by thick webs.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The webs are thick and nearly impassable. It requires a DC 33 Strength check to move 5 feet. They can also be destroyed by dealing 60 points of damage per 5 foot square. They are flammable, though. If set on fire, they burn quickly at the rate of 10' per round. 15 feet in, there is a barrel of gun powder that will explode when the fire reaches it. Barrel(10d6 damage, DC 24 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets(all targets within 30')

item.title: Bullet Trap Door (CR 5 + 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Whoosh, a pit opens up, dumping you down into it. The door quickly shuts, leaving you in darkness.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The pit trap is simple (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage). However, once in, the door closes. It is featureless from the outside. However, on the inside, there are several small holes. The only way the door can be opened is to either succeed at a DC 40 Disable Device check, a DC 35 Break check or break it open. It has 80hp and 15 hardness. The holes on the lower side are filled with explosives. When the door is struck and takes damage that overcomes the hardness, 1d4 explosives are set off, injuring the person in the pit. Explosives (+15 ranged melee for 1d8 damage). Each hole, there are 100, can be disabled with a DC 19 Disable Device check)

item.title: Slow Arrow (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An open window leads over to a small bedroom next to this room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the party gets to the middle of the room, a Mass Hold Person is activated (DC 25 Will Save) paralyzing everyone for 13 rounds. Each player gets a new save each round). While being held, each round an arrow slowly passes through the character, dealing 1d8 damage plus 1 Wisdom damage.

item.title: Blunderbuss Door (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door seems to be the only way into the building.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character opens the door, a blunderbuss behind it fires. Blunderbuss (+6 melee touch attack for 1d8 damage); multiple targets (all targets in a 15' cone)

item.title: Ball Bearings (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pedestal rises up from the middle of a deep pit. A chest is on the pedestal.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

A character can jump to the pedestal easily with a DC 15 Jump check. However, the top of the pedestal is covered in ball bearings. Any character that jumps over must make a DC 20 Acrobatics check or lose balance and topple over the edge, falling for 10d6 damage.

item.title: Life Drain Glass (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You can see your faint reflection in a pane of glass.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

When a character sees his reflection, it is only very faint. However, each round it becomes more solid. After several rounds, it becomes completely solid and life-like. At this point, the character dies. Life Drain Glass (DC 28 Will Save each round, if failed, make a DC 28 Fortitude Save or lose 2d4 levels. If all levels are drained, character dies)

item.title: Horn Room (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The ceiling of this cavern is cone shaped.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character reaches a 10'x10' spot in the center of the cavern, the echo of his footsteps are amplified in the cone. Amplified Footsteps (DC 18 Fortitude Save or take 1d8 sonic damage and become stunned for 1 round)

item.title: Sandwich Hall (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Stone doors are at either end of this short hallway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

When a character opens the far door, it causes both doors to smash together, then reset. Smashing Doors (4d6 crushing damage); multiple targets (all targets in hallway)

item.title: Snake Scroll Tube (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An ornate scroll tube sits on a table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the scroll tube is opened, a venomous snake appears and attacks (See Snake, Venomous, Bestiary). Snake Scroll Tube (DC 18 Perception check or snake is granted a surprise round)

item.title: Open All (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A locked door is at the end of the hall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character unlocks the door (DC 18 Disable Device), he must make a DC 18 Will Save or all items on his person become "open". Potion tops come off, armor falls off, weapons fall off belts, shoes become untied, etc.

item.title: Spiked Chute Trap (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pit opens up beneath you.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character falls into the pit, they fall into an angled 20' shaft that is 2-3 feet wide. They take no damage. However, as they slide, spikes, angled downwards, pop out, blocking the way back. In order to leave, the PC must make a DC 25 Acrobatics Check for each 5' travelled upwards or take 3d6 damage. Each spike can be removed (DC 25 Disable Device or Engineering) or destroyed (10 hp, hardness 10). 100 spikes must be removed or destroyed.

item.title: Magnifying Glass Chute (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pit open up beneath you.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset repair

Effect

When a character falls into the pit (DC 24 Reflex Save), they take 2d6 damage from falling 20 feet. The bottom and sides of the pit have many magnifying glasses. Each round spent in the pit deals 1d6 fire damage to the PC. It is a DC 20 Climb check to escape.

item.title: Surprise Stair (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This long hallway has a wooden floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

When a character gets about halfway across the hallway, they hallway steps down, but is cleverly painted to appear flat. Surprise Stair (DC 16 Reflex Save or fall prone)

item.title: Heavy, Flammable Gas (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The passageways of this underground complex are uneven.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

A heavy, flammable gas has sunk to the floor and fills up the bottom 1 foot of the air. Whenever anything flammable enters, be it a dropped torch or some kind of fire spell, it flash ignites. Heavy air (DC 28 Reflex Save or take 4d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets in caves)

item.title: Sticky Pollen (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of flowers are in bloom.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PC's begin to walk through the area, the air is thick with pollen. This pollen begins to accumulate on the PC's with the following effects:

Round 1 (nothing)

Round 2 (All Dex based skills/attributes are at -1)

Round 3 (Speed is reduced to 1/2)

Round 4 (Character is immobilized)

It requires a full round action to remove the pollen. After it is removed, the accumulation cycle begins anew.

item.title: Wood Plank on Ball Bearings (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several pits are regularly placed down this wooden hallway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

After each pit, each section of wooden floor sits atop several ball bearings. If someone jumps the pit, they land on the floor and it moves, dumping them into the pit. If they climb out of the pit, once they reach the top and grab the opposite floor, is slips towards them, dumping them back into the pit. Jumping (DC 22 Reflex Save or fall into the pit, taking 4d6 points of falling damage). Climbing out (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 4d6 points of falling damage)

item.title: Acid Pie (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door has a smaller viewing door in it.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If a PC opens the viewing door, they get hit in the face with a pie that is full of acid. Acid Pie (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d4 points of acid damage, plus 1 point of acid damage per round for 1d4+1 rounds)

item.title: Life Shield (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wide, but shallow pit blocks the way.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The bottom of the pit is 5' down and is an opaque shield that is a wall of force. However, the 2nd time it is touched, it is dispelled, revealing the real bottom 60' below. Pit (6d6 points of falling damage)

item.title: Oily Gold Sphere (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A golden sphere sits on a pedestal.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character picks up the sphere, oil exudes from the interior and it becomes slippery, causing the PC to drop it, creating an oil patch and having it roll over his words. Sphere (DC 17 Reflex Save or take 1d4-1 points of damage and fall prone); The sphere is coated in gold paint, it is otherwise worthless.

item.title: Paper Cut Scroll (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A few scrolls sit on a table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character picks up the scroll, it causes a papercut. Papercut (DC 16 Reflex Save or take 1 bleed damage)

item.title: Fatiguing Mirror (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An ornate mirror is at the end of the hallway.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

When a character looks in the mirror, he sees a reflection of himself that starts to sweat and look tired. Fatigue (DC 16 Will save or become fatigued)

item.title: Tainted Potion Bottle (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A single potion sits on a table.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

A small bit of oil has been applied to the lip of the potion bottle. Unless it is wiped clean, the imbiber will becomes sickened when ingesting the potion. Poison (DC 18 Fortitude Save or become sickened for 1d4 hours)

item.title: Suggestion Box (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden box is in the corner.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the box is opened, it tells the character to close it and go elsewhere. This carries the force of a suggestion spell. Suggestion Box (DC 19 Will Save or character closes lid and walks away)

item.title: Pitfall (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small chasm crosses the path, it can be easily jumped.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character jumps over the chasm, a pit is created via the create pit spell. Pit (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall into 10 foot pit, taking 1d6 damage)

item.title: Door Spikes (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door is closed, swollen, and stuck fast in its frame.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 22

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When a character tries to break the door down, spikes appear as soon as the door is hit. Spiked Door (+12 melee for 3d6 points of damage)

item.title: Pin Cushion (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It's a short drop off from the balcony to a padded cushion below.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

A balcony overlooks a plaza 20 feet below. Right below the balcony is a very large and thick cushion. The cushion, underneath about 6 inches of padding, is filled with spikes. Light objects tossed down will not reveal the spikes, only something > 5 lbs. Pin Cushion (8d6 damage, DC 24 Reflex Save for half damage if landed on from above)

item.title: Trompe L'oeil Cushion (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It's a short drop off from the balcony to a padded cushion below.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

A balcony overlooks a plaza 20 feet below. Right below the balcony is a very large and thick cushion. The cushion is a clever painting on the stone floor. Cushion (2d6 falling damage)

item.title: Water (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A cube of an unknown substance sits on a table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 25; Disable Device 25

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

A small block of sodium sits on a table. When it is touched, magical water is created and dumped on it, causing it to explode. Sodium (1d6 damage, DC 15 Reflex for half damage)

item.title: Roller Floor (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor of this room seems to be comprised of several parallel metal rollers.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Each movement action requires a DC 17 Acrobatics check of the character falls prone, requiring a DC 17 Acrobatics check to stand up. A character may crawl 5 feet per round, though. However, in the center of the room, the area under the rollers is magnetized. The Acrobatics check for any PC wearing metal armor increases to 25, and in order to stand up, a Strength or Escape Artist check of DC 22 is required, and the PC cannot crawl in this area.

item.title: Telescoping Ladder (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A ladder is leaning against the side of the building, going all the way to the roof of this three story building.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character reaches the middle of the third floor, the telescoping ladder collapses. Ladder Collapse (DC 19 Reflex Save or fall, taking 3d6 damage, any other PC's on the ladder must also save or fall)

item.title: Shadow Pits (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Large shadows dance about the floor.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The shadows on the floor move around and shift. Each one turns into a 10' pit if stepped on. It requires a DC 18 Acrobatics Check for each move to not step on a shadow. Shadow Pit (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, taking 1d6 damage)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: That's.....that's....awesome.

item.title: Golden Cannonball (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A single golden ball sits in the middle of the room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The golden cannonball is made of solid gold and worth 2,000 gp. It is also the only visible component of a large stack of otherwise normal cannonballs. When it is removed, (DC 21 Strength check) the other cannonballs tumble down on the PC. Stack of cannonballs (12d6 damage, DC 24 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in 20' cone)

item.title: Picket Line (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large mural is on the far wall, depicting several musketeers in battle.

Type: magical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PC's get within 10' of the wall, several muskets fire from behind the wall. Musket Fire (+8 vs touch AC for 1d8+4 damage); multiple targets (all targets in a 20' burst)

item.title: Cherry Bomb Trees (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several cheery trees are blooming, full of fruit.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

While walking under the trees, there is a 1 in 6 chance that they will drop a small cherry bomb on a random party member. Cherry Bomb (1d6 damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 10' take 1 splash damage)

item.title: Fire Blankets (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pile of neatly folded blankets sits on a shelf.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PCs enter the room, several small fires start all over the room. If the PCs are in one of the areas, they catch on fire as well, taking 1d6 fire damage per round. If the blankets are used to put out the fire on a PC, they instead entangle the PC and catch fire. The only way to put out this fire is by magical means or using at least 1 cubic foot of water. Entangling Blankets (DC 22 Reflex Save or become entangled, requiring a DC 22 Escape Artist or Strength check to escape. While entangled and on fire, PC takes 2d6 fire damage per round)

item.title: Donation Candles (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large donation tray sits near the door, it also contains a few burning candles, and wax pools in the bottom.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PC's enter the room, the candles are burning. Each round, the characters must make a DC 15 Fortitude Save or lose 1 temporary Con. If gold or silver coins are placed in the tray, in one round the wax mixes with the coins, creating a mist that cancels the candle effect for 1 hour. It also reverses the Con loss in 1d4 rounds.

item.title: Flint Doorknob (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden door leads deeper into the house. A doorknob can be used to open it.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When a character turns the doorknob, flint inside the mechanism strikes a spark the ignites an oil reservoir inside. Flint Doorknob (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 2d6 fire damage)

item.title: Bolt Bolts (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A metal door is bolted secure into its frame.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a bolt is unfastened, a crossbow bolt fires at the PC. Bolt (+8 melee attack for 1d8 damage)

item.title: Sponge (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several sponges are on the floor and wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC moves through the room, they must make a DC 18 Acrobatics check to avoid making contact with a sponge. Sponge (DC 18 Fortitude Save or take 1 cumulative bleed damage per round. Once attached, 2 consecutive saves are required to remove the sponge)

item.title: Sticky Welcome Mat (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A straw mat is just outside of the door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the door is opened, the entire mat area turns into a sticky tar. Tar Mat (DC 18 Acrobatics check or become immobilized, DC 18 Strength or Escape Artist check to move)

item.title: The Hand (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A painting of a mailed fist is on the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 33; Disable Device 33

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When anyone gets within 10' of the portrait, the fist reaches out and strikes the PC. Mailed Fist (+29 melee for 1d8+11 damage, DC 23 Fortitude save or be stunned for 1 round)

item.title: Corn Stalks (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A full cornfield takes up acres of space.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character leaves the cornfield, one of the stalks will follow him at a distance. (DC 22 Perception check to notice) When the PC is doing something risky, like a skill check that has bad consequences for failure or combat, the stalk will appear, and entangle the PC. Stalk (+12 CMB attack or PC becomes entagled. It's a DC 22 Escape Artist check or vs. 22 CMD to escape. Each round the PC takes 1d6 points of damage if entangled. The stallk is AC 12, hardness 1 and 12 hit points to destroy)

item.title: Cleansed by Flame (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stout wooden door is at the end of the hall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19(flame) 25 (poison); Disable Device 19 (flame) 23 (poison)

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a PC gets within 10' of the door, the opposite end of the hallway catches on fire. The fire moved 30 feet per round towards the door. Everyone in the path of the flames takes 1d6 fire damage, as the flame quickly goes out. It also burns the poison from the door. If the flame is prevented, the poison will be present. Poison (DC 19 Fortitude Save or take 1d3 Con damage per round. 1 Save cures)

item.title: Background Check (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A sign outside the door says "Weapons by criminals are not allowed"

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When a character walks through the doorway, all weapons he and anybody outside within 30 feet are carrying are immediately teleported into a hidden safe in the room (DC 31 Perception check, DC 35 Disable Device check to open, Hardness 20, 80HP to break) if that PC has ever committed a violent act. Background Check (DC 22 Will Save or weapons teleported to safe); multiple targets (all targets within 30' of first entrant)

item.title: Skull Pile (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pile of old skulls fills half of the room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

If the pile is searched, the skulls animate. Anyone in the same squares as the skulls takes 1d6 points of damage and becomes entangled (DC 22 Reflex Save negates). While entangled, the PCs take 1d6 damage per round, and must make a DC 22 Reflex Save to escape. A new save must be made every 5 feet of movement.

item.title: Speaking Spokes (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wagon sits near the city gate.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PC's begin to talk to the guards to get in, one of the wheels of the wagon will say random things in one of the PC's voices, adding 5 to the DC of any Diplomacy check.

item.title: Sinkholes (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The road ahead is uneven.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Small sinkholes litter the road. Mounted characters must make a Ride check, or their horse will step in a hole and become lame. The ride check is based on speed - Full - DC 25, Half, DC 20, Quarter - DC 15.

item.title: Blades of Grass (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A steep, grassy hillside leads down.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The hillside requires a DC 20 Acrobatics check to descend, or else the PC falls and rolls down the hill. About halfway down, the grass is composed of sharp blades. Blades of Grass (+16 melee attack for 3d6 damage)

item.title: Feet Waffler (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor of this room is made up of metal grates.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

Several of the grates in the room are heated. Feet Waffler (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 fire damage and become entangled, taking 1d6 fire damage per round until the PC escapes with a DC 18 Strength or Escape Artist check)

item.title: Gullion's Tiny Fist (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This is dedicated to my friend, Joshua...

An ornate sarcophagus sits in the middle of this crypt chamber. A raised sculpture of a might warrior is on the lid. He has a gilded sword and a tower shield. Emblazoned on the shield is a golden fist.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The sword and shield can be removed. If they are, they are each +1 cold iron. However, if the sarcophagus is disturbed, the golden fist vanishes. Small golden fists appear inside everyone within 30', clutching each of the character's hearts. Whenever a stressful action is taken, the PC must make a DC 21 Fortitude Save or suddenly have trouble breathing, taking a -4 penalty to that action. A stressful action is defined as any combat action or spell casting, or any skill check that has consequences for failure and/or requires physical action, such as an Acrobatics check. Additionally, if the first check is missed, the PC must make a second DC 21 Fortitude Save or become unconscious for 1d6 rounds. This effect can be removed with break enchantment, limited wish, miracle, remove curse, wish, or heal.

item.title: Spiral Stairway (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A circular stairway opens up in the middle of this tile floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset 1d6 rounds

Effect

When a PC descends 20 feet down, the stairs begin to rotate quickly, turning the stairs into metal blades. Spiral Stairway (+16 melee attack for 3d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets on staircase).

item.title: Snapdragon Sparklers (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several unlit sticks of incense protrude from several vases of scented oil.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The incense appears to be a type of incense of meditation with a shortened burn cycle and shortened effect. (10 minute burn, 1 hour spell effect) If any of them are picked up, they all ignite, causing 4d10 random 5 foot squares in the building to erupt in a fireworks display, each instance is resolved separately. Fireworks (1d4 fire damage and dazzled for one round, DC 15 Reflex Save negates dazzle and half damage, firework attacks continue for 1d4 rounds); multiple targets (4d10 random 5 foot squares)

item.title: Waterfall Painting (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A painting of a waterfall hangs on the wall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

A DC 19 Perception check reveals that the painting is covering a wall safe. However, removing the painting causes the waterfall to burst out of the painting, shooting a jet of water. Waterfall (DC 21 Reflex Save or take 5d6 damage and be knocked prone); Multiple targets (all targets in 20' line)

item.title: Last In, First Out (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A locked metal door is at the end of the hall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 25

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The door requires a DC 25 Disable Device Check to open. When it is opened, the last person to walk through the door must make a DC 25 Reflex Save or get pushed back outside as the door slams and re-locks. The DC of the Disable Device check is 25 for the solo character, and 40 for the rest of the party.

item.title: Strain Door (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door is made of several small, pointy pieces of metal sticking out in random directions, with an iron pull knob.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the knob is pulled, it grapples the PC's hand and pulls them through the door. Strain Door (+16 vs. CMD or be pulled through the door, taking 8d6 damage)

item.title: Crossed Swords (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A pair of crossed swords are mounted on the wall, above an arch.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When someone passes through the archway, the swords rotate downwards, cutting anything moving through the arch. Crossed Swords (+8 melee for 2d8+2 damage).

item.title: Slime Floor (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It's a short drop off from the balcony to a tiled floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device -

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

The floor below is made up of 6'x6'x6' blocks of a corrosive green slime, that from above, look like a tiled floor. If a character jumps down, he sinks all the way to the bottom, where he takes 1d6 points of acid damage per round. It is a DC 20 Climb check to climb the sides to get out, and a PC can move 5 feet per round through the slime.

item.title: Darkness (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The room is flooded in darkness.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The room becomes very dark. All light sources are neutralized. Torches and extinguished, magical light sources no longer operate, and even darkvision does not work. The only way to get back light is to use a non-magical light source. All innate abilities and magical light/seeing effects do not function in this area. Feel free to litter the room with pits, spikes or whatever else you see fit to make the darkness more than a mere inconvenience.

item.title: Splintered Floor (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor of this room is made up of old, splintered planks.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

About halfway across the room, the floor tilts when stepped on, causing the PC to slide down the wood, collecting splinters along the way. Splintered Floor (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 1d6 bleed damage and fall prone, requiring a DC 10 Climb check to climb out of the tilted floor area)

item.title: Steam Jets (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Steam shoots up through several nozzles in the floor randomly.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Steam shoots up from several spots. A DC 18 Acrobatics check is required for each move action or the PC takes 1d6 steam damage. If the Disable Device check is failed by less than 5, the random steam jets stop for 2d4+1 rounds. However, after that time, every jet violently shoots steam upwards. Steam Jets (4d6 steam damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in room).

item.title: Hat Rack (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several hats hang from a wooden hat rack.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If any of the hats are touched, the hooks on the rack constrict about the character's limbs, and then they pull them in opposite directions. Hat Rack (+14 vs. CMD or take 1d6 damage per round, DC 24 Escape Artist or CMD to escape)

item.title: Thin Cooled Lava (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The ground is covered in a layer of cooled lava.

Type: natural; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Several spots in the cooled lava are thin and weak. Stepping on these spots causes the ground to crack and break, dumping the PC into some not quite so cooled lava. Lava (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 fire damage per round, DC 12 Strength or Escape Artist to free oneself from lava)

item.title: Copper Door Handle (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door handle is made from copper.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the handle is grasped, a continuous electric charge is applied to the PC which may also cause his muscled to contract, making him unable to let go. Door Handle (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d6 electricity damage and become immobilized. Each round, PC may make a DC 18 Fortitude Save to free himself or take an additional 1d6 electricity damage per round. PC can also be freed by another PC by either delivering a bludgeoning attack that deals at least 5 damage or performing a successful attack vs. the PC's CMD)

item.title: Trompe-l'œil Wall (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small chasm cuts across the hallway. It continues on the other side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The chasm is 10 feet wide and 30 feet deep. It can be easily jumped with a DC 10 Acrobatics check. However, the far side is a cleverly painted wall. Those that jump strike the far wall and fall. Wall (3d6 falling damage)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I can't wait to use this!

item.title: Faerie Chest (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A single wooden chest is in the back of this store room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the chest is opened, everyone within 5 ft becomes outlined in a pale glow as per the faerie fire spell for 2 minutes.

item.title: Fabricated Manacles (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Sacks of gold coins have been placed on the floor near the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The coins are actually painted pieces of iron. When they are touched, they form into manacles that shackle the PC to the wall. Shackles (DC 19 Reflex Save or become entangled. DC 19 Escape Artist check or DC 25 Strength check to escape)

item.title: Needle Trees (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several pine trees grow here in small clusters.

Type: natural; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

Several of the needles on the trees are very sharp and poisonous. During each round spent moving through the trees, several needles fall from the trees, sticking the PCs. Needles (+16 melee for 1d2 damage plus DC 13 Fortitude Save or take 1d3 Strength damage); multiple targets (all targets among trees)

item.title: Hot Springs (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The path winds its way through several bubbling hot springs.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

The paths are covered in loose gravel and dirt. Unless a DC 25 Acrobatics check is made for each movement, some of the rocks and dirt roll off the side of the path, splashing into the hot springs and causing boiling water and steam to shoot up. Geysers (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 1d6 fire damage); multiple targets (all targets on path)

item.title: Panini Portcullis (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stone archway is in front of you. It appears that it has a portcullis that is raised.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a PC crosses under the open portcullis, 2 on either side swing down, smashing the PC between them. Panini Portcullis (DC 31 Reflex Save or take 4d6 damage and become pinned, requiring a DC 28 Strength or Escape Artist check to free oneself, or someone who is free can make a DC 25 Disable Device or Engineering check)

item.title: Acid Bottles (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several bottles of bubbly liquid sit on a shelf.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

There are six bottles full of acid. However, the bottles are weak and stuck to the shelf. Picking one up cause it to break, spilling acid everywhere. Spilled Acid (DC 21 Reflex Save or take 2d6 acid damage)

item.title: Chile Powder False Door (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stout wooden door is on the other side of the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The door is stuck and won't open. Behind the door is a small space containing several small pillows filled with chile powder. If the door is broken to open, the pillows puff out the powder in a huge cloud. Chile Powder Door (DC 19 Fortitude Save or become blinded and nauseated for 1d6 rounds); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Tilting and Grating Wall (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This wall is about 40 feet tall and has lots of handholds.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 22

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

About 30 feet up, the wall tilts over, sending the PC sliding down the wall. However, the handholds from this angle act much like a cheese grater. Tilting Wall (DC 22 Reflex Save or slide down wall, taking 6d6 damage)

item.title: Heated Rung (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Iron rungs have been set into the stone wall, creating a ladder.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

About 30 feet up, one of the rungs has been heated. Heated Rung (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 1d4 fire damage and then make a DC 22 Reflex Save or fall, taking 3d6 damage)

item.title: Landing Spikes (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
It is a short drop to the floor below.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When a PC lands on the floor, it flips up a set of spikes from directly in front of the PC. Spikes (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 2d6 damage)

item.title: Flipping Rung (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Iron rungs have been set into the stone wall, creating a ladder going down.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

About 20 feet down, one of the rungs rotates into the wall when pressure is applied. Flipping Rung (DC 19 Reflex Save or fall, taking 3d6 damage)

item.title: Wired Shaft (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A smooth cylindrical shaft leads down about 7-8 feet.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

About 4 feet down, a thin, razor sharp wire is strung across the shaft. PC's that jump in get sliced. Razor Wire(+12 melee for 1d8+3 damage - 18-20/x2)

item.title: Icy Rungs (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Iron rungs have been set into the stone wall, creating a ladder.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Several of the uppermost rungs are covered in a thin coat of black ice. Icy Rungs (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, taking 3d6 damage)

item.title: Barbed Doorknob (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A polished brass doorknob is set into the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the doorknob is turned, a small, barbed bit drives into the PC's hand, entangling the PC to the door. Doorknob (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 1d4 damage and become entangled, DC 22 Escape Artist to escape, or DC 17 Strength check and take an additional 1d4 damage tearing the barb away)

item.title: Cutlery Drawer (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The top drawer on this stout oak desk is locked.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The drawer is filled with dozens of knives. When opened, they fly out in all directions. Cutlery (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 4d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets within 15')

item.title: Calling Cards (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several valuables lay around the room, each has a calling card stuck to it.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

Each calling card has been coated with Tears of Death. (DC 22 Fortitude Save or 1d6 Con damage and paralyzed for 1 minute, Onset 1 minute, Frequency 1/minute for 6 minutes)

item.title: Color Spray Chest (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A red chest, banded with brass fittings, sits in the corner.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the chest is opened, a color spray (as the spell at CL 1, DC 11) is activated.

item.title: Waxed Floor (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The stone floor is shiny and highly polished.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The floor has been recently waxed. Treat as difficult terrain. Anytime an action other than a single movement action is taken (i.e. combat, double-move, etc) the PC must make a DC 17 Acrobatics check or fall prone.

item.title: Fan Shaft (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stone shaft leads downwards; iron rungs, creating a ladder are set into one side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

About 30 feet down, several rungs retract into the wall, causing the character to fall 30 feet, where a spinning fan is mounted 10 feet above the floor. Fan (DC 21 Reflex Save or fall, taking 3d6 falling damage, plus +16 melee attack for 3d6 damage)

item.title: Leaning Ladder (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A ladder is wedged across the hallway.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset none

Effect

When a PC walks under the ladder (there is no way to avoid it without destroying it or climbing around it) they are hit with a bestow curse spell (DC 14 Will Save, CL 5) which gives a -4 penalty on attack, saves, ability and skill checks.

item.title: Tacky Rung (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Iron rungs have been set into the stone wall, making a ladder that goes up.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset auto

Effect

About 20 feet up, one of the rungs has small spikes on the surface. Spikes (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, taking 2d6 damage)

item.title: Marble Statue (CR 11)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large marble statue dominates the end of the hall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger proximity; Reset Auto

Effect

Anyone in the room is immediately in awe of the statue. Awe (DC 27 Will Save or become awed for 17 rounds. Awed PCs fall prostrate and are considered helpless. A PC that saves is staggered for 1 round. Awed PCs may make a new save every round. If they save, they are staggered for 1d4 rounds and take 1d6 Wisdom damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Ant Door (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several woven mats line the doorway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The mats are lined with bullet ants. Anyone passing through the door gets stung several times. Ant Sting (DC 24 Fortitude Save or become helpless for 4d6 hours as they fall down in excruciating pain. Each hour the PC must also make a DC 21 Will Save or lose 1 Wisdom point. Once the effect ends, the character gains the exhausted condition)

item.title: Mood Swing (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A rope hangs from the ceiling, dangling over the center of a small chasm.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

Jumping across the chasm requires a DC 30 Acrobatics check, as it is 30 feet wide. Using the rope, however, only requires a DC 10 Acrobatics check. However if the rope is used, the PC must make a DC 16 Will Save or become shaken for 1d4 rounds.

item.title: Sodium Drain (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A covered drain is set into the center tile of this room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset none

Effect

After everyone is in the room, it seals and begins to flood with water. If the drain cover is removed (DC 17 Strength check) the water quickly drains from the room. However, the drain is lined with sodium, which explodes. Sodium (DC 23 Reflex Save or taje 6d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Gem in Horn (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large, red gem is stuck into the wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the gem is removed, a sonic blast emanates from the hole, dealing 1d8 points of damage in a 30' cone. Also, anyone in the cone must make a DC 18 Fortitude Save or become stunned for 1 round. The gem is worth 100gp.

item.title: Shouting Mosaic (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A mosaic of a fair lass is set into the floor, done in colored glass.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Unless specifically avoided, the mosaic will be stepped on. When stepped on or examined closely, it screams. Scream (1d6 sonic damage and become dazed for 1 round, DC 16 Fortitude Save for half damage and negates daze)

item.title: Incorporeal Wall (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wall between the two rooms seems translucent.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The wall is incorporeal, and objects and even hands/arms can freely pass through. However a PC steps through the wall, it immediately turns to solid stone, and also turns the PC to stone. Stone (DC 19 Fortitude Save or be turned to stone inside the wall) PCs turned to stone are stuck in the wall. If restored to flesh while still in the wall they are instantly killed, and must be removed before restored.

item.title: Itching Door (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wooden door at the end of the hall is swollen and stuck.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

It requires a DC 22 Break check to open the door. If the check succeeds, a cloud of dust emanates from the door, causing intense itching. Dust (DC 22 Fortitude Save or itch for 1d4+1 minutes. During this time, skill checks and attack rolls are at -4, anything that requires concentration needs a DC 20 Will Save to attempt, and spellcasters must also make concentration checks when casting spells); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Paper Floor Pit (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden floor stretches across the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Just inside the door, a 5' section of floor has been replaced by a carefully disguised piece of paper that looks like the floor. Paper Floor Pit (DC 17 Reflex Save or fall into 20' pit, taking 2d6 damage)

item.title: Flowing Stream (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large stream crosses the road at the ford here.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset none

Effect

Instead of water, the stream is filled with a fog-like substance that looks like water. Anyone crossing immediately drop to the bottom, about 10' down. The only way out is to climb the banks, which requires a DC 20 Climb check. Anyone in the fog also takes a -2 penalty to movement-based skill checks, as well as melee attacks.

item.title: Impaling Ladder (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden ladder is set against the wall, leading down about 30 feet.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

About 10 feet down, the rung that is stepped on collapses. At the same time, all the other rungs below break in two and fold upwards, creating several spikes. Ladder (DC 19 Reflex Save or fall, taking 2d6 falling plus 2d6+3 impaling damage)

item.title: Flint Staircase (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An irregular stone staircase leads downward.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Several of the stairs are covered in oil. When reached, the character must make a DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, sliding down several stairs for 1d6 damage. Standing up requires a DC 15 Acrobatics check, and if the PC expects the oily stair, a DC 15 Acrobatics check is required to move without falling. Additionally, falling characters wearing metal armor cause the oil to ignite, dealing 1d6 damage per round for 2d4+1 rounds, after which all the oil is burned away.

item.title: Missing Stair (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Plush carpet runs down the staircase.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

About 1/3 of the way down the staircase, a stair is missing, but the carpet is shaped like there is a stair. Missing Stair (DC 17 Reflex Save or fall down stairs, taking 1d6 damage and knocked prone)

item.title: One Way Mirror (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large mirror is set at the end of the hallway, but the reflection is... off?

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset none

Effect

Anything that touches the mirror can pass through it. However, as soon as a PC passes through the mirror, they end up in a small closet, with a mirror behind them that mirrors the interior of the closet, and is impassable, as a wall of force activates, that has the illusion of a mirror on its surface. One Way Mirror (DC 17 Reflex Save or become trapped on far side of wall)

item.title: Dangling Rope Ladder (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The only way up appears to be via a rope ladder that is dangling in the breeze.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The rope ladder is 40' long. When a PC reaches the 20' mark, the rope begins to animate and twist, tying up the PC. Rope Ladder (DC 19 Reflex Save or become entangled in the rope, which requires a DC 19 Escape Artist or Strength check to escape. After escaping, another DC 19 Reflex Save must be made.
