If the first Reflex Save fails by more than 5, the character instead falls, taking 2d6 damage. If the second Reflex Save is failed, the character also falls, taking 2d6 damage)

item.title: Trick Rope Trick (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A rope leads up 30' in the air next to a smooth wall. It appears to be attached to thin air.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The rope is attached to an invisible, levitating spike. When more than 100 lbs of force is applied, the spike releases. Rope and spike fall. Spike (DC 17 Will and Reflex Save or take 1d6+3 damage)

item.title: Reverse Gravity Pit (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A 10' square hole is in the ceiling just ahead.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The hole in the ceiling is a tall 10'x10' shaft, that goes up 60 feet. When a PC walks underneath it, gravity reverses, until they hit the top. It is then restored and they fall back down. Reverse gravity (DC 20 Reflex Save or take 7d6 + 7d6 falling damage); multiple targets (all targets in 10'x10' square underneath the shaft)

item.title: Wood You Loot this Chest? (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A sturdy wooden chest is hidden in the corner, barely visible.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The chest is filled with about 4,000 gp. However, when opened, a transmute metal to wood spell is triggered, rendering all the gp into worthless wooden coins, and oh, anything on the PCs within 40 feet.

item.title: Rage Timer (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large mosaic of a cute teddy bear is on the far wall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Any PC that is in or enters a rage becomes calmed, ending the rage. Rage Timer (DC 13 Will Save or rage ends, with normal end of rage effects); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Candle Fuses (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several lit candles are in a candleholder, filled with black sand.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The candles burn for 2 rounds, and then they reach the black sand, which is black powder and explodes. Black Powder (6d6 damage, DC 18 Reflex for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30' of candles)

item.title: Awkward Teleporter (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wide chasm blocks the path. It could probably be jumped with a running start.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

5 feet before the edge of the 25 foot wide chasm there is a teleporter pad. When stepped on, it teleports the PC just over the edge of the chasm. Teleporter (DC 17 Will Save or be teleported just over chasm, where the PC falls 60 feet, taking 6d6 damage)

item.title: Cape Fan (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several large fans are inset into the side walls.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

If a PC wearing a cloak gets within 5 feet of one of the fans, it will activate, sucking the cloak into the fan. Fan (Cloak gets caught in fan and is destroyed. Magical cloaks may make a DC 22 Reflex Save to avoid being destroyed. If the initial Reflex Save is failed by 5 or more, the PC also takes 8d6 damage from fan)

item.title: Glue Door (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door at the end of the hall appears stuck.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The door is stuck and requires a DC 22 Break check to open. However, if the door is hit with enough force to open it (i.e. passing the check) glue oozes out from beneath the wood, sticking fast to anything that is in contact. This glue can only be removed with universal solvent, oil of slipperiness, or similar items.

item.title: Metal Tick (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Lots of bugs seem to be crawling around in the tall grass.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

This area is infested with Metal Ticks. For each movement action spent in the grass, the following effect is triggered. Metal Tick (+8 melee or a tick attaches to you, which is a DC 31 Perception check to notice. After 24 hours, a DC 19 Fortitude Save must be made, or the PC develops an allergy to all metal. Simply touching metal causes a severe reaction, and grants the nauseated condition while contact is made and for 1 hours afterwards. This allergy can only be removed with a cure disease or similar spell)

item.title: Dunce Cap (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A white dunce cap sits on a table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the cap is touched, the PC becomes bungled. Dunce Cap (DC 11 Will Save or take a -20 penalty on next attack roll or skill check)

item.title: Who is in the Mirror? (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small mirror sits on the table in the middle of the room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

If the mirror is looked at, instead of reflecting the person looking at the mirror, it reflects the person closest to him. The person looking in the mirror then feels unadulterated loathing for him as per the spell. Unadulterated Loathing (DC 14 Will Save or become nauseated when within 60 feet of target. Effect lasts for 5 days)

item.title: Monkeys in a Barrel (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several barrels are stacked in a corner.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Each barrel is full of fine ale and trapped so that if opened, the mad monkeys spell is triggered. Mad Monkeys (a monkey swarm appears for 5 rounds).

item.title: Slow Down! (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A sign is posted near the fork in the corridor ahead.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

Once a PC gets within 30 feet of the sign, it is legible. If read, it triggers a symbol of slowing. Symbol of Slowing (DC 16 Will save or become slowed for 7 rounds); multiple targets (all targets within 60 feet of sign)

item.title: Grease Fire (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The stone floor is somewhat slick in here.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The floor is covered in grease. Treat as difficult terrain. Any movement actions that are more than normal speed require a DC 15 Acrobatics check or the PC is knocked prone. About halfway thru the room, a large spark triggers a grease fire. PC's in the fire take 1d6 fire damage per round, and those that fail a DC 15 Reflex Save are set on fire, and take an additional 1d6 fire damage per round. It is a full round action to extinguish the fire on a PC. However, if water is used, hot grease splatters everywhere, and everyone within 20' takes 3d6 damage. (DC 17 Reflex Save for half damage)

item.title: Swinging Portcullis (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The hallway is blocked by a closed portcullis.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

If the portcullis is fully raised, (DC 22 Strength check) once it gets to the top, it falls sideways and swings through the entire area. Swinging portcullis (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 2d6 points of damage); multiple targets (all targets within 10')

item.title: Trash Compactor (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The stone floor is smooth and a bit greasy.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Halfway down the hallway, the floor hinges open, dumping the PC into a 10' pit. The walls of the pit then quickly close. Pit (DC 22 Reflex Save or fall into pit, taking 1d6 falling damage and 3d6 crushing damage)

item.title: Scissor Stair (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A wooden stairway leads down.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 23; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Underneath one of the stairs is a pair of iron scissors. When the stair below it is stepped on, they close quickly. Scissor (+16 vs. AC for 1d12 damage)

item.title: Loose Brick (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Iron rungs have been set into the brick wall, creating a ladder.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

One of the bricks that a rung is attached to is loose, and not mortared into the wall. When this rung is grabbed, the brick is pulled loose. Loose Brick (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall 20', taking 2d6 damage)

item.title: Magnetic Spikes (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is littered with 6" metal spikes.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the trap is triggered, those wearing metal armor are pulled down into the spikes. Magnetic Spikes (+12 (light armor), +14 (med armor), +16 (heavy armor) vs. CMD or target is knocked prone, taking 1d6+3 damage); multiple targets (all targets in room wearing metal armor)

item.title: Blind Corner (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Up ahead, the corner takes a 90 degree turn right.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the corner is rounded, several small shards of metal explode out of the wall. Shards (DC 19 Reflex Save or become blinded until magical healing is applied); multiple targets (all targets within 15')

item.title: Bane Pipes (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small pipe organ is on the other side of the room.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset done

Effect

When anyone gets within 15' of the organ, it begins to play a dirge. This dirge has the effect of a bane spell. Bane Organ (DC 11 Will save or -1 penalty to attack rolls and fear saves); multiple targets (all targets within 50')

item.title: Goblin Mines (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor looks damaged or dug up in places.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Several low quality mines have been buried in the floor. When stepped on, they explode 1 round later. Mines (DC 18 Acrobatics check per movement action or mine is stepped on and explodes 1 round later. 3d6 damage, DC 18 Reflex for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Iron Cross (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Each door  of the double door has a handle.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The only way to open the door is to operate both handles at once. Once done, the handles clamp down, and the doors slowly open, after 1 round, they begin to pull apart the PC. Door handles (DC 23 Reflex Save or become clamped. After 1 round, DC 25 Strength check or take 3d6 damage each round. DC 30 Strength, Escape Artist or Disable Device check to escape)

item.title: Molten Wall (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wall is very hot.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The wall is extremely hot. If disturbed in any manner, it liquifies. Molten Wall (6d6 damage, DC 23 Reflex for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 15' of wall)

item.title: Clock Door (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large clock face has been carved into the stone door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

In order to open the door, the correct time must be entered by using ones arms as the clock hands. However, if the incorrect time is entered, the target ages by the hour hand he enters. (DC 23 Will Save negates)

item.title: Hand Lock (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small stone hand sits on a pedestal in front of a featureless stone door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger touch; Reset Up to 3 times

Effect

The hand unlocks the door. One of the fingers, if moved, opens the door. If any of the other 4 are moved, the target instead takes damage. Hand Lock (7d10 damage, DC 20 Fortitude Save and take 3d6 + 13 damage instead) Once the correct finger is moved, the door opens and the hand becomes inert.

item.title: Gravity Shaft (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A switch is on the back wall of this vertical stone shaft. Arrows point up and down.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger touch; Reset 1 round

Effect

When the switch is flipped, the gravity reverses in the shaft, which is 100 ft high. Characters falling the entire length take 10d6 damage. There is a switch at the top as well.

item.title: Rust Dust (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Everything in this room is coated in a reddish-brown dust.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Halfway into the room, a huge gust of wind is triggered, blowing the dust everywhere. Anything metal that is exposed gains the broken condition. Masterwork and magical items get a DC 15 Fortitude Save.

item.title: Spears and Corrugated Tin Roof (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The roof seems to be made of corrugated tin, and is installed at a sharp angle.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

At the very top of the roof, a spear has been placed in each corrugated "row", and locked in with a spring. When someone gets close to the building the springs expand, sending the spears down the roof. Spears (1d4 + 1 spears at +8 melee for 1d6+3 damage each); multiple targets (all targets within 5 foot of wall)

item.title: Doorknob Screw (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door has a simple looking doorknob with a large, round keyhole.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the doorknob is turned, a spring loaded screw drives itself into the target's hand. Doorknob Screw (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 1d3 damage and become entangled and immobilized, DC 18 Strength check and take an additional 1d3 damage or DC 18 Escape Artist check to escape)

item.title: Blinded by my Own Headgear (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Two statues point at you from the end of the hall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger visual; Reset none

Effect

When a PC gets within 10' of the statues, they turn and point at him. Pointing (DC 14 Reflex Save or any headgear moves itself into a position where the eyes are covered, coming down, turning around, etc); multiple targets (all targets within 30' of target PC)

item.title: You no take candle! (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An expensive, ceremonial candle is set into a gold holder. It is alight.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

The actual candle is a wax coating around a fuse. If the candle or holder are disturbed, the wax peels away and the fuse immediately burns down to the explosives under the floor. Candle Fuse (10d6 fire damage, DC 22 Reflex for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Force Chains (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The tiles are highly polished, but have scratches in places on the floor.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

When the trap is triggered, chains of force descend upon the target, rooting him to the floor. Force Chains (DC 17 Reflex Save or become pinned. Once pinned, it requires a DC 24 Escape Artist or Strength check to escape by crawling away, if the PC tries to stand up, a DC 30 Strength check must be made or the standing up action is unsuccessful)

item.title: Negative Energy Door (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The featureless metal door is cool to the touch.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

When the door is touched, the target gains negative levels. Negative Energy Door (+5 ranged touch or gain 1d4 negative levels) The door opens if 2 or more negative levels are gained from the trap. Otherwise, it must be broken down. The door has 10 hardness, 90 hp and a break DC of 30.

item.title: Hungry Coin Purse (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A leather coin purse lies on the ground, full of coins.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If tipped, the coins get stuck on the hem of the bag. If someone sticks their hand in the bag, the bag chomps down on it. Hungry Coin Purse (+8 melee for 1d6+1 damage)

item.title: Teleport Guard (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A few chests are in the back of the closet.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

One of the chest if full of gold coins. Anyone carrying these coins is teleported to a locked cell in the basement if the coins are removed from a 100' radius of the chests. Teleport (DC 22 Will Save or be teleported into a locked cell. Cell is a DC 25 Disable Device Check to unlock, or DC 30 to break out); multiple targets (all targets carrying coins)

item.title: Sparta Door (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stout wooden door has been set into the wall, which overlooks a steep cliff.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

If the door is opened, it kicks the person off the walkway, over the cliff. Sparta (+18 CMB or be knocked back 10 feet, falling for 10d6 damage)

item.title: Bleed Torches (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several quality-looking torches are unlit in their wall holders.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

These torches seem to last a very long time. However, when list, the smoke they emit causes anyone injured in a 15' radius of the torch to take 1 bleed damage. Bleed (DC 18 Fortitude Save or take 1 bleed damage); multiple targets (all targets within 15')

item.title: Tax Bill (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A scroll is sealed on the table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the scroll is opened, it appears to be a tax bill that also causes fear. Fear (DC 12 Will Save or become frightened for 1d4 rounds, if 5th level or less, otherwise, they are shaken for 1 round)

item.title: Overhead Electric Wires (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several sparking wires hang from the ceiling.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset none

Effect

The wires on the ceiling dangle about 6 feet from the floor. They can be easily avoided. However, when someone gets to the middle of the room, a mass enlarge is set off. Mass Enlarge (DC 16 Fortitude Save or become one size bigger, creatures that are now Large or above must make a DC 16 Reflex Save or touch the wires for 5d6 electrical damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Spittoon (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A spittoon sits in the corner, slightly smoking.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset 1/day

Effect

The spittoon sits on a small volcanic vent. Every day, unless it is spit into with special tobacco (located in a drawer with a DC 20 Perception check), it will erupt, spewing lava, smoke and ash into the room. Lava, smoke and ash (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 3d6 fire damage plus DC 19 Fortitude Save or take 1d6 asphyxiation damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Portcullis Gears (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Huge gears are at the end of the hall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 33

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The huge gears at the end of the hall are for the tower sized portcullis at the entrance to the castle. However, when activated, several more large supporting gears pop out in the hall. Gears (DC 28 Reflex Save or take 10d6 damage and become stuck in a gear, taking 5d6 damage per round. It requires a DC 25 Escape Artist or 28 CMD to escape the gears); multiple targets (all targets in hallway)

item.title: Shackle Rung (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Iron rungs have been set into the stone wall, creating a ladder.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

About 30 feet down, when one of the rungs is stepped on, a shackle attaches to the leg with a 1 foot chain attaching it to the rung. Shackle (DC 22 Reflex Save or become shackled. DC 30 Break, Escape Artist or Disable Device check to escape. Being shackled imparts a an additional -4 penalty on these checks to any PC that has a 0 or less Dex modifier)

item.title: Rug Over Hole (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A ladder stops down the wall, about 8 feet above the floor. Underneath the ladder is a throw rug.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 16

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

Underneath the rug, there is a hole in the floor. If the rug is dropped on or stepped on, it falls down the hole. Hole (DC 22 Reflex Save or fall 40 feet, taking 4d6 damage)

item.title: Arrow Attracting Glove Box (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A glove box is inset into the large stone doors. Inside the box are several holes, a lock, and a key. Gloves are inside the box, and can be used or bypassed. The key glistens with an unknown liquid.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The liquid on the key is oil. Anyone not using the gloves must make a DC 24 Reflex Save to hang onto the key to open the lock. The holes are filled with arrows, and the gloves attract arrows. If the gloves are put on, all of the arrows fire. Glove Box (10 arrows +8 ranged melee for 1d6 damage each)

item.title: Barbed Wire Coils (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The tile of the floor has round shapes in the middle.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Several of the tiles are trapped. When stepped on, a spring-like coil of barbed wire shoots upward, slicing and trapping the PC. Barbed Wire (DC 24 Reflex Save or take 3d6 damage plus become entangled with the wire. Escaping requires a DC 30 Break check or DC 25 Escape Artist check. The wire can also be broken, it has hardness 10 and 80hp. PC's take 1d6 bleed damage per round trapped in the wire)

item.title: Dusty Curtains (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Thick, dusty curtains hang in the doorway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 24

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The curtains are actually infested with spores that release insanity mist when moved. Insanity Mist (DC 15 Fortitude Save or take 1d3 Wis damage per round for 6 rounds, 1 save cures); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: That's Why They Are Round (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several grates make up the floor.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Some of the grates aren't set correctly. When stepped on, they tip, spilling the PC down the shaft, and then the grate teeters on the edge and falls down as well. Grate (DC 18 Reflex save or fall, taking 2d6 damage, then +8 melee for 1d8 damage)

item.title: Acid Rain (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The ceiling has several small holes.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

A few pressure plates around the room spring this trap. When activated, a light acid mist fills the room, coming from the ceiling. Acid Rain (2d6 damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Potions on a Shelf (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several potions sit atop a high shelf.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Six potions have been sitting on the shelf for quite some time. When any of them are removed, they briefly stick to the shelving, causing it to tumble, dumping the rest of the potions to the floor, where they shatter. They also happen to be alchemist's fire. Potions (+5 vs. AC 5 for 5d6 damage, and 5 splash damage in each adjacent square)

item.title: Bag Rug (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large rug takes up most of the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When someone steps a few feet into the rug, the corners are pulled up, forming a sack shape. It then slams into the ceiling and hangs. Bag Rug (DC 18 Reflex Save or become pinned and take 1d6 damage. It is a DC 25 Escape Artist check to escape, or 2 full rounds if using a knife, dagger, or some other short blade)

item.title: Buried Treasure (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The map says the treasure is buried here.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset none

Effect

Detect magic spells show lots of magic buried underneath the ground here. About 10 feet down is a treasure chest that has been enchanted to seem like it contains magic. When it is opened, however, it is empty. At the same time, all the dirt removed from the hole falls back in. Dirt (DC 21 Reflex Save or become pinned under the dirt, taking 3d6 damage, and begin suffocating. A DC 20 Escape Artist or Strength check is required to move 5 feet each round, taking 2 rounds to leave); multiple targets (all targets in hole)

item.title: Blades of Grass (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The base of the hill is grassy.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device -

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

A 30'x30' patch of grass at the base of the hill is made up of very sharp and stiff blades of grass. Anyone moving through it must make a DC 15 Acrobatics check for each move action or take 1d6+1 damage.

item.title: Trick or Treat (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Two doors are at the end of the hallway. One is labelled "Trick" and the other is labelled "Treat".

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device -

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

If the trick door is opened, it appears to be a long hallway. This is an illusion (DC 14 Will Save to disbelieve) and is actually just a wall. The treat door opens up to a long, wet, rough stone hallway. A DC 20 Perception check will reveal that the floor and ceiling, just inside the doorframe, appear to have teeth. If anyone walks in, the doorframe closes, biting the PC. Treat (+16 melee attack for 3d6 damage, on successful hit, character is engulfed, and must cause 60 hp of damage to the inside of the beast (AC 5) to escape. The PC takes 2d6 damage per round while trapped inside)

item.title: Fall Leaves (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The trees are covered in orange and red leaves, and a slight breeze begins to gently blow the leaves.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device -

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The leaves are extremely rigid and sharp. Each movement action spent in this forest is a chance for a leaf to hit the PC. Leaf (+8 melee for 1d6+1 damage); multiple targets (all targets in forest)

item.title: (mis)spellbook (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A thick spellbook sits on a table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

Anyone reading this spellbook becomes dyslexic. Dyslexia (DC 19 Will Save or become dyslexic. Dyslexic characters must make concentration checks at DC 10 + Spell level when memorizing written spells or reading casting from scrolls. Reading based skill checks are at DC +2)

item.title: Rung Bell (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Iron rungs have been set into the stone wall, creating a ladder.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

About 30 feet up, one of the rungs has been rigged to move slightly, ringing a loud bell when pressure is applied to it.

item.title: Rain of Terror (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Dark clouds gather overhead.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset none

Effect

As soon as the torrential downpour starts, it causes fear as the spell. Fear (DC 21 Will Save or be panicked for 7 rounds, else be shaken for 1 round); multiple targets (all targets in downpour; once affected, target cannot be affected again for 24 hours)

item.title: Loose Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A heavy iron door is at the end of the hallway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

The door's hinges have rusted out. When the door is pulled to open, it falls. Loose door (DC 18 Reflex Save or take 2d6 damage and become pinned, requiring a DC 19 Strength or Escape Artist check to escape)

item.title: Wires in the Floor (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A metal door is set at the end of the hallway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is opened, it discharges an electrical charge. The floor is also covered in a small, nearly invisible wire mesh that carries the charge. Charge (4d6 electrical damage, DC 21 Fortitude Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30' of this side of door)

item.title: Arrow Door (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several small arrows have been painted pointing at the exit door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door that the arrows are pointing to is opened, an arrow fires from it. Arrow (+8 melee for 1d8 damage)

item.title: Illusion Shaft (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small close is at the end of the hall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The floor of the closet is an illusion, covering a 60 shaft. Illusion Shaft (DC 14 Will Save to disbelieve floor, else DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, taking 6d6 damage)

item.title: Low Hanging Fruit (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several branches hang low in the path, dangling ripe pieces of fruit.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the fruit is picked or moved aside, it explodes. Fruit (6d6 damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Deglove (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The wall in front of you has a glass covered inset in the middle. Inside is a knob that looks like it can be turned. A small opening is in the front of the glass. A glove is fitted into the opening, and it looks like, if worn, the glove would reach the knob.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

Turning the knob causes the wall to slide open. The inside of the box is filled with an acid mist that deals 1d6 damage per round. The glove protects the hand from the mist. However, if the glove is put on, once the knob is turned, little hooks appear and the glove is yanked off, degloving the fingers and exposing them to the acid. Deglove (1d6 Dex damage plus 2d6 acid damage plus 2 bleed damage, DC 22 Reflex Save for half of each type of damage)

item.title: Whine Skin (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
You trip, skinning a knee.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset none

Effect

The PC must make a DC 22 Reflex save or fall, taking 1 point of damage and skinning a knee, elbow, etc. When this happens, a small magic mouth is cast on the injury. The magic mouth will speak often, complaining and making inappropriate comments. Stealth and Diplomacy DCs are increased by 5 while the magic mouth exists. It can be removed with a DC 11 dispel magic check, or it disappears on its own in 1d4+1 days.

item.title: Thin Wall of Fire (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A thin wall of flame blocks the path to the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The flames are near one end of the hallway. There is a 10' space between it and the far door. A DC 15 Acrobatics check allows a PC to jump through the fire unharmed, else the PC takes 1d6 fire damage. When the door is opened, the pressure change causes the flames to rush into the room. Flames (3d6 fire damage, DC 18 Reflex Save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets between flames and door)

item.title: Cube in the Ceiling (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A portcullis is closed in front of you.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset none

Effect

Hidden up in the ceiling is a gelatinous cube. When the portcullis is raised, the cube is pushed out through the ceiling, landing in the 10x10 area in front of the portcullis. Falling Cube (DC 17 Reflex save or become engulfed by gelatinous cube); multiple targets (all targets in 10x10 area in front of portcullis)

item.title: Pit in a Pit (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A ladder leads down on one side of a 20 foot deep pit.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

About halfway down the ladder, it breaks off from the wall. The floor of the pit breaks, revealing a shaft that goes another 30 feet down, filled with spikes. Pit (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, taking 4d6 falling damage + 2d6 piercing damage)

item.title: Spring Loaded Door (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A locked iron door is at the end of the hall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

The door is locked and spring loaded. When it is unlocked (Disable Device DC 30) it immediately flies open. Door (DC 18 Reflex save or take 1d6 damage and be knocked prone)

item.title: Boomerang Dagger (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
As you open the door, a dagger flies out of it!

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is opened, a dagger flies out of it. If it does not hit, it circles back like a boomerang. Dagger (+8 melee for 1d4+1 damage, if it misses, 1 round later it makes a second attack)

item.title: Delayed Fireball Door (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door opens easily after it is unlocked.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

After the door is opened, a delayed blast fireball goes off 1d4 rounds later in the doorway. Fireball (13d6 damage, DC 19 Reflex save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30 feet)

item.title: Suggestion Box (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A hidden box, full of coins is before you.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The box is full of coins. If any of them are touched, a suggestion is cast on the target, suggesting that he drop the coin and put his own money in instead, and then leave. Suggestion (DC 13 Will Save)

item.title: Campfire (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An old campsite must have been at this site.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If a fire is lit in the fire pit, it fans out in a 15' cone. Fire (1d4, DC 11 Reflex save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in 15' cone)

item.title: Rocket Barrel (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several barrels are stacked in a corner on their sides.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If any of the barrels are opened, a rocket is set off, propelling the barrel across the room. Once it hits anything, it explodes. Barrel (DC 22 Reflex save to avoid being hit, then it explodes for 4d6 damage, DC 22 Reflex save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30 ft of explosion)

item.title: Branding Lock (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A locked chest is in the back of this church.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

Anyone who doesn't worship the deity of this church that opens the lock is branded as per the spell greater brand. Brand (DC 16 Fortitude Save or take 1d6 damage and be affected as the spell)

item.title: Soundtrack (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A chest is hidden in the back of the closet, gaudily decorated with musicians and performers.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

When the chest is opened, the opener is cursed with a soundtrack. When the PC attempts actions, the soundtrack activates in the most inconvenient way possible, causing a -4 circumstance penalty on any check. For example, loud sounds will play when the PC is attempting a stealth check, or Yakity Sax will play during an intimidate check. Soundtrack (DC 17 Will Save or gain the Soundtrack) The soundtrack may be removed by dispel magic with a DC 20 caster level check)

item.title: Rug Door (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The rug in front of the door disappears underneath it.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The door is locked (DC 25 Disable Device). If opened, the rug is pulled. Rug (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall prone)

item.title: Jagged Grate (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A broken iron grate is set into the wall. With a little dexterity, it should be easily bypassed.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 17

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

Some of the ends of the broken grates are sharp and poisoned. Poisoned Grates (DC 18 Acrobatics check or take 1 point of damage, and be poisoned - DC 14 Fortitude Save or 1 Con Damage and unconscious for 1d3 hours, 1 Save for cure)

item.title: Needle Door (CR 9)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A locked wooden door is at the end of the hall.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the lock cover is opened, a needle shoots out. (DC 18 Reflex Save to avoid). The needle contains an antidote for the gas poison that fills the hallway when the lock is unlocked. Poison Gas (Burnt Othur Fumes). Anyone struck by the needle automatically makes their save. multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Tar Pits (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several tar pits are in random locations.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

At some point, lightning in the room begins to crackle in the air for 1 round, then is strikes the floor, which conducts. However, anyone standing in a tar pit is not affected. Lightning strike (5d6 electrical damage, DC 22 Reflex save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Dagger in the Face (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The rickety hut has an equally rickety door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

A dagger on a makeshift swing comes down when the door is opened. Dagger (+8 melee for 1d4 damage)

item.title: Razor Latch (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The dresser drawers can be opened by a small, recessed latch.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

When the latch is pulled, a small razor swings down. Razor (+8 melee for 1d3+1 damage)

item.title: Icy Hill and Bar (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The paved street is slick with ice.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

Anyone walking down the hill must make a DC 22 Reflex save or slide down the hill, those failing by more than 5 fall prone and slide. At the base, a bar is stretched across the road at about shin height. Bar (DC 19 Reflex Save or take 1d6 damage and fall prone if not already)

item.title: One Way Coffin (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A fancy coffin, draped in finery, sits on a table.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Anyone who opens the coffin is teleported to an identical coffin about 2 miles away and buried 6 feet underground. Teleport (DC 17 Fortitude save or be teleported) Once in the coffin, it requires a DC 33 Strength or Escape Artist check to get out of the coffin, and then 6 more successful checks to dig their way out. The PC has 1d4+1 rounds of air before suffocation rules kick in.

item.title: Sticky Walls (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The paint on the wall looks to be still wet.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 22

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If someone touches a wall, they become stuck. Sticky Walls (DC 22 Reflex save or become entangled and immobilized. As a full round action, a stuck PC may attempt a DC 22 Strength or Escape Artist check to free himself)

item.title: Saw Blade Floor (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is made from freshly cut planks.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

Halfway across the room, there are several saws in the middle of the floor. When PC's reach it, the saws spring up from the ground. Saws (+16 melee for 3d6 damage). The planks, then caught in the saws, shoot across the room, hitting anyone in the way of the entrance. Shooting Planks (4d6 damage, DC 22 Reflex save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets in 30' half radius in front of saws)

item.title: Bellows Dart (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small rug is in front of a door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The rug sits atop an air bladder. When stepped on, the air forced from it causes a single poison dart to shoot from the door. Poison Dart (+8 melee for 1d3 damage plus DC 15 Fortitude save or take 1d3 Strength damage)

item.title: Chile Powder Cloud (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door ahead is locked and swollen.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When the door is opened, several bags of chile powder puff into the air. Chile powder (DC 17 Fortitude Save or become blinded and sickened for 1d6 rounds); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Flame Thrower Peep Hole (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stout wooden door, locked and barred from this side is on the other side of the room. There is a small iron peephole that can be opened.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the peephole is looked through (note that opening does not set off the trap) they PC sees their own eye looking back at them, followed by a jet of flame. Jet of Flame (DC 21 Reflex save or become blinded until magical healing is applied)

item.title: Coconuts (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A basket hangs here, full of empty coconut halves.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Any PC that travels the pathway ahead is affected by a slow spell unless they take two coconut halves and bang them together while moving. Doing so causes them to move at half speed, but they do not gain the staggered condition.

item.title: Faerie Path (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The path ahead is unnaturally dark.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The path itself is littered with pits, and off to the side are several goblin archers. When the PC's step onto the path, they are affected as if by a faerie fire spell. As the move, they will find that if they wind through the path, the faerie fire affects them in certain places and not in others. If they wander away from the faerie fire, the PC's encounter spiked pits for every 10' of movement. Pit (DC 18 Reflex Save or fall, taking 1d6+3 damage). If they stay and follow the faerie fire path, they are targeted by 1d4 archers each turn. Archers (+8 melee for 1d8 damage)

item.title: Force Feathers (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There's an empty room ahead. Yep, empty.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PC's take any action in the room other than movement thousands of tiny, invisible force feathers wink into existence and brush the PC's. Force Feathers (DC 17 Will save or break into uncontrollable laughter, falling prone and unable to take any actions. PC's are not considered helpless); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Iron Powder Cloud (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The hallway looks as it has been scoured clean.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When the PC's get about halfway across the hallway, a fine mist sprays out from the ceiling, covering the PC's with a sticky, gooey film. Film (DC 19 Reflex Save or be covered in a sticky goo); multiple targets (all targets in hallway). Once the mist sprays out, clouds of iron powder puff out every round. Iron Powder (Those covered in the film must make a DC 24 Reflex Save or be covered by the powder. Each round adds 10 lbs to the character's encumberance, and powder comes out for each 5' of movement)

item.title: Itching Chair (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A huge wooden desk is in this room. Before it are two plush chairs.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Anyone who sits in one of the chairs must make a DC 16 Fortitude save or will begin to itch intensely in 1d4 rounds. The itching lasts one hour. While itching, the PC is at -2 to Charisma and Dexterity based skill checks.

item.title: Stagnant Water (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor is covered in a few inches of stagnant, standing water.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device -

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

The water is slightly toxic. Those waking in it must make a DC 18 Fortitude save or their feet become covered in painful blisters for 1d4-1 days. While blistered, speed is reduced by half and any movement based checks are at -4.

item.title: Lesser Hand Carpet (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The carpet down this hall is covered in patterns of hands.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If anyone moves down the hall at a speed greater than 30', the hands in the carpet animate, tripping the PC. Trip (DC 19 Reflex save or fall prone)

item.title: Burning Oil (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The hallway is interrupted by a closed portcullis.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The portcullis is locked (DC 25 Disable Device). When opened, boiling oil streams down from small holes in the ceiling. Boiling Oil (4d6 fire damage, DC 24 Reflex Save for 1d6 splash damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30' of portcullis)

item.title: Hand Carpet (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The carpet down this hall is covered in patterns of hands.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If anyone moves down the hall at a speed greater than 30', the hands in the carpet form a giant hand, which bull rushes the PC, pushing them back and out of the hall. Pushing Hand (+20 vs. CMD or be pushed back out of hall)

item.title: Greater Hand Carpet (CR 10)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The carpet down this hall is covered in patterns of hands.

Type: magical; Perception DC 34; Disable Device 34

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If anyone moves down the hall at a speed greater than 30', the hands in the carpet form a giant hand, which grabs and crushes the PC. Crush (+28 vs. CMD or PC takes 2d6+12 points of damage and is grappled, while grappled, PC automatically takes damage each round)

item.title: Poison Oak Chest (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A well oiled chest is in the corner.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

If the chest is opened, a small vial of poison oak extract expels onto the hand. Poison Oak (DC 14 Fortitude save or become itchy for 1d4 days, taking -1 to all checks)

item.title: Secret Fireplace Compartment (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A large fireplace is at one end of the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 21

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

The fireplace contains a small, hidden compartment. (DC 28 Perception). If opened, the fireplace roars to life. Fireplace (DC 22 Reflex save or take 2d6 fire damage)

item.title: Explosive Doorknob (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The doorknob is tough to turn.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the doorknob is turned, it explodes. Exploding doorknob (3d6 damage, DC 21 Reflex save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 15'). Additionally, after exploding, the door becomes stuck. (DC 28 Break check to open)

item.title: Pollen (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A fine, yellow dust covers everything in this area.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

While traveling through the area, PC's must make a DC 21 Acrobatics check each movement, or be covered in pollen. While covered in pollen, PC's become surrounded by buzzing insects each round, causing a -2 penalty to all checks.

item.title: Rolling Stair Carpet (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A carpet runner runs down the middle of the stairway.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

When someone gets halfway down the stairway, the carpet begins to roll up from the top down. Rolling carpet (DC 18 Reflex save or be knocked prone and trapped in carpet, taking 1d6 damage. A DC 18 Strength or Escape Artist check is required as a full round action to escape the carpet. While rolled up, character is helpless)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Rolling carpet made me laugh out loud. I'll try this on the party thief. I also want to see a real life version of this in action during a red-carpet Oscars awards or a theatrical premier.

item.title: Window Room(CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several windows line the walls, and a solitary, iron door leads out.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The door is stuck, and requires a DC 28 Break check to open. However, if forced open, all the windows shatter. Windows (6d6 damage plus 1d6 bleed damage, DC 27 Reflex save for half damage and no bleed damage); multiple targets (all targets in room)

item.title: Milk and Cookies (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Smoke wafts into the room from a roaring hearth. A plate of cookies and a glass of milk sits on a small table near a leather chair.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The smoke from the fire is toxic. Everyone must make a DC 18 Fortitude Save or fall unconscious in 1d4+1 rounds. Each round thereafter, they must make another DC 18 Fortitude Save or lose 1 point of Con. Once unconscious, the only way to be woken and stop losing Con is to partake of the milk and cookies, which will neutralize the poison effect and let the PC regain consciousness. However, if a PC partakes of either the milk or cookies while conscious, they must make a DC 16 Will Save or lose 1d6 Wis. Ability loss is permanent.

item.title: Happy New Year (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A grandfather clock slowly ticks down to midnight.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

As the party enters, the clock strikes midnight, causing everyone to age 1d10 years. Age (DC 24 Fortitude save or age 1d10 years); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Happy New Year (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A lighted ball slowly falls down a pole.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

As the party moves into the room, the ball strikes bottom, unleashing a flash of light. New Year (DC 24 Fortitude save or become younger by 1d100 years); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Lava Hearth (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Flames are dying down in this broad hearth.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

If the fire dies out in the hearth, lava is drawn up from below, erupting into the room. This can be averted by throwing more wood on the fire, keeping it going. Eruption (10d6 fire damage, DC 27 Reflex save for half damage); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Wisdom Clock (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This small, ornate clock rings out the hour every hour.

Type: magical; Perception DC 27; Disable Device 27

Trigger location; Reset 1/hour

Effect

The closest person to the clock when it strikes the hour takes Wisdom damage equal to the number of times the clock chimes (1 per the hour). Chime (DC 18 Will Save or take 1 to 12 Wis damage)

item.title: Blank Snowmen (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several featureless snowmen line the way.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When someone moves within 10' of a snowman, they are affected by a random affliction of blindness, deafness, or muteness, at which point the snowman gains eyes, ears or a mouth. Affliction (DC 16 Fortitude Save or become blind, deaf or mute for 1d4 days, until snowman melts)

item.title: Magnet Wall (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
At the end of the hallway, near the door, the walls have been patched on either side.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 22

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

A metal plate is embedded on in one wall, and a very powerful magnet in the other. When the door is opened, the magnet is let loose, crashing through the wall and into the metal plate just behind patching on the other side. Magnet (DC 21 Reflex save or take 3d6 damage, 4d6 if wearing metal armor. If wearing metal armor and the save is failed, the PC has a magnet stuck to them, which requires a DC 35 strength check or DC 30 Engineering check to remove from the armor, otherwise while the magnet is on the armor, the armor check penalty is increased by ab additional -2, any dex bonuses are negated, the PC is encumbered with 50 lb of weight, and AC is penalized -2)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Used a modified version of this as an inside-the-ship door trap to the captain's cabin. In a miraculous turn of horrible rolls, amazing botches, and insane neglect for each other's well being, the ship turned into a fiery tomb for one of the party members, who was still stuck to the magnet as the ship burned to the keel, while the others ate popcorn and watched. High five!

item.title: Broken Toilet Seat (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This well apportioned outhouse has fine wooden seating.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 17; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Any PC that sits down causes the seat to break. Broken Seat (DC 19 Reflex save or fall into the latrine, taking 1d6 damage and becoming covered in excrement, imparting a -4 penalty to all Charisma based checks until everything is cleaned)

item.title: Switching Statues (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several statues seem to have been placed haphazardly about this area, all in strange poses.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If anyone gets within 5' of a statue, it reaches out and touches the PC, turning the PC to stone, and becoming a flesh golem that guards the new statue, attacking anyone that gets within 10' of the new statue. Statue Attack (DC 25 Fortitude Save or become a statue) After 1d4 weeks, the flesh golem returns to statue form.

item.title: Beholder Disco Ball (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Light reflects crazily off of a turning glass ball.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The disco ball turns slowly and reflects any light sources that illuminate it. When light strikes it, one of the following effects happen:

1) Color Spray, as spell, DC 11

2) Hypnotic Pattern, as spell, DC 12

3) Rainbow Pattern, as spell, DC 15

item.title: Trapped Potion Bottles (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several potion bottles have been stashed in the back of this closet.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The potion bottles radiate a weak conjuration aura and appear to be potions of cure light wounds. However, when opened, the explode. Potion Bottle (2d6 damage, DC 16 for half damage)

item.title: Cursed Lock (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door at the end of the hall appears locked.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the door is unlocked via a DC 25 Disable Device check, the trap goes off, cursing the lock picker. Cursed Lock (DC 21 Will save or take a -8 penalty on all future Disable Device checks. The curse works as the bestow curse spell.)

item.title: Wooden Door (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A stout wooden door is at the end of the hall.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The door is stuck fast and locked. It requires a DC 35 Disable Device check to unlock the door, but even so, it is still stuck, which requires a DC 40 break check. It also has 60 hp and 8 hardness. Any object made of metal which strikes the door, like armor or a weapon is turned to wood as in the transmute metal to wood spell.

item.title: Hourglass (CR 15)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
An hourglass, in a swivel, turns over at the far end of the room. The sand begins to flow.

Type: magical; Perception DC 39; Disable Device 39

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The sand runs out in 4 rounds. If the sand runs out, everyone within 100' of the hourglass is suspended in time. They are unable to be harmed, but will be in stasis until someone comes along and resets the hourglass, where the 4 round countdown begins again.

item.title: Stareway (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The ambient light reflects sharply off of the metal staircase.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Anyone who steps onto the stairs becomes fascinated. Fascinate (DC 16 Will save or gain fascinated condition)

item.title: Crystal Ball (CR 8)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A crystal ball sits on a velvet draped table. An image can be seen within.

Type: magical; Perception DC 32; Disable Device 32

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

If the image in the crystal ball is examined, they will see a wizard going about his daily tasks. He then turns and looks directly at the viewer and wags his finger. Comatose (DC 20 Will save or become comatose for 13 days)

item.title: Rooftop Rollers (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The buildings are close. It's a small jump from rooftop to rooftop.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 26

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

Several of the rooftops have been fitting with a rolling mechanism. When landing, they roll, dumping the jumper onto the street below. Rollers (DC 23 Reflex save or fall to the ground, taking 2d6 damage and being knocked prone)

item.title: Spiky Door (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The door at the end of the hallway appears locked.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 19

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

The door is locked (Disable Device 25). If it is bashed or kicked in, the outside of the door is readily destroyed, revealing a spike-lined interior. Spikes (DC 22 Reflex save or take 1d6+3 damage plus 1 bleed damage, and become entangled, requiring a DC 22 Escape Artist, Strength or CMB check to escape)

item.title: Wall of Blades (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A vast green lawn stretches out before you.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 24; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

About halfway across the yard, a wall of blades springs from the ground. Wall of Blades (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 4d6 damage plus 1d6 bleed damage, anyone who wants to pass through the wall must make a DC 28 Acrobatics check fail, taking 1d6 bleed damage)

item.title: Carpet Bagger (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A thick carpet lays in the middle of the room. An ornate desk sits atop it.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger touch; Reset Repair

Effect

If the desk is touched, the floor underneath collapses, pinning any PC's on the carpet as they are dangling below, stuck in the rug. Carpet (DC 19 Reflex save or be pinned, requiring a DC 19 Escape Artist check to free oneself); multiple targets (all targets on rug)

item.title: Slug Trap (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The floor of this room has several small holes. The room smells of beer.

Type: magical; Perception DC 30; Disable Device 30

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Teleporter traps have been placed around the room. There is a 1 in 6 chance a single 5x5 tile contains a teleporter. If it is stepped upon, the target is teleported into a large bottle that is underground, and whose neck is exposed in a small hole in the floor. The bottle is filled with beer, and the PC is subject to drowning rules. For those in the room, they see the PC disappear, and beer sloshes out of one of the holes as it is displaced. Slug Trap (DC 22 Will save or be teleported into bottle)

item.title: Wet Cement (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Down below is a slab of cement.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The slab below is not dry, and about 2 feet deep. Anyone stepping or jumping down immediately sinks, become immobilized. Concrete (DC 17, stepping or DC 19, jumping Reflex save or become immobilized and entangled, requiring a DC 22 Strength check to escape)

item.title: Icicles (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The cavern entrance is covered in icicles.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 17

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Icicles fall on anyone entering the cave. Icicles (+12 melee for 2d6 damage +1d2 bleed damage)

item.title: Hand Door Handle (CR 2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The handle of the door is shaped like an open hand.

Type: magical; Perception DC 26; Disable Device 26

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

When the handle is touched, it clenches and electrocutes the holder. Shocking Grasp (+8, or +11 if target is wearing metal armor melee for 1d6 electrical damage)

item.title: Carp Diem (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
This pantry seems well stocked. Meat hangs from hooks, cheeses and breads line the shelves.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger touch; Reset Auto

Effect

If anyone removes food from the larder, they are cursed. Cursed (DC 22 Will Save or take -6 to any Charisma based check). Whenever the cursed PC attempts to use a Charisma based skill, a slightly ripe carp will appear on his person in plain sight. It can only be removed via the same mechanism as the spell bestow curse.

item.title: Kitchen Stairs (CR 1)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Stained wooden stairs descend into the cellar.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 19; Disable Device 18

Trigger location; Reset Auto

Effect

Years of grease and other slippery food items have spilled on and down the stairs, making it quite slick in places. Kitchen Stairs (DC 19 Reflex Save or fall to base of stairs, being knocked prone and taking 1d6 damage)

item.title: Gas-Filled Corridors (CR varies)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Several orcs converge at the end of the hall, prepared to attack!

Type: magical; Perception DC APL+20; Disable Device APL+20

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The hallways are filled with a colorless, odorless, very flammable gas. Any magical fire attack spells ignite the gas. The result is that the entire area acts as the area of effect for the spell, and everyone in it is subject to the attack.

item.title: Wire-Lined Floors (CR varies)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
The mortar between the flagstones of the floor is cracked.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC APL+20; Disable Device APL+20

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

The floor is lined with a fine wire mesh. Any electrical effects that happen transmit instantly to anyone on the floor; the area of effect of the electrical spell or effect happens to everyone.

item.title: Acid Drop (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
There is about a 7 foot drop from the bottom of the ladder to the floor.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

When someone drops off the ladder and lands underneath it, a 100-ft acid pit opens up underneath the PC. Pit (DC 21 Reflex save or take 10d6 damage, and 2d6 acid damage per round while in the acid at the bottom. It acts as the spell acid pit)

item.title: Needle Tree (CR 6)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A small tree sits on a desk in the room.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 22; Disable Device 23

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

If the desk is touched, needles from the tree spray outwards. Needles (DC 22 Reflex Save or take 1d3 damage, and then make a DC 18 Fortitude save or lose 1d6 Con); multiple targets (all targets within 30')

item.title: Should Have Gone Into The Room (CR 5)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
Through the open door, you see dozens of angry orcs.

Type: magical; Perception DC 29; Disable Device 29

Trigger location; Reset None

Effect

Any spell that targets an area or target in the room, and the line of effect travels through the open door is instantly teleported back to the caster. Oops. Door (CL 10 + 2x spell level check or spell is teleported back to caster)

item.title: Rug Under Door (CR 1/2)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A rug disappears under the door.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 18; Disable Device 16

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

A large orc is on the other side of the door. If the rug is stepped on, he pulls it. Rug (DC 17 Reflex Save or fall prone)

item.title: Glue Trap (CR 3)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A rickety bridge crosses a stream of lava.

Type: mechanical; Perception DC 21; Disable Device 24

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

A bridge crosses the river of lava at it's widest point and is 30' across. There are a few spots that are 10' across. However, the entire area, with the exception of a path that runs from the bridge on the far side, is covered in sticky glue. Sticky glue (DC 22 Strength check or become stuck and gain the entangled condition. A DC 22 Strength check is required each round to leave, and lets the target move 5' until another strength check is required)

item.title: Helping Hand Door (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A door is at the top of the stairs. A large, painted handprint is on the door.

Type: magical; Perception DC 31; Disable Device 31

Trigger touch; Reset None

Effect

If the door is opened by any means other than opening the lock (Disable Device DC 28) with the key, the hand pushes the target down the stairs. Hand (+20 vs. CMB or target is pushed down stairs, taking 2d6 damage and falling prone)

item.title: Minefield (CR 7)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A peaceful, empty field sits before the army.

Type: mechanical; Perception --; Disable Device --

Trigger location; Reset Repair

Effect

An army that moves into a minefield must make a DC 18 Leadership check to move at half speed or take a -2 penalty to its OM and DV.

item.title: Snake Sigil Journal (CR 4)
item.dc:creator: pfworks
item.content:encoded:
A journal lies on the desk.

Type: magical; Perception DC 28; Disable Device 28

Trigger visual; Reset None

Effect

If someone reads the journal, the text turns into a snake which bites the reader as the sepia snake sigil spell. Snake (DC 14 Reflex Save or become trapped for 1d4 + 5 days)
